column4: Anything you pour down your drain, sink or toilet can eventually end up in our rivers or sea! Never dispose of liquids such as oils, grease, or hazardous liquids – like paint thinners or unused paint – by pouring them down the drain. Instead, collect them in one box and dispose with the rest of your waste. Keep them all in their individual packaging, to avoid possible chemical reactions. This will also make it easier for them to be identified during waste collection. If applicable, take them to your community collection point.
column5: Tudo o que deita nos canos, pelo lava-loiça ou a sanita, pode acabar nos rios ou no mar! Nunca deite para o esgoto líquidos como óleos e gordura ou materiais perigosos, como diluentes e sobras de tintas. Coloque‑os numa caixa e ponha‑os no lixo, com os resíduos não recicláveis. Mantenha‑os na embalagem original, para evitar possíveis reacções químicas e facilitar a sua identificação pelo pessoal da recolha de lixo. Se for caso disso, leve‑os para o ponto de recolha comunitário.

column2: Don't buy timber from illegal trade!
column3: Não compre madeira ao comércio ilegal!
column4: Illegal trade in tropical timber contributes to forest destruction. Many hardware suppliers are now selling timber that has been certified as legal and sustainable. Next time you shop for wood-products, check for labels such as the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).
column5: O comércio ilegal de madeiras tropicais contribui para a destruição das florestas. Actualmente, muitos grossistas vendem madeira certificada como legal e sustentável. Na próxima vez que comprar produtos de madeira, procure rótulos como o do Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).

column2: When travelling to exotic places, choose your souvenirs carefully.
column3: Quando viajar para locais exóticos, escolha com cuidado as lembranças que trouxer.
column4: Trade in items such as woodcarvings, red coral or ornaments with fur or feathers, is often regulated and permits are required to bring them home. Check the rules, as there are strict laws governing exports of wildlife and you could risk having your souvenir confiscated.
column5: O comércio de esculturas de madeira, coral vermelho ou ornamentos com peles e penas é muitas vezes ilegal, e é preciso uma autorização especial para os trazer. Informe‑se, porquanto há leis rigorosas para proteger a fauna e a flora selvagens, e esses objectos podem ser‑lhe confiscados.

column2: Be creative and design a wildlife area in your garden!
column3: Seja criativo e reserve uma zona do seu jardim à vida selvagem!
column4: In addition to creating a natural haven for you and your family, it will attract butterflies and also provide cover for frogs, mammals and insects.
column5: Para além de criar um refúgio natural para si e para a sua família, atrairá borboletas e dará protecção a rãs, pequenos mamíferos e insectos.

column2: Support your national parks!
column3: Apoie os parques nacionais!
column4: Visit nature reserves and parks to show support for their creation, preservation and even their expansion. Remember to leave these areas as you found them.
column5: Visite reservas e parques naturais para demonstrar que apoia a sua criação, preservação e até mesmo a sua expansão. Não esqueça que deve deixar esses espaços tal como os encontrou.

column2: Conserve water by letting your lawn grow longer.
column3: Poupe água deixando a relva crescer um pouco mais.
column4: Let the grass grow higher and thus encourage root growth. It will also allow the grass to self-seed. If you mow a path in the middle, it will show that it is indeed meant to be that way as opposed to being neglected.
column5: Deixe a relva crescer mais, para favorecer o crescimento das raízes e permitir a sua renovação. Se abrir um carreiro no meio, perceber‑se‑á que foi intencional e não por negligência.

column2: A rotting log is a mini nature reserve in its own right!
column3: Um toro apodrecido é uma verdadeira mini-reserva natural!
column4: By removing dead or dying trees from woodland, a section of the natural nutrient-cycle can be lost. A lack of dead wood reduces species diversity by about 20 %. Avoid removing dead wood from your property. You could be doing away with thousands of invertebrate species and fungi.
column5: Se retirar as árvores mortas ou quase mortas dos bosques, pode perder‑se uma parte do ciclo nutricional natural. A falta de madeira morta reduz a diversidade de espécie em cerca de 20%. Evite retirar madeira morta da sua propriedade. Pode estar a destruir milhares de espécies de invertebrados e de fungos.

column2: To prevent soil erosion, plant vegetation with complementary root systems.
column3: Para evitar a erosão do solo, plante vegetação com sistemas radiculares complementares.
column4: Some examples include lavender that have deep roots, which form a dense network that stabilises the soil.
column5: Um bom exemplo disto é a lavanda, que, com as suas raízes profundas, forma uma rede densa que ajuda a estabilizar o solo.

column2: From a distance…
column3: À distância...
column4: Appreciate wildlife, but be sure to watch wild animals from a distance and avoid feeding them. Remember, the scent you leave when you touch a nest or a lair may scare the parents off for good. Instead of touching, try to find out more about them and maybe even discover how you can contribute to their protection.
column5: Aprecie a fauna selvagem, mas observe os animais à distância e evite alimentá-los. Lembre‑se que o odor que deixa quando mexe num ninho ou numa toca pode afastar de vez os progenitores. Em vez de tocar nos animais, procure informar‑se sobre eles e talvez até descobrir como pode ajudar a protegê-los.

column2: Take part in the next census of birds in your country.
column3: Participe no próximo recenseamento de aves no seu país.
column4: In addition to making a valuable contribution to the national bird survey, you can learn how to recognise wrens, robins and will also spend a day outdoors.
column5: Para além de dar um precioso contributo para o levantamento nacional de aves, poderá aprender a reconhecer as carriças e os piscos, além de passar um dia ao ar livre.

column2: When on a hiking trip do not leave anything behind, especially litter.
column3: Quando fizer uma caminhada a pé, não deixe ficar nada, principalmente lixo.
column4: If you come across anything that others have left behind, act responsibly and pick it up.
column5: Se encontrar alguma coisa que outros tenham deixado, seja responsável e recolha-a.

column2: Where you can, choose organically farmed fish such as sea bass, salmon and trout.
column3: Sempre que puder, compre peixe de aquicultura biológica (por exemplo, perca, salmão, truta).
column4: Non-organic fish uses large quantities of chemicals and antibiotics which can affect other animals in the food chain. It is also worth bearing in mind that to produce a 3 kg farmed salmon, 15 kg of fish are caught in the wild to provide its meal and oil.
column5: Os peixes que não são criados de forma biológica usam grandes quantidades de substâncias químicas e antibióticos, que podem afectar outros animais da cadeia alimentar. Importa também não esquecer que, para produzir em viveiro um salmão de 3 kg, são capturados 15 kg de outros peixes para produzir farinha e óleo.

column2: Welcome a newborn in your family by planting a tree.
column3: Saúde um nascimento na família plantando uma árvore.
column4: In addition to creating a happy memory, this tree will give you shade, create a small ecosystem and produce oxygen.
column5: Para além de recordar tempos felizes, essa árvore dará sombra, criará um pequeno ecossistema e produzirá oxigénio.

column2: Find out about the special flora and fauna in your area.
column3: Informe-se sobre a flora e a fauna específicas da sua zona.
column4: Threatened and endangered species can be found in all kinds of ecosystems, big and small. Learn what kinds of species are listed as endangered in your area and commit to assisting in the preservation of their habitat.
column5: Há espécies ameaçadas e em risco de extinção em todos os tipos de ecossistemas, grandes e pequenos. Saiba quais as espécies da sua zona que estão em risco e esforce-se por ajudar a preservar o seu habitat.

column2: If on holidays by a tropical lagoon or coral reef, avoid touching or stepping on corals.
column3: Se estiver de férias numa lagoa tropical ou num recife de corais, evite pisar ou tocar nos corais.
column4: When diving, do not break off a branch of coral to take home as a souvenir. Coral reefs are precious and they are disappearing
column5: Ao praticar mergulho, não parta um ramo de coral para levar para casa como recordação. Os recifes de coral são preciosos e estão a desaparecer.

column2: Create a small ecosystem
column3: Crie um pequeno ecossistema
column4: in your garden or park by piling up some logs in a secluded corner. These will provide shelter for hedgehogs, frogs and toads. If you half-bury the bottom logs in the soil, you will also encourage stag beetles as they are fond of rotten wood. A pile of stones will also provide shelter to a range of insects and spiders.
column5: no seu jardim ou parque, amontoando alguns toros num canto tranquilo. Servirão de abrigo a ouriços-cacheiros, rãs e sapos. Se enterrar parcialmente os toros, vai atrair certos escaravelhos que gostam de madeira apodrecida. Um monte de pedras também servirá de abrigo a uma série de insectos e aranhas.

column2: Did you know?
column3: Sabia que...
column4: Certain non-recyclable paper products (such as tissues, napkins, and egg cartons) can be added to your compost. Their fibres will aerate the compost and help the organisms that encourage decomposition.
column5: Também pode deitar no seu depósito de compostagem artigos de papel não recicláveis (lenços e guardanapos, e as caixas de ovos). As fibras do papel vão arejar o composto e ajudar os microrganismos que estimulam a decomposição.

column2: Choose your pet carefully and think before buying an exotic animal
column3: Escolha bem o seu animal de estimação e pense duas vezes antes de comprar um animal exótico.
column4: Reptiles, birds and fish are often taken from their natural habitats. The black market for exotic pets has devastated entire populations of species, and it is still the fastest growing sector in the pet market.
column5: Répteis, aves e peixes são muitas vezes retirados do seu habitat natural. O mercado negro de animais exóticos já destruiu populações inteiras de algumas espécies e continua a ser o mercado de animais de estimação que cresce mais depressa.

column2: If you're up for an unusual holiday, why not volunteer for nature conservation?
column3: Se tem vontade de fazer umas férias diferentes, por que não se oferece como voluntário para a conservação da natureza?
column4: Many travel companies offer such trips. It will give you the opportunity to work with passionate people and to do something positive in support of an environmental cause.
column5: Muitas agências de viagem propõem viagens desse tipo. Terá a oportunidade de trabalhar com pessoas apaixonadas e de fazer algo positivo em prol do ambiente.

column2: Grow your own vegetable garden or just a few in window boxes.
column3: Cultive uma horta, nem que seja em floreiras.
column4: You'll enjoy tasty and fresh vegetables free of pesticides.
column5: Vai gostar de comer legumes saborosos e frescos sem pesticidas.

column2: Help to clean up your surroundings.
column3: Ajude a limpar o seu bairro e arredores.
column4: Each year on World Environment Day, schools and environmental organisations worldwide organise clean up operations. Join one! In addition to enriching the landscape of your neighbourhood, you will learn more about the animals and plants that live nearby.
column5: Todos os anos, no Dia Mundial do Ambiente, as escolas e as organizações de defesa do ambiente organizam acções de limpeza, em todo o mundo. Adira a uma! Além de melhorar a paisagem do seu bairro, aprenderá coisas sobre os animais e plantas que lá vivem.

column2: Looking to add new plants to your garden?
column3: Quer pôr plantas novas no seu jardim?
column4: Be careful when buying for your garden. People are one of the main introducers of invasive species, especially flora. Many of the invasive species have been introduced for ornamental purposes. Do put an extra effort in finding out whether the plant you want is native to your environment.
column5: Tenha cuidado quando comprar plantas para o seu jardim. As pessoas são um dos principais responsáveis pela introdução de espécies invasivas, especialmente da flora. Muitas espécies invasivas foram introduzidas para fins ornamentais. Procure saber se a planta que quer é indígena do seu ambiente.

column2: Buy locally-produced fresh produce
column3: Compre produtos frescos locais
column4: either directly from the farmer or at a local fruit and vegetable market. Seasonal food is good for you and the environment. Cutting the number of kilometres your food has travelled and avoiding packaging reduces pollution and waste.
column5: directamente ao produtor ou num mercado de frutas e legumes local. Os alimentos sazonais são bons para si e para o ambiente. Reduzindo as embalagens e o número de quilómetros que os alimentos percorrem, diminui-se a poluição e os resíduos.

column2: Where possible, switch to organic food!
column3: Se possível, coma alimentos biológicos!
column4: Organic food production uses no synthetic pesticides, produces slightly less greenhouse gases and usually leaves more room for biodiversity in agricultural areas.
column5: A produção de alimentos biológicos não utiliza pesticidas sintéticos, produz um pouco menos gases com efeito de estufa e, normalmente, é mais favorável à biodiversidade nas zonas agrícolas.

column2: Eat meat in moderation!
column3: Não coma muita carne!
column4: If you're a meat eater, consider reducing your meat consumption and going for quality rather than quantity. Production of meat consumes enormous amounts of energy, not only for the growth and transport of animal feed, but also for the heating, air conditioning, and lighting of the immense animal farms. Changing to a diet with less meat helps the environment, but is also good for your health. It is best to buy meat from local producers and buy organic too.
column5: Se come carne regularmente, considere a possibilidade de reduzir o seu consumo de carne e de preferir a qualidade à quantidade. A produção de carne consome quantidades enormes de energia, não só para o cultivo e o transporte de forragens, mas também para o aquecimento, a climatização e a iluminação das enormes explorações pecuárias. Optar por um regime alimentar com menos carne não só ajuda o ambiente como é bom para a sua saúde. Também é preferível comprar carne aos produtores locais e, se possível, biológica.

column2: Disposable napkins are often given out for free but this is no reason to waste them.
column3: Os guardanapos de papel são gratuitos nos cafés e restaurantes, mas isso não é razão para os desperdiçar.
column4: Instead of taking a handful, one or two should be more than enough. Be reasonable and trees will thank you for it!
column5: Em vez de tirar um monte, 1 ou 2 são mais do que suficientes. Seja moderado – as árvores agradecem-lhe!

column2: Eat fruit and vegetables that are in season.
column3: Coma frutos e legumes da época.
column4: They taste better, are healthier for you, and their cultivation has less impact on the environment.
column5: Sabem melhor, são mais saudáveis e o seu cultivo afecta menos o ambiente.

column2: Consider your dairy consumption.
column3: Avalie o seu consumo de produtos lácteos.
column4: The production of butter, cheese and other dairy products with high fat content accounts for high greenhouse gas emissions as well as for eutrophication of groundwater, rivers and seas. Remember: Globally, around 70 % of all agricultural land is used for livestock production.
column5: A produção de manteiga, queijo e outros produtos com um elevado teor de gordura é responsável por elevadas emissões de gases com efeito de estufa, bem como pela eutrofização de águas subterrâneas, rios e mares. Lembre-se: em todo o mundo, cerca de 70% das terras agrícolas são utilizadas para a produção pecuária.

column2: Invest in a lunch box.
column3: Invista numa lancheira.
column4: If needed use cling film and paper instead of aluminium foil when you prepare your lunch. Reducing the amount of materials you use will reduce the amount of rubbish you throw away and this is good news for the environment!
column5: Se necessitar, use película aderente e papel em vez de folha de alumínio. Reduzindo a quantidade de materiais utilizados, diminui o volume de resíduos que deita fora, e isso é bom para o ambiente!

column2: Don't start a washing machine unless it is fully loaded with laundry or dishes.
column3: Use a máquina de lavar apenas quando esta estiver cheia de roupa ou de louça.
column4: Its energy and water consumption will be the same whether it's full or empty so you might as well optimise its cycle.
column5: O consumo de energia e de água é o mesmo quer esteja cheia ou vazia, por isso, o melhor é tirar o máximo partido do seu ciclo.

column2: Let your hot food cool down before putting it in the refrigerator
column3: Arrefeça sempre os alimentos quentes antes de os pôr no frigorífico
column4: and defrost food from the freezer in the fridge. Both will save you money on your energy bill. Also, remember to keep the fridge door open for only as long as you need it.
column5: e descongele os alimentos que retira do congelador no frigorífico. Assim, poupa dinheiro na factura da electricidade. Além disso, mantenha a porta do frigorífico aberta o mínimo tempo possível.

column2: Take a shower rather than a bath!
column3: Tome duche em vez de banho de imersão!
column4: This way you can cut your water consumption by a third! Pause the water flow when soaping and avoid long showers. A shower uses about 30 to 80 litres, while a bath uses 150 to 200 litres of precious water. Install low-flow shower heads and think before buying a power shower.
column5: Assim, gastará só um terço da água! Feche a água enquanto se ensaboa e evite duches demorados. Um duche consome 30 a 80 litros, enquanto um banho de imersão gasta 150 a 200 litros de preciosa água. Instale crivos de chuveiro de baixo fluxo e pense duas vezes antes de comprar um duche de massagem.

column2: Got lime scale to remove?
column3: Tem de remover calcário?
column4: Instead of chemical products, try using vinegar to remove lime scale from tiles, taps, kettles and irons.
column5: Em vez de produtos químicos, experimente usar vinagre para remover o calcário dos azulejos, torneiras, cafeteiras e ferros de engomar.

column2: Buy eco-friendly dishwashing detergent.
column3: Compre detergentes para a louça amigos do ambiente.
column4: It is largely biodegradable, less polluting to aquatic habitats and just as effective a cleaning agent as less environmentally friendly options. Look for eco-friendly dishwashing detergents, such as those labelled with the European flower eco-label (see www.eco-label.com to find one in your country).
column5: É altamente biodegradável, menos poluente dos habitats aquáticos e um agente de limpeza tão eficaz como outros menos compatíveis com o ambiente. Procure detergentes para a louça compatíveis com o ambiente, como os que ostentam a flor do rótulo ecológico europeu (consulte www.eco-label.com para encontrar um que esteja à venda no seu país).

column2: Planning to renovate your house or apartment?
column3: Vai renovar a sua casa?
column4: Look for ways to reduce the energy consumption for heating and cooling, for example by sealing windows and doors, insulation or changing the windows. Today it is possible to build ‘carbon neutral’ houses.
column5: Procure formas de reduzir o consumo de energia para aquecimento e arrefecimento, por exemplo, calafetando portas e janelas, melhorando o isolamento ou mudando as janelas. Hoje, já é possível construir casas “neutras em termos de carbono”.

column2: In the market for a new printer?
column3: Quer comprar uma impressora nova?
column4: When buying a new printer consider one that allows ink cartridges to be refilled with rechargeable kits. It is very cost effective and environmentally friendly. If this is not applicable to your printer remember to recycle your used cartridges by returning them to the shop where you buy the new ones.
column5: Quando for comprar uma impressora nova, pense em comprar uma cujos tinteiros possam voltar a ser cheios com conjuntos recarregáveis. Sai muito mais barato e ajuda o ambiente. Se não for possível reutilizar os tinteiros da sua impressora, recicle os tinteiros usados, entregando‑os na loja em que comprar os novos.

column2: Invest in rechargeable batteries instead of buying disposable ones.
column3: Compre pilhas recarregáveis em vez de pilhas normais.
column4: You will save money in the long term. You can also buy solar powered rechargers if you want to reduce your environmental impact even further.
column5: Com o tempo, acaba por poupar dinheiro. Se quiser reduzir ainda mais o seu impacto no ambiente, pode comprar carregadores a energia solar.

column2: Say no to disposable products!
column3: Diga não aos produtos descartáveis!
column4: We're using an increasing number of one-use products such as plastic razors, cups, paper towels, wipes, nappies, plastic bags, paper napkins and even disposable cameras to name a few. Not only do they usually cost more in the long-run, they involve the consumption of more resources and energy than their reusable alternatives.
column5: Usamos cada vez mais produtos descartáveis – máquinas de barbear de plástico, copos de plástico, papel de cozinha, lenços de papel, fraldas, sacos de plástico, guardanapos de papel e até máquinas fotográficas descartáveis, só para nomear alguns. Não só custam mais a longo prazo, como implicam o consumo de mais recursos e energia do que os reutilizáveis.

column2: When shopping for new electronics, favour products with low energy use.
column3: Quando comprar produtos electrónicos, prefira produtos que consumam pouca energia.
column4: You can use energy labels (A++, A+, A, B) for guidance, and for office electronics the Energy Star label. In the long-run, they will save you money on your electricity bill. To find out what products are included, go to EU's website: www.eu-energystar.org.
column5: Pode orientar‑se pelos rótulos energéticos (A++, A+, A, B) e, no caso do material electrónico de escritório, pelo rótulo "Energy Star". A longo prazo, poupa dinheiro na factura da electricidade. Para saber que produtos estão incluídos, consulte o sítio Web da UE: www.eu-energystar.org.

column2: Close the loop!
column3: Feche o círculo!
column4: Purchase products made from recycled materials. Who else should buy all the products made from the stuff you throw into the recycling bins?
column5: Compre produtos feitos de materiais reciclados. Senão, quem há‑de comprar os produtos feitos daquilo que deita para os caixotes de reciclagem?

column2: When preparing a good meal, buy Fairtrade!
column3: Para preparar uma boa refeição, compre produtos do comércio justo!
column4: Fairtrade ensures Southern producers get their fair share. There are also many products which are certified Fairtrade and organic at the same time.
column5: O comércio justo garante que os produtores do Sul recebem o que lhes é devido. Há muitos produtos que são certificados, simultaneamente, como comércio justo e biológicos.

column2: Don't forget about your local shops.
column3: Não esqueça o comércio tradicional.
column4: New supermarkets in the area can reduce business for smaller shops. Pollution and congestion would be significantly less if consumers frequented their local shops, rather than travelling long distances to out-of-town shopping centres.
column5: As grandes superfícies que vão abrindo podem reduzir o volume de negócios do comércio local. A poluição e a congestão podem ser significativamente reduzidas se os consumidores frequentarem o comércio local em vez de percorrerem grandes distâncias até centros comerciais situados fora dos centros urbanos.

column2: Buy lasting potted flowers!
column3: Compre flores envasadas!
column4: When the urge to give flowers takes you, choose a potted plant from a local supplier. A lot of exotic flowers are grown in greenhouses great distances away. Aside from the issue of transport, there can be high social and environmental costs. For example, in Colombia, the flower industry uses enormous quantities of polluting pesticides, and in Kenya, horticulture requires a lot of water which reduces local water resources. As an alternative ask your flower shop for Fairtrade or organically produced flowers.
column5: Quando lhe apetecer muito oferecer flores, ofereça uma planta envasada de um fornecedor local. Muitas flores exóticas são cultivadas em estufas, a grande distância. Para além do problema do transporte, podem ter elevados custos sociais e ambientais. Por exemplo, na Colômbia, a floricultura usa grandes quantidades de pesticidas poluentes e, no Quénia, a horticultura consume muita água, reduzindo os recursos hídricos locais. Em alternativa, peça ao seu florista flores do comércio justo ou biológicas.

column2: Buy your music as electronic files online and pollute less!
column3: Compre a sua música sob a forma de ficheiros electrónicos em linha e reduza a poluição!
column4: You will save a trip to the music store as well as reducing the use of CDs, plastic boxes, packaging and transportation, not to mention some money.
column5: Poupa uma ida à loja de discos e economiza em CD, caixas e embalagens de plástico e transportes, para não falar no dinheiro.

column2: Buy what you need and not what you want!
column3: Compre aquilo de que necessita e não o que lhe apetece!
column4: If everyone on earth lived a European lifestyle, we would need three planets to supply all the resources. Do not fall into the trap of consumerism and make a shopping list of items you need rather than picking up unnecessary items that you think you need. This will also save you money.
column5: Se todos os habitantes do planeta tivessem o estilo de vida europeu, precisaríamos de três planetas para fornecer todos os recursos necessários. Não caia na armadilha do consumismo. Faça uma lista das compras necessárias e não compre coisas desnecessárias. Assim, também poupa dinheiro.

column2: Upgrade your computer!
column3: Actualize o seu computador!
column4: The EEA has upgraded their office PCs with additional memory space. This way, the life-time of the computers was extended by another two years and avoided a lot of electronic waste.
column5: A EEA melhorou os computadores dos seus escritórios, adicionando‑lhes mais memória. Deste modo, a vida útil dos computadores foi prolongada por mais dois anos e evitaram‑se muitos resíduos electrónicos.

column2: Dispose medical waste properly!
column3: Elimine convenientemente os resíduos médicos!
column4: Landfills or sewage systems are not the place for old medication. Instead, dispose them at designated disposal stations or take them back to your pharmacist.
column5: Os aterros ou as redes de esgotos não são o lugar indicado para medicamentos antigos. Estes medicamentos devem ser colocados em pontos de recolha ou entregues na farmácia.

column2: Don't throw away your printer cartridges.
column3: Não deite fora os cartuchos da sua impressora.
column4: Instead, recycle them! Most office supply stores make it possible to turn in your old, used cartridges when buying new ones.
column5: Recicle‑os antes! A maior parte das lojas de material de escritório aceitam os seus tinteiros usados na compra de novos.

column2: Got bulky waste to dispose of?
column3: Tem de se desembaraçar de resíduos volumosos?
column4: When you'd like to get rid of large waste items, take it to a drop-off centre or contact a special company to come and pick it up. The professionals will segregate and possibly recycle your waste. Some products, including refrigerators and other electric appliances, have to be recycled properly not to pollute the environment. You can also use the internet or newspapers to sell goods which still have some value.
column5: Quando se quiser desembaraçar de artigos volumosos, leve‑os para um centro de recolha ou contacte uma empresa especializada para os vir recolher. Os profissionais dividem e, possivelmente, reciclam o seu lixo. Alguns produtos, incluindo frigoríficos e outros electrodomésticos, têm de ser convenientemente reciclados, para não poluírem o ambiente. Também pode recorrer à Internet ou aos jornais para vender artigos que ainda tenham algum valor.

column2: When the time comes to change your car battery, recycle your old one.
column3: Quando tiver de mudar a bateria do seu carro, recicle a sua bateria velha.
column4: Check with your local authorities for their advice as they might recommend that you take it to a special disposal site, or to a garage which collects them for recycling and proper disposal.
column5: Aconselhe‑se junto das autoridades locais, que lhe poderão recomendar um local de depósito especial ou uma garagem que os recolha para reciclagem e eliminação adequadas.

column2: Dispose of toxic materials properly!
column3: Elimine conveniente os materiais tóxicos!
column4: The best way to dispose of paint is to deliver it to your local specialist waste recycling centre. If you do not have access to one of these, let the paint dry fully, adding sawdust or cat litter as needed, before putting it in the dustbin. Don't throw it down the drain, because it is toxic and it interferes with the processes of water treatment plants.
column5: A melhor forma de se desembaraçar de tintas é entregá‑las ao centro de reciclagem de resíduos especializado local. Se não tem acesso a um destes centros, deixe a tinta secar completamente, adicionando‑lhe, se necessário, serradura ou areia para gatos, antes de a deitar no caixote do lixo. Não a deite para o esgoto, porque é tóxica e interfere com os processos das estações de tratamento de águas residuais (ETAR).

column2: Dripping oil?
column3: A pingar óleo?
column4: Did you know that most of oil pollution in our oceans is the result of human activity on land and not tanker spills? If you notice oil leaking from your car, fix it right away! Never dispose of used oil into a storm drain.
column5: Sabia que a maior parte da poluição por hidrocarbonetos dos oceanos é resultado da actividade humana em terra e não de derrames de petroleiros? Se vir que o seu carro está a perder óleo, repare‑o imediatamente! Nunca deite óleo usado num colector de águas pluviais.

column2: Think twice before buying more toys for your children.
column3: Pense duas vezes antes de comprar mais brinquedos aos seus filhos.
column4: Many of them are used only very shortly and then thrown away. Go for high-quality, long-lasting toys that can be used by several generations of children. Selling old toys on a flea market can give your toys a second life and can be much fun for you and the kids.
column5: Muitos são usados muito pouco tempo e depois deitados fora. Prefira brinquedos de alta qualidade e duradouros, que possam ser utilizados por diversas gerações de crianças. Se vender os brinquedos velhos na feira da ladra, está a dar‑lhes uma segunda vida, para além de se divertir com os seus filhos.

column2: Get in shape and be friendly to the environment all at once!
column3: Ponha-se em forma e seja amigo do ambiente ao mesmo tempo!
column4: Journeys of less than 3 km may take less time if you walk, use a bike or even take the bus. If taking your kids along, try using a skateboard, skipping rope, rollerblades or buggy boards! Remember how much fun it was when you were a kid.
column5: Trajectos de menos de 3 km são mais rápidos a pé, de bicicleta ou até de autocarro. Se os seus filhos forem consigo, use um skate, uma corda de saltar, uns patins ou buggy boards! Lembre-se como se divertia quando era miúdo.

column2: Walk or cycle: Set a good example!
column3: Dê um bom exemplo!
column4: Walk or cycle to your work as much as it is possible and you’ll set your kids a good example. Encourage them to walk, cycle or take the bus when going to and from school each day! Both their health and the environment will benefit.
column5: Se possível, vá para o trabalho a pé ou de bicicleta e dará um bom exemplo aos seus filhos. Incentive‑os a ir a pé, de bicicleta ou de autocarro para a escola todos os dias! É bom para a saúde deles e para o ambiente.

column2: Car pool!
column3: Partilhe o automóvel!
column4: If you live far away from school, instead of driving your kids to and from school each day, start a car pooling initiative with the other parents and share the responsibility. It will save you time, petrol and help the environment.
column5: Se vive muito longe da escola, em vez de os ir levar e buscar de carro todos os dias, organize a partilha de automóveis com outros pais e assumam conjuntamente a responsabilidade. Poupa tempo e gasolina, e é bom para o ambiente!

column2: Keep your tyres properly inflated.
column3: Verifique regularmente a pressão dos pneus.
column4: This will reduce wear and tear on them and increase their longevity, thereby saving money. It also saves precious raw material: it takes 27 litres of crude oil to produce a new tire. Under-inflated tyres also increase fuel consumption by up to 10%. Check your tyres at least once a month. It takes but a few minutes.
column5: Reduz o desgaste e aumenta a sua longevidade, e assim poupa dinheiro. Também permite poupar matérias‑primas preciosas: para produzir um pneu novo, são precisos 27 litros de petróleo bruto. Os pneus com pouca pressão aumentam o consumo de combustível em 10%. Verifique a pressão dos pneus pelo menos uma vez por mês. Só precisa de alguns minutos para o fazer.

column2: Share your automobile!
column3: Partilhe o seu automóvel!
column4: If you have to use a car to get to work, sign up to a car sharing scheme.
column5: Se precisa de usar o carro para ir para trabalho, procure partilhá‑lo.

column2: Slow down!
column3: Abrande!
column4: When driving your car, drive steadily and anticipate what is coming up. Avoid rapid accelerations and breaking as much as possible. This will decrease your car’s fuel consumption.
column5: Conduza de forma constante e preveja o que tem de fazer. Evite, tanto quanto possível, acelerações e travagens bruscas, e reduzirá o consumo de combustível do seu automóvel.

column2: Have your oil changed by a professional.
column3: Recorra a um profissional para mudar o óleo do seu carro.
column4: Take your car to a garage to have the oil changed. They will collect the used oil and recycle it.
column5: Leve o carro a uma oficina para mudar o óleo. As oficinas recolhem e reciclam o óleo usado.

column2: If travelling by plane, off-set your CO2 emissions.
column3: Se viajar de avião, compense as emissões de CO2.
column4: Many airlines and travel agencies offer carbon-credit schemes in their services.
column5: Muitas companhias aéreas e agências de viagem propõem programas de créditos de carbono.

column2: Innovate!
column3: Inove!
column4: Encourage your workplace to develop a sustainable transport policy for business trips. You can buy carbon credits to off-set flights, minimise physical meetings involving travel by using conference or video-calls or take a sleeper train instead of flying.
column5: Incite a sua entidade patronal a desenvolver uma política de transportes sustentável para as deslocações de serviço. Pode comprar créditos de carbono para compensar voos, reduzir ao mínimo as reuniões que impliquem deslocações, substituindo‑as por videoconferências ou videochamadas, ou substituir o avião pelo comboio nocturno.

column2: Save paper by setting your printer to print double sided by default.
column3: Poupe papel, programando a sua impressora para imprimir de ambos os lados.
column4: You can also print two pages per page if it remains legible. The EEA has introduced double-side default printing, which reduced the Agency’s paper consumption by around 17 % from 2004 to 2005.
column5: Também pode imprimir duas páginas por página, se o documento for legível. Na EEA, as páginas são sistematicamente impressas do dois lados, iniciativa que, de 2004 para 2005, reduziu o consumo de papel da Agência em cerca de 17%.

column2: Turn the heat down!
column3: Baixe o aquecimento!
column4: Comfortable room temperature is 19 °C, but 15 °C is just perfect for bedrooms, as it can help you sleep better. Remember to turn the heating off if you're leaving for the holidays!
column5: 19º é uma temperatura confortável para uma sala, mas 15º é uma boa temperatura para quartos, que o ajuda a dormir melhor. Não se esqueça de desligar o aquecimento antes de ir de férias!

column2: To save on your domestic energy consumption,
column3: Para reduzir o seu consumo de energia doméstico,
column4: make your radiators more efficient by placing reflective panels or sheets of aluminum foil behind them as this will bounce the heat back into the room.
column5: aumente a eficácia dos seus radiadores colocando painéis reflectores ou folhas de alumínio atrás deles, para dirigir o calor para a sala.

column2: Do not position your fridge or freezer near a heat source,
column3: Não instale o seu frigorífico ou congelador próximo de uma fonte de calor,
column4: such as a stove or radiator, or even a south-facing window, as it will lead to increased electricity consumption.
column5: como uma estufa ou um radiador, ou até uma janela virada a Sul, porque isto aumenta o consumo de electricidade.

column2: If you own an old refrigerator and freezer,
column3: Se tiver um frigorífico/congelador,
column4: defrost them at least every six months. Even better –  replace them with new models, which have automatic defrost cycles and are generally up to twice more energy-efficient.
column5: descongele‑os, pelo menos, de seis em seis meses. Melhor ainda – substitua‑os por modelos novos, com ciclos de descongelação automáticos e até duas vezes mais eficazes em termos energéticos.

column2: Turn down your hot water thermostat
column3: Baixe o termóstato de água quente
column4: – it doesn't need to be set higher than 60 ºC. The same goes for the boiler of your central heating. Remember, 70 % of the energy used by households in the EU is spent on heating homes and another 14 % – on heating water.
column5: ‑ não precisa de estar a mais de 60º C. O mesmo se aplica à caldeira do seu aquecimento central. Não se esqueça que 70% da energia consumida pelas famílias da UE são gastos no aquecimento das casas e 14% no aquecimento de água.

column2: Don't forget to switch off the lights.
column3: Não se esqueça de apagar as luzes.
column4: Switching off five lights in hallways and rooms in your house – when you don't need them – can save around EUR 60 a year! This prevents the release of approximately 400 kg of CO2 gas in one year.
column5: Se apagar as luzes de que não está a precisar na sua casa pode poupar cerca de 60 euros por ano! Isto evita a libertação de cerca de 400 kg de CO2 num ano.

column2: Don't forget to unplug your battery chargers
column3: Não se esqueça de desligar os carregadores de pilhas
column4: after you've finished charging your mobile phone or laptop. If left plugged in, they continue to consume energy.
column5: quando acabar de carregar o telemóvel ou computador portátil. Se o deixar ligado, continua a consumir energia.

column2: Try to cool off without resorting to air conditioning.
column3: Procure refrescar‑se sem ligar o ar condicionado.
column4: The use of A/C can increase your electricity bill by 33 %. A fan requires one tenth of the energy used by an A/C system; sunshades, blinds, shutters and the cool of the night use no energy at all.
column5: O ar condicionado pode aumentar a sua factura de electricidade em 33%. Uma ventoinha consume um décimo da energia de um sistema de ar condicionado; chapéus de sol, estores, portadas e a frescura da noite não consumem energia.

column2: If you can, change your electricity supplier,
column3: Se puder, mude de fornecedor de electricidade,
column4: switch over to the one that offers part of your energy supply from renewable sources. It will send the right message to energy companies.
column5: escolha o que oferece parte da energia obtida a partir de fontes renováveis. Assim, está a transmitir a mensagem certa à empresas de energia.

column2: Put a lid on your pots when cooking.
column3: Quando cozinha, tape os tachos.
column4: You can save up to a quarter of the energy needed for preparing the dish. Pressure cookers and steamers are even better: they can save around 70 %!
column5: Pode poupar até um quarto da energia necessária para confeccionar o prato. A panela de pressão e as panelas a vapor ainda são melhores: podem poupar cerca de 70%!

column2: Our waste can produce lighting,
column3: Os nossos resíduos podem iluminar‑nos,
column4: electricity, heat and even jobs!  Remember to recycle what you no longer need.
column5: electricidade, calor e até empregos!  Não deixe de reciclar aquilo de que já não precisa.

column2: Get on the move and cycle, walk or use public transport!
column3: Mexa‑se e pedale, ande a pé ou use transportes públicos!
column4: You'll improve your health and lessen your impact on the environment. Remember that for each litre of fuel burnt in a car engine, more than 2.5 kg of CO2 is released into the atmosphere.
column5: É bom para a saúde e reduz o seu impacto no ambiente. Não esqueça que por cada litro de combustível queimado no motor de um carro são libertados na atmosfera mais de 2,5 kg de CO2.

column2: Lonely drive to work?
column3: A caminho do trabalho sozinho?
column4: Car-pooling with your colleagues will lessen your impact on the environment, save you money and let you travel in the company of others.  Ask which of your colleagues live nearby and take turns driving to work.
column5: Se partilhar o automóvel com os seus colegas, reduz o seu impacto no ambiente, poupa dinheiro e viaja acompanhado.  Saiba quais os colegas que vivem perto de si e revezem‑se a levar o carro.

column2: Buying a new car?
column3: Carro novo?
column4: Why not buy one of the new generation vehicles?  A hybrid car consumes between 20 % and 30 % less fuel and generates far less CO2 than a classical vehicle. So why not pollute less and save money – all at once?
column5: Porque não comprar um automóvel de nova geração?  O carro híbrido consome entre 20% e 30% menos combustível e gera muito menos CO2 do que um veículo clássico. Então, porque não poluir menos e poupar dinheiro ao mesmo tempo?

column2: During cold winter days, don’t warm up your car's engine while idle.
column3: Nos dias frios de Inverno, não aqueça o motor do carro com este parado.
column4: It's safe to start the journey with a cold engine, and you will save on fuel.
column5: É seguro iniciar a viagem com o motor frio, e assim poupa combustível.

column2: Off for the weekend with the family?
column3: Fim‑de‑semana fora com a família?
column4: To avoid traffic jams and the related stress, not to mention polluting, why not consider other transportation alternatives?  After all, trains are more comfortable!
column5: Para evitar engarrafamentos e o stresse inerente, já para não falar da poluição, porque não considera os transporte alternativos?  Afinal, os comboios são mais confortáveis!

column2: Yet another flight for a business meeting?
column3: Vai outra vez apanhar o avião para uma reunião de trabalho?
column4: Develop a habit of considering telephone or video-conferencing first!
column5: Habitue‑se a pensar primeiro em telefonar ou em fazer uma videoconferência!

column2: Keep on the move!
column3: Pysy liikkeellä!
column4: Instead of taking the car: walk, cycle, take the bus or use the underground. You will not only keep fit but also help reduce traffic, air pollution, noise and accidents.
column5: Älä mene joka paikkaan autolla vaan kävele, pyöräile, käytä bussia tai hyppää metroon. Pysyt kunnossa ja vähennät samalla liikennettä, ilmansaastumista, melua ja onnettomuuksia.

column2: Got an errand to run?
column3: Oletko menossa asioille?
column4: Cars often pollute more on short trips when the motor is cold, so try to walk or cycle instead.
column5: Autot saastuttavat usein eniten lyhyillä matkoilla, jolloin moottori on kylmä. Kävele tai pyöräile aina kun mahdollista.

column2: Don’t skip regular check-ups of your car.
column3: Huollata autosi säännöllisesti.
column4: Inspect your car regularly for the emissions it generates. Catalytic converters need regular maintenance.
column5: Tarkistuta autosi päästöt ja huollata katalysaattori säännöllisesti.

column2: Going to work?
column3: Töihin menossa?
column4: Consider carpooling or using public transport rather than your own car. If driving, ask around the office which of your colleagues lives near you and whether you can share lifts.
column5: Järjestä kimppakyyti tai käytä julkista liikennettä oman auton sijaan. Jos kuitenkin liikut omalla autolla, kysele työpaikallasi, haluaisiko joku lähellä asuva työkaveri kyydin.

column2: Think twice before buying a new car.
column3: Mieti tarkkaan ennen kuin ostat uuden auton.
column4: It might be more efficient to use alternatives for transport rather than keeping a car only for weekend trips.
column5: Pelkkiä viikonloppumatkoja varten ei ehkä kannata pitää omaa autoa, vaan saattaisi olla järkevämpää käyttää muita liikennemuotoja.

column2: Use bicycle couriers!
column3: Käytä polkupyörälähettejä.
column4: If you run a business and need to deliver mail and parcels regularly around town, use a bicycle courier service if one is available. Bicycles bypass traffic; are quick; and you will contribute to the improvement of urban air quality in your area.
column5: Jos yrityksesi lähettää säännöllisesti postia tai paketteja eri puolille kaupunkia, käytä polkupyörälähettipalveluja, jos sellaisia on tarjolla. Polkupyörä kulkee ruuhkassa ja on nopea. Samalla autat parantamaan kaupunki-ilman laatua omalla alueellasi.

column2: Did you know that you can reduce air pollution by recycling your waste?
column3: Tiesitkö, että jätteiden kierrätys voi vähentää ilmansaastumista?
column4: By recycling glass, paper, batteries, engine oil and aluminium cans, these materials can be re-used, and you will reduce the volume of waste incinerated by up to 70%.
column5: Kun kierrätät lasin, paperin, paristot, moottoriöljyn ja alumiinipurkit, ne voidaan käyttää uudelleen. Kierrättämällä voidaan vähentää poltettavan jätteen määrää 70 prosenttia.

column2: On very hot days use public transport rather than your car.
column3: Käytä helteellä julkista liikennettä oman auton sijaan.
column4: Car exhaust emissions react with sunlight and heat to cause polluting gases such as tropospheric ozone. This is the main ingredient of poor air quality and photo-chemical smog, which can cause breathing difficulties.
column5: Auton tuottamat kaasut voivat reagoida auringonvalon ja lämmön kanssa, jolloin ne tuottavat saastuttavia kaasuja, kuten alailmakehän otsonia, joka on suurin syyllinen huonoon ilmanlaatuun ja fotokemialliseen savusumuun, joka voi aiheuttaa hengitysvaikeuksia.

column2: Think first before buying a Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV).
column3: Harkitse tarkoin, kannattaako kaupunkimaasturin hankinta.
column4: In addition to being very expensive to run, SUVs are very fuel inefficient. They emit twice as much carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons and nitrogen dioxide as an average car. These chemicals contribute to air pollution as well as global warming!
column5: Katumaasturit ovat kalliita ja kuluttavat runsaasti polttoainetta. Niiden hiilimonoksidi-, hiilivety- ja typpidioksidipäästöt ovat kaksi kertaa keskimääräistä korkeammat, ja juuri nämä kemikaalit aiheuttavat sekä ilman saastumista että ilmaston lämpenemistä.

column2: Turn off the tap!
column3: Sulje hana!
column4: Avoid wasting water while brushing your teeth or shaving, and save up to 10 litres of water each time. Use a mug of water and turn the tap off so you only use what you need.
column5: Kun et jätä vettä valumaan hampaita pestessäsi tai partaa ajaessasi, voit säästää jopa 10 litraa vettä joka kerta. Käytä sen sijaan mukia ja sulje hana, jolloin käytät vain tarvitsemasi määrän vettä.

column2: Install a water meter to keep track of your water consumption.
column3: Asennuta vesimittari, niin voit seurata vedenkulutusta.
column4: Households with meters tend to be more careful with their water-use and also end up saving money as well.
column5: Talouksissa, joissa on oma vesimittari, vedenkäyttö on yleensä tarkempaa. Samalla säästyy rahaa.

column2: Thirsty?
column3: Janottaako?
column4: Fill a jug with tap water and store it in your fridge rather than waiting for the tap to run cold each time you want a glass of cold water.
column5: Pidä kannullista vettä jääkaapissa sen sijaan, että juoksuttaisit vettä hanasta joka kerta, kun haluat lasillisen kylmää vettä.

column2: Why waste?
column3: Miksi tuhlata?
column4: Boil only as much water as you need for your cup of coffee or tea.
column5: Kun keität kahvia tai teetä, lämmitä vain tarvitsemasi määrä vettä.

column2: Take a quick shower instead of a bath.
column3: Suosi pikaista suihkua kylvyn sijaan.
column4: Showers require as little as a third of the water! However, this is true as long as you keep them under five minutes long. So be quick and use a shower timer to keep track of time next time you hop in!
column5: Kylvyssä vettä kuluu kolme kertaa enemmän. Muista kuitenkin, että tämä pitää paikkansa vain, kun olet suihkussa enintään viisi minuuttia. Ole siis nopea ja käytä ensi kerralla suihkussa käydessäsi ajastinta.

column2: Invest in low-flow showerheads to decrease your consumption of water.
column3: Hanki suihkuun vettä säästävä suutin, joka vähentää vedenkulutusta.
column4: They produce a finer spray and increase the flow of the water while using less of it.
column5: Vettä säästävien suuttimien suihku on hienojakoisempi, joten pienempi vesimäärä saa aikaan suuremman virtauksen.

column2: Reduce your domestic consumption of water.
column3: Vähennä vedenkulutusta kotona.
column4: By having aerators and water flow restrictors fitted on your taps, the flow of water will feel stronger, but will consist of less water and more air. Aerated taps can reduce the water flow by 30-40 %.
column5: Kun hankit hanoihin ilmastuslaitteet ja vedenvirtauksen rajoittimet, veden virtaus tuntuu voimakkaammalta, mutta sisältää vähemmän vettä ja enemmän ilmaa. Ilmastetut hanat vähentävät vedenvirtausta 30–40 prosenttia.

column2: Drop in a hippo!
column3: Käytä vedensäästäjää.
column4: Decrease your toilet’s water-use by dropping a hippo or other displacement device into the cistern. If you’re planning on buying a new toilet, consider a water efficient one with a dual flush.
column5: WC:n vedenkulutusta voi vähentää asettamalla säiliöön vedensäästäjän. Jos suunnittelet uuden WC-istuimen hankkimista, harkitse vettä säästävää mallia, jossa voi valita kahdesta erilaisesta huuhtelusta.

column2: Only run the dishwasher when it's completely full.
column3: Käynnistä astianpesukone vasta, kun se on täynnä.
column4: In this way, you actually use less water than if you wash the dishes by hand.
column5: Näin vettä kuluu vähemmän kuin käsin tiskattaessa.

column2: Go for the eco-label!
column3: Valitse ympäristömerkillä varustettu tuote.
column4: When shopping for a new washing machine, look for an energy-efficient model that uses the least amount of water. To find out more, visit the Eco-Label web-site that lists energy-efficient appliances:
column5: Ostaessasi uutta pesukonetta valitse energiatehokas malli, joka kuluttaa vähiten vettä. Lisätietoja saat Euroopan ympäristömerkin verkkosivulta, jossa on lueteltu energiatehokkaat laitteet.

column2: Don't flush
column3: Älä heitä roskia WC:hen.
column4: cotton-balls, cotton-swabs and make-up tissues down the toilet. Instead dispose of them in the bin where they belong.
column5: Älä vedä alas WC:stä pumpulia, vanutuppoja tai meikinpoistoliinoja, vaan heitä ne roskakoriin.

column2: The water hose in your garden can release as much as 18 litres of water a minute.
column3: Puutarhan vesiletkusta voi tulla vettä jopa 18 litraa minuutissa.
column4: Use a traditional watering can instead and significantly reduce the water wasted. Alternatively, you can fit the hose with a trigger gun to control the water-flow.
column5: Käytä vesiletkun sijasta perinteistä kastelukannua ja vähennä vedenkulutusta. Voit myös asentaa vesiletkuun veden virtausta säätävän liipaisinkahvan.

column2: Soak, don’t sprinkle!
column3: Älä suihkuttele, vaan kastele kunnolla.
column4: When gardening, soak the roots of your plants twice a week instead of sprinkling water on them each day. This way much more water is absorbed instead of evaporating.
column5: Kun kastelet kasveja, laske niiden juurille runsaasti vettä kahdesti viikossa sen sijaan, että suihkuttaisit niille hieman vettä joka päivä. Näin suurempi osa vedestä imeytyy eikä pääse haihtumaan.

column2: Collect rainwater
column3: Kerää sadevesi talteen.
column4: for watering your garden instead of using precious drinking water from the tap. Also, remember to check the weather forecast before watering the garden; it may be about to rain.
column5: Kerää sadevettä pihan kastelemista varten, niin et joudu käyttämään siihen arvokasta juomavettä. Muista myös tarkistaa säätiedotus ennen pihan kastelemista – luvassa saattaa olla sadetta.

column2: Hand-wash your car with a bucket, sponge and soap.
column3: Pese auto käsin.
column4: You’ll use up only a few litres of water compared to a commercial car wash which can use from 32 to 150 litres each time. You can achieve the same result, but with far less water.
column5: Käytä vesiämpäriä, pesusientä ja saippuaa. Vettä kuluu vain muutamia litroja, kun autopesulassa sitä voi kulua joka kerta 32–150 litraa. Käsinpesukin saa autosta säihkyvän puhtaan mutta vettä kuluu huomattavasti vähemmän.

column2: Mulch your plants – indoors and outdoors.
column3: Peitä puutarha- ja ruukkukasviesi multa katteella.
column4: It will keep weeds away; protect the plants by keeping the soil cool; decrease evaporation and reduce soil compaction. Be creative and use materials like: pebbles, bark chippings, gravel, cocoa shells, decorative pine cones, marbles, broken crockery, grass clippings or leaf mould. But avoid mulching too close to the stems to avoid the plant rotting in winter.
column5: Se pitää rikkaruohot loitolla ja suojaa kasveja pitämällä maan viileänä. Käytä luovasti erilaisia katemateriaaleja, kuten pieniä kiviä, kaarnahaketta, soraa, kaakaopavun kuoria, koristekäpyjä, marmorikuulia, rikkoutuneen saviastian sirpaleita, leikattua ruohoa tai lehtiä. Jätä varsien ympärille kuitenkin tilaa, etteivät ne lahoa talvella.

column2: If you have a garden, creating a pond is a great way to boost biodiversity.
column3: Lammen rakentaminen pihalle on hyvä tapa edesauttaa luonnon monimuotoisuutta.
column4: Frogs, water beetles, pond snails, and sometimes dragonflies and damselflies will use ponds. However, remember: avoid tadpole-eating goldfish!
column5: Sammakot, sukeltajakuoriaiset, kotilot ja jopa erilaiset sudenkorennot viihtyvät lammissa ja niiden läheisyydessä. Muista kuitenkin välttää sammakonpoikasia syöviä kultakaloja!

column2: Minimise your use of weed killers and insecticides.
column3: Vältä rikkaruoho- ja hyönteismyrkkyjen käyttöä.
column4: These can kill many useful creatures and plants you didn't intend to get rid of, especially if they seep into ponds and streams. There are many wildlife-friendly alternatives.
column5: Ne tappavat myös hyödyllisiä otuksia ja kasveja varsinkin päästessään lampiin tai jokiin. Tarjolla on myös monia ympäristöystävällisiä vaihtoehtoja.

column2: Pesticides contain dangerous and harmful toxic chemicals that are damaging human health.
column3: Torjunta-aineet sisältävät vaarallisia ja myrkyllisiä kemikaaleja, jotka ovat haitaksi ihmisten terveydelle.
column4: Residues from garden pesticides and insecticides can linger in the home. Contact your local authorities to find out where to safely and properly dispose of them.
column5: Puutarhassa käytettävien rikkaruoho- ja hyönteismyrkkyjen jäänteitä saattaa jäädä nurkkiin lojumaan. Kysy paikallisilta viranomaisilta, miten ne voidaan hävittää turvallisesti ja asianmukaisesti.

column2: Kill weeds with hot boiling water or simply burn them.
column3: Hävitä rikkaruohot kiehuvalla vedellä tai polttamalla.
column4: Weeds that have had boiling water poured over them turn brown within a few hours and die. There is no toxic residue and the area is immediately safe for children to play.
column5: Kun rikkaruohojen päälle kaadetaan kiehuvaa vettä, ne muuttuvat ruskeiksi ja kuolevat muutaman tunnin kuluessa. Tästä ei aiheudu myrkkyjäämiä, vaan alueella voi oleskella ja leikkiä heti turvallisesti.

column2: Home gardens can add immensely to the biodiversity of cities and towns.
column3: Kotipuutarhat lisäävät valtavasti kaupunkien luonnon monimuotoisuutta.
column4: They provide cover, feeding and commuting routes for wildlife including hedgehogs, badgers, birds and butterflies. If you have a garden, increase its value by planting berry-bearing trees and flowering plants. Rowan, bird cherry and dandelion, among others, can serve as food and shelter to a wide range of invertebrates.
column5: Esimerkiksi siilit, mäyrät, linnut ja perhoset löytävät niistä suojaa ja kulkureittejä. Voit lisätä luonnon monimuotoisuutta pihallasi istuttamalla marjoja tuottavia puita ja kukkivia kasveja. Muun muassa pihlaja, tuomi ja voikukka tarjoavat ruokaa ja suojaa monenlaisille hyönteisille.

column2: Biodiversity: Set a good example!
column3: Näytä hyvää esimerkkiä!
column4: Encourage others in your community to create biodiversity ‘hot spots’. How? A row of gardens could create a biodiversity corridor linking wildlife to a local park or green space.
column5: Kannusta muitakin lähistöllä asuvia lisäämään luonnon monimuotoisuutta. Miten se sitten onnistuu? Pihojen rivistö voisi yhdistää luonnontilaisen alueen paikalliseen puistoon tai viheralueeseen.

column2: Keep your dog on a lead if it is likely to run off and disturb wildlife.
column3: Pidä koira hihnassa, ettei se karkaa häiritsemään luonnonvaraisia eläimiä.
column4: In particular, be careful of nesting birds in early spring and early summer, and roosting or feeding birds in winter. If you have a dog, keep this in mind when you're taking it for a walk!
column5: Varo erityisesti pesiviä lintuja keväällä ja alkukesästä sekä nukkuvia ja ruokailevia lintuja talvella. Pidä tämä mielessä, jos ulkoilet koiran kanssa.

column2: Dispose, don’t pour!
column3: Älä kaada jätteitä viemäriin.
column4: Anything you pour down your drain, sink or toilet can eventually end up in our rivers or sea! Never dispose of liquids such as oils, grease, or hazardous liquids – like paint thinners or unused paint – by pouring them down the drain. Instead, collect them in one box and dispose with the rest of your waste. Keep them all in their individual packaging, to avoid possible chemical reactions. This will also make it easier for them to be identified during waste collection. If applicable, take them to your community collection point.
column5: Kaikki, mikä kaadetaan viemäriin, pesualtaaseen tai WC:hen, voi päätyä jokiin ja mereen. Öljyjä, rasvoja ja kodin vaarallisia aineita, kuten maalin ohenteita ja käyttämätöntä maalia, ei saa kaataa viemäriin. Ne on kerättävä vaikkapa laatikkoon ja hävitettävä muiden kierrätyskelvottomien jätteiden mukana. Säilytä ne erillään omissa alkuperäispakkauksissaan välttääksesi aineiden välisiä kemiallisia reaktioita ja helpottaaksesi niiden tunnistamista jätteenkäsittelylaitoksessa. Voit myös tarkistaa, onko kotikunnassasi tällaisten nesteiden keräyspistettä.

column2: Don't buy timber from illegal trade!
column3: Älä osta laittomasti kaupattavaa puutavaraa.
column4: Illegal trade in tropical timber contributes to forest destruction. Many hardware suppliers are now selling timber that has been certified as legal and sustainable. Next time you shop for wood-products, check for labels such as the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).
column5: Trooppisten puulajien laiton kauppa edistää metsien tuhoutumista. Monet rautakaupat myyvät nykyään lailliseksi todistettua ja kestävän metsänhoidon periaatteiden mukaisesti tuotettua puutavaraa. Seuraavan kerran, kun ostat puutavaraa, tarkista, että siinä on asianmukaiset merkinnät, kuten FSC-merkki.

column2: When travelling to exotic places, choose your souvenirs carefully.
column3: Kun matkustat eksoottiseen paikkaan, valitse matkamuistosi huolellisesti.
column4: Trade in items such as woodcarvings, red coral or ornaments with fur or feathers, is often regulated and permits are required to bring them home. Check the rules, as there are strict laws governing exports of wildlife and you could risk having your souvenir confiscated.
column5: Usein puuveistokset, jalokoralli ja turkis- tai höyhenkoristeet ovat laittomia ja niiden kuljetus kotiin edellyttää erikoislupaa. Tarkista säännökset, sillä luontoa suojellaan tiukkojen lakien avulla, joten matkamuistosi saattaisivat joutua takavarikoiduiksi.

column2: Be creative and design a wildlife area in your garden!
column3: Jätä pihallesi tilaa luonnonvaraisille kasveille ja eläimille.
column4: In addition to creating a natural haven for you and your family, it will attract butterflies and also provide cover for frogs, mammals and insects.
column5: Luonnontilaan jätetyt alueet tarjoavat sinulle ja perheellesi paikan, jossa voi rauhoittua luonnon helmassa. Samalla ne houkuttelevat perhosia ja tarjoavat suojaa sammakoille, nisäkkäille ja hyönteisille.

column2: Support your national parks!
column3: Tue kansallispuistoja.
column4: Visit nature reserves and parks to show support for their creation, preservation and even their expansion. Remember to leave these areas as you found them.
column5: Tee retkiä luonnonsuojelualueille ja -puistoihin. Näin osoitat tukevasi niitä ja autat varmistamaan, että ne jatkavat toimintaansa ja laajenevat. Muista jättää alueet siihen tilaan, jossa ne olivat saapuessasi.

column2: Conserve water by letting your lawn grow longer.
column3: Säästä vettä antamalla ruohon kasvaa pitemmäksi.
column4: Let the grass grow higher and thus encourage root growth. It will also allow the grass to self-seed. If you mow a path in the middle, it will show that it is indeed meant to be that way as opposed to being neglected.
column5: Kun ruoho on pidempää, se kasvattaa juuret syvemmälle ja pääsee myös siementämään. Jos leikkaat nurmikon keskelle kulkureitin, se osoittaa, ettei puutarhasi ole hoitamaton, vaan ruoho on tarkoituksella jätetty pitkäksi.

column2: A rotting log is a mini nature reserve in its own right!
column3: Tiesitkö, että lahoava pölkky on itsessään luonnonsuojelualue?
column4: By removing dead or dying trees from woodland, a section of the natural nutrient-cycle can be lost. A lack of dead wood reduces species diversity by about 20 %. Avoid removing dead wood from your property. You could be doing away with thousands of invertebrate species and fungi.
column5: Jos metsästä poistetaan kuolleet tai kuolevat puut, niiden mukana häviää osa luonnon ravintoketjua. Kuolleiden puiden puuttuminen vähentää lajien monimuotoisuutta noin 20 prosenttia. Älä poista kuolleita ja kuolevia puita metsästä tai pihaltasi. Samalla saatat tulla tuhonneeksi tuhansia selkärangattomia ja sieniä.

column2: To prevent soil erosion, plant vegetation with complementary root systems.
column3: Ehkäise maaperän eroosiota istuttamalla tiheäjuurista kasvillisuutta.
column4: Some examples include lavender that have deep roots, which form a dense network that stabilises the soil.
column5: Esimerkkinä voidaan mainita laventeli, jolla on pitkät juuret, jotka muodostavat tiheän verkoston, joka tasapainottaa maaperää.

column2: From a distance…
column3: Säilytä etäisyys…
column4: Appreciate wildlife, but be sure to watch wild animals from a distance and avoid feeding them. Remember, the scent you leave when you touch a nest or a lair may scare the parents off for good. Instead of touching, try to find out more about them and maybe even discover how you can contribute to their protection.
column5: Arvosta luontoa, mutta muista tarkkailla luonnonvaraisia eläimiä riittävän kaukaa äläkä ruoki niitä. Muista myös, että pesän koskettaminen jättää siihen hajusi, jolloin vanhemmat saattavat hylätä sen. Älä siis koske eläinten pesiin, vaan yritä löytää lisätietoa niistä ja niiden suojelusta.

column2: Take part in the next census of birds in your country.
column3: Osallistu seuraavaan lintujen laskentaan.
column4: In addition to making a valuable contribution to the national bird survey, you can learn how to recognise wrens, robins and will also spend a day outdoors.
column5: Anna arvokas panoksesi lintujen laskentaan ja tunnistukseen maassasi. Voit oppia tunnistamaan peukaloisen ja punarinnan – ja pääset viettämään päivän ulkona.

column2: When on a hiking trip do not leave anything behind, especially litter.
column3: Kun olet vaeltamassa tai retkellä, älä jätä roskia tai mitään muutakaan jälkeesi.
column4: If you come across anything that others have left behind, act responsibly and pick it up.
column5: Jos löydät jotakin muiden jättämää, toimi vastuullisesti ja korjaa se pois.

column2: Where you can, choose organically farmed fish such as sea bass, salmon and trout.
column3: Osta orgaanisesti viljeltyä kalaa, kuten meriahventa, lohta ja taimenta.
column4: Non-organic fish uses large quantities of chemicals and antibiotics which can affect other animals in the food chain. It is also worth bearing in mind that to produce a 3 kg farmed salmon, 15 kg of fish are caught in the wild to provide its meal and oil.
column5: Epäorgaanisessa kalanviljelyssä käytetään runsaasti kemikaaleja ja antibiootteja, jotka voivat vaikuttaa ravintoketjun muihin eläimiin. On myös hyvä muistaa, että kolmikiloisen kasvatetun lohen tuottamiseksi joudutaan pyytämään 15 kg luonnonvaraista kalaa sen ravinnoksi.

column2: Welcome a newborn in your family by planting a tree.
column3: Juhlista vauvan syntymää istuttamalla puu.
column4: In addition to creating a happy memory, this tree will give you shade, create a small ecosystem and produce oxygen.
column5: Tästä erityisestä tapahtumasta jää mukava muisto ja lisäksi puu luo varjoa, kehittää pienen ekosysteemin ja tuottaa happea.

column2: Find out about the special flora and fauna in your area.
column3: Hanki tietoa alueesi erityisistä kasveista ja eläimistä.
column4: Threatened and endangered species can be found in all kinds of ecosystems, big and small. Learn what kinds of species are listed as endangered in your area and commit to assisting in the preservation of their habitat.
column5: Uhanalaisia lajeja on kaikissa ekosysteemeissä, niin pienissä kuin suurissakin. Selvitä uhanalaiset lajit omalla alueellasi ja osallistu niiden elinalueen suojeluun.

column2: If on holidays by a tropical lagoon or coral reef, avoid touching or stepping on corals.
column3: Jos lomailet trooppisella alueella, vältä vedessä koralliriutalle astumista ja sen koskettamista.
column4: When diving, do not break off a branch of coral to take home as a souvenir. Coral reefs are precious and they are disappearing
column5: Kun sukellat, älä irrota koralleja matkamuistoiksi. Koralliriutat ovat arvokkaita ja ne ovat katoamassa.

column2: Create a small ecosystem
column3: Perusta pieni ekosysteemi
column4: in your garden or park by piling up some logs in a secluded corner. These will provide shelter for hedgehogs, frogs and toads. If you half-bury the bottom logs in the soil, you will also encourage stag beetles as they are fond of rotten wood. A pile of stones will also provide shelter to a range of insects and spiders.
column5: pinoamalla muutamia tukkeja pihan tai puiston perukoille. Siilit, sammakot ja rupikonnat käyttävät niitä suojina. Vaihtoehtoisesti voit haudata alimmat tukit puoliksi maahan, mikä houkuttelee lahosta puusta pitäviä kampasarvisia. Myös kivikasa tarjoaa suojaa erilaisille hyönteisille ja hämähäkeille.

column2: Did you know?
column3: Tiesitkö?
column4: Certain non-recyclable paper products (such as tissues, napkins, and egg cartons) can be added to your compost. Their fibres will aerate the compost and help the organisms that encourage decomposition.
column5: Tietyt ei-kierrätettävät paperituotteet (esimerkiksi nenäliinat, lautasliinat ja kananmunarasiat) voidaan kompostoida. Niiden kuidut ilmastavat kompostia ja auttavat lahoamista edistäviä mikro-organismeja.

column2: Choose your pet carefully and think before buying an exotic animal
column3: Valitse lemmikkisi huolella ja harkitse ennen kuin hankit eksoottisen eläimen.
column4: Reptiles, birds and fish are often taken from their natural habitats. The black market for exotic pets has devastated entire populations of species, and it is still the fastest growing sector in the pet market.
column5: Matelijat, linnut ja kalat viedään usein pois luonnollisilta elinalueiltaan. Eksoottisten lemmikkien laittomat markkinat ovat hävittäneet kokonaisia eläinyhteisöjä; tämä on edelleen lemmikkieläinmarkkinoiden nopeimmin kasvava sektori.

column2: If you're up for an unusual holiday, why not volunteer for nature conservation?
column3: Jos haluat tehdä lomallasi jotakin erilaista, lähde vaikka vapaaehtoiseksi luonnonsuojelutyöhön?
column4: Many travel companies offer such trips. It will give you the opportunity to work with passionate people and to do something positive in support of an environmental cause.
column5: Monet matkatoimistot tarjoavat tällaisia matkoja. Saat mahdollisuuden tehdä työtä innostuneessa ilmapiirissä ja toimit ympäristön hyväksi.

column2: Grow your own vegetable garden or just a few in window boxes.
column3: Perusta oma vihannestarha tai kasvata joitakin vihanneksia ikkunalaudalla.
column4: You'll enjoy tasty and fresh vegetables free of pesticides.
column5: Saat tuoreita ja maukkaita vihanneksia, joissa ei ole hyönteismyrkkyjä.

column2: Help to clean up your surroundings.
column3: Auta lähiympäristösi siivoamisessa.
column4: Each year on World Environment Day, schools and environmental organisations worldwide organise clean up operations. Join one! In addition to enriching the landscape of your neighbourhood, you will learn more about the animals and plants that live nearby.
column5: Maailman ympäristöpäivänä koulut ja ympäristöjärjestöt järjestävät vuosittain siivousoperaatioita. Osallistu johonkin niistä! Lähiympäristösi maiseman kohentamisen lisäksi opit uutta lähistöllä elävistä kasveista ja eläimistä.

column2: Looking to add new plants to your garden?
column3: Haluatko uusia kasveja pihallesi?
column4: Be careful when buying for your garden. People are one of the main introducers of invasive species, especially flora. Many of the invasive species have been introduced for ornamental purposes. Do put an extra effort in finding out whether the plant you want is native to your environment.
column5: Ole tarkkana ostaessasi uusia kasveja puutarhaasi. Tulokaslajeja, erityisesti tulokaskasveja, päätyy luontoon usein juuri ihmisen toiminnan seurauksena. Monet tulokaslajit ovat olleet alun perin koristekasveja. Selvitä, onko haluamasi kasvi alueesi alkuperäiseen lajistoon kuuluva laji.

column2: Buy locally-produced fresh produce
column3: Osta paikallisesti tuotettuja tuoretuotteita
column4: either directly from the farmer or at a local fruit and vegetable market. Seasonal food is good for you and the environment. Cutting the number of kilometres your food has travelled and avoiding packaging reduces pollution and waste.
column5: joko suoraan viljelijältä tai paikallisesta hedelmä- ja vihanneskaupasta. Kausiruoka on hyväksi sekä sinulle että ympäristölle. Pakkausmateriaalin vähentäminen ja lyhyemmät kuljetusmatkat vähentävät ruokatarvikkeista aiheutuvaa saastumista ja jätemäärää.

column2: Where possible, switch to organic food!
column3: Siirry käyttämään luomuruokaa aina kun mahdollista.
column4: Organic food production uses no synthetic pesticides, produces slightly less greenhouse gases and usually leaves more room for biodiversity in agricultural areas.
column5: Luonnonmukaisessa maataloudessa ei käytetä synteettisiä torjunta-aineita. Se tuottaa jonkin verran vähemmän kasvihuonekaasuja ja useimmiten jättää enemmän tilaa maatalousalueiden biologiselle monimuotoisuudelle.

column2: Eat meat in moderation!
column3: Syö vähemmän lihaa.
column4: If you're a meat eater, consider reducing your meat consumption and going for quality rather than quantity. Production of meat consumes enormous amounts of energy, not only for the growth and transport of animal feed, but also for the heating, air conditioning, and lighting of the immense animal farms. Changing to a diet with less meat helps the environment, but is also good for your health. It is best to buy meat from local producers and buy organic too.
column5: Jos perheessäsi syödään lihaa säännöllisesti, pyri suosimaan määrän sijasta laatua. Lihan tuottaminen kuluttaa valtavat määrät energiaa – ei pelkästään eläinten rehun kasvatuksen ja kuljetuksen vuoksi, vaan myös todella suurten karjatilojen lämmityksen, ilmastoinnin ja valaistuksen vuoksi. Enemmän kasviksia sisältävä ruokavalio säästää luontoa ja on terveellisempi. Kannattaa suosia paikallisten tuottajien luomutuotteita.

column2: Disposable napkins are often given out for free but this is no reason to waste them.
column3: Kertakäyttöisiä lautasliinoja jaetaan yleensä ilmaiseksi, mutta se ei ole mikään syy tuhlata niitä.
column4: Instead of taking a handful, one or two should be more than enough. Be reasonable and trees will thank you for it!
column5: Älä siis ota kourallista, yleensä yksi tai kaksi riittää hyvin. Muista kohtuus – ja puut kiittävät sinua!

column2: Eat fruit and vegetables that are in season.
column3: Syö aina sesongin hedelmiä ja vihanneksia.
column4: They taste better, are healthier for you, and their cultivation has less impact on the environment.
column5: Ne maistuvat paremmalle, ovat terveellisempiä ja niiden kasvattaminen kuormittaa ympäristöä vähemmän.

column2: Consider your dairy consumption.
column3: Mieti maitotuotteiden kulutustasi.
column4: The production of butter, cheese and other dairy products with high fat content accounts for high greenhouse gas emissions as well as for eutrophication of groundwater, rivers and seas. Remember: Globally, around 70 % of all agricultural land is used for livestock production.
column5: Voin, juuston ja muiden rasvaisten maitotuotteiden tuotanto synnyttää suuria kasvihuonekaasupäästöjä sekä aiheuttaa pohjaveden, jokien ja meren rehevöitymistä. Huomaa: 70 prosenttia maailman maatalousmaasta käytetään kotieläintuotantoon.

column2: Invest in a lunch box.
column3: Hanki eväslaatikko.
column4: If needed use cling film and paper instead of aluminium foil when you prepare your lunch. Reducing the amount of materials you use will reduce the amount of rubbish you throw away and this is good news for the environment!
column5: Jos tarvitset pakkausmateriaalia, käytä alumiinifolion sijasta paperia ja muovikelmua. Mitä vähemmän materiaalia käytät, sitä vähemmän roskaa heität pois – ja siitä ympäristö kiittää!

column2: Don't start a washing machine unless it is fully loaded with laundry or dishes.
column3: Älä käynnistä pesukonetta, ellei se ole täynnä pyykkiä tai tiskiä.
column4: Its energy and water consumption will be the same whether it's full or empty so you might as well optimise its cycle.
column5: Energian- ja vedenkulutus on sama, olipa kone täynnä tai tyhjä, joten voit yhtä hyvin optimoida koneen käytön.

column2: Let your hot food cool down before putting it in the refrigerator
column3: Anna lämpimän ruoan jäähtyä ennen kuin laitat sen jääkaappiin
column4: and defrost food from the freezer in the fridge. Both will save you money on your energy bill. Also, remember to keep the fridge door open for only as long as you need it.
column5: ja sulata pakasteet jääkaapissa. Säästät sähkölaskussa. Älä myöskään pidä jääkaapin ovea tarpeettomasti auki.

column2: Take a shower rather than a bath!
column3: Suosi pikaista suihkua kylvyn sijaan.
column4: This way you can cut your water consumption by a third! Pause the water flow when soaping and avoid long showers. A shower uses about 30 to 80 litres, while a bath uses 150 to 200 litres of precious water. Install low-flow shower heads and think before buying a power shower.
column5: Se vähentää vedenkulutuksen jopa kolmannekseen! Sulje hana saippuoinnin ajaksi ja vältä pitkiä suihkuja. Suihkun aikana arvokasta vettä kuluu noin 30–80 litraa, kun taas kylvyssä sitä kuluu 150–200 litraa. Asenna virtausta säästävä suihkusuutin ja mieti ennen kuin hankit painesuihkun.

column2: Got lime scale to remove?
column3: Haluatko eroon kalkkisaostumista?
column4: Instead of chemical products, try using vinegar to remove lime scale from tiles, taps, kettles and irons.
column5: Perinteisten kemikaalien sijasta kannattaa käyttää etikkaa. Sillä voi poistaa myös laattoihin, hanoihin, kattiloihin ja silitysrautaan kerääntyneen kalkin.

column2: Buy eco-friendly dishwashing detergent.
column3: Osta ympäristöystävällistä astianpesuainetta.
column4: It is largely biodegradable, less polluting to aquatic habitats and just as effective a cleaning agent as less environmentally friendly options. Look for eco-friendly dishwashing detergents, such as those labelled with the European flower eco-label (see www.eco-label.com to find one in your country).
column5: Se on suureksi osaksi biohajoavaa, saastuttaa vähemmän vesistöjä ja on pesuaineena aivan yhtä tehokasta kuin vähemmän ympäristöystävälliset vaihtoehdot. Suosi ympäristöystävällisiä astianpesuaineita, jotka on merkitty EU-kukalla eli Euroopan ympäristömerkillä (omassa maassasi myytävistä tuotteista saat lisätietoa osoitteesta www.eco-label.com).

column2: Planning to renovate your house or apartment?
column3: Suunnitteletko remonttia?
column4: Look for ways to reduce the energy consumption for heating and cooling, for example by sealing windows and doors, insulation or changing the windows. Today it is possible to build ‘carbon neutral’ houses.
column5: Mieti, miten voisit vähentää lämmityksen ja jäähdytyksen energiankulutusta esimerkiksi tiivistämällä ovet ja ikkunat, lisäämällä eristeitä tai vaihtamalla ikkunat. Nykyään on mahdollista rakentaa "hiilineutraaleja" taloja.

column2: In the market for a new printer?
column3: Oletko ostamassa uutta tulostinta?
column4: When buying a new printer consider one that allows ink cartridges to be refilled with rechargeable kits. It is very cost effective and environmentally friendly. If this is not applicable to your printer remember to recycle your used cartridges by returning them to the shop where you buy the new ones.
column5: Ostaessasi uutta tulostinta valitse malli, jonka värikasetin voi täyttää. Sellainen on hyvin kustannustehokas ja ympäristöystävällinen. Jos oman tulostimesi värikasettia ei voi täyttää uudelleen, muista ainakin palauttaa vanha värikasetti kierrätykseen samalla, kun ostat uuden.

column2: Invest in rechargeable batteries instead of buying disposable ones.
column3: Hanki ladattavia akkuja kertakäyttöparistojen sijaan.
column4: You will save money in the long term. You can also buy solar powered rechargers if you want to reduce your environmental impact even further.
column5: Pitkällä aikavälillä se on myös edullisempi vaihtoehto. Askelta edemmäs pääset, kun hankit aurinkoenergialla toimivan laturin.
