column5: Poskytujú úkryt, potravu a prepravné trasy pre voľne žijúce živočíchy vrátane ježkov, jazvecov, vtákov a motýľov. Ak máte záhradu, pomôžte zlepšiť biodiverzitu tým, že vysadíte dreviny, ktoré majú bobuľovité plody, a kvitnúce rastliny. Jarabina, vtáčnica a púpava môžu okrem iného slúžiť aj ako potrava a úkryt pre rozličný hmyz.

column2: Biodiversity: Set a good example!
column3: Buďte príkladom!
column4: Encourage others in your community to create biodiversity ‘hot spots’. How? A row of gardens could create a biodiversity corridor linking wildlife to a local park or green space.
column5: Nabádajte ostatných ľudí žijúcich v okolí, aby vytvárali „ostrovčeky“ biodiverzity. Ako? Záhrady by mohli vytvoriť prechodný koridor pre voľne žijúce živočíchy vedúci do miestneho parku alebo do voľnej prírody.

column2: Keep your dog on a lead if it is likely to run off and disturb wildlife.
column3: Ak je pravdepodobné, že Vám pes odbehne a bude rušiť voľne žijúce zvieratá, držte ho na vôdzke.
column4: In particular, be careful of nesting birds in early spring and early summer, and roosting or feeding birds in winter. If you have a dog, keep this in mind when you're taking it for a walk!
column5: Pozor treba dávať najmä na hniezdiace vtáky začiatkom jari a leta a vtáky, ktoré sa pripravujú na odlet, alebo vtáky, ktoré kŕmia svoje mláďatá v zime. Pamätajte na to, ak máte psa a chodíte s ním na prechádzky.

column2: Dispose, don’t pour!
column3: Likvidujte, nevylievajte!
column4: Anything you pour down your drain, sink or toilet can eventually end up in our rivers or sea! Never dispose of liquids such as oils, grease, or hazardous liquids – like paint thinners or unused paint – by pouring them down the drain. Instead, collect them in one box and dispose with the rest of your waste. Keep them all in their individual packaging, to avoid possible chemical reactions. This will also make it easier for them to be identified during waste collection. If applicable, take them to your community collection point.
column5: Všetko, čo sa vyleje do odpadu, výlevky alebo záchodu skončí v riekach alebo v mori! Kvapaliny, ako sú oleje a tuky alebo nebezpečné materiály (napríklad riedidlá na farby a zvyšné farby), by sa nikdy nemali vypúšťať do kanalizácie. Namiesto toho by sa mali odložiť do škatule a zneškodniť spolu s ostatným odpadom. Nechajte ich v pôvodnom obale, aby nedošlo k prípadnej chemickej reakcii. Okrem toho sa budú dať ľahšie rozpoznať pri zbere odpadu. Ak je to možné, odnes ich na zberné miesto.

column2: Don't buy timber from illegal trade!
column3: Nekupujte drevo pochádzajúce z nelegálneho obchodu!
column4: Illegal trade in tropical timber contributes to forest destruction. Many hardware suppliers are now selling timber that has been certified as legal and sustainable. Next time you shop for wood-products, check for labels such as the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).
column5: Nelegálny obchod s tropickým drevom je jednou z príčin ničenia lesov. Mnohí dodávatelia predávajú drevo, ktoré má osvedčenie o legálnom pôvode a trvalej udržateľnosti. Keď budete nabudúce kupovať výrobky z dreva, hľadaj etikety ako Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).

column2: When travelling to exotic places, choose your souvenirs carefully.
column3: Pri cestách na exotické miesta si dávajte pozor pri kúpe suvenírov.
column4: Trade in items such as woodcarvings, red coral or ornaments with fur or feathers, is often regulated and permits are required to bring them home. Check the rules, as there are strict laws governing exports of wildlife and you could risk having your souvenir confiscated.
column5: Predmety ako drevoryty, červený koral alebo ozdoby z kožušín či peria sú často obmedzené a na to, aby ste si ich mohli doviezť domov, je potrebné osobitné povolenie. Zistite si, aké sú pravidlá, pretože pre vývoz voľne žijúcich živočíchov a rastlín platia prísne predpisy a riskujete, že Vám suvenír zabavia.

column2: Be creative and design a wildlife area in your garden!
column3: Buďte tvorivý a navrhnite si vo svojej záhrade prírodný kútik!
column4: In addition to creating a natural haven for you and your family, it will attract butterflies and also provide cover for frogs, mammals and insects.
column5: Okrem toho, že vytvoríte prirodzené útočisko pre seba a svoju rodinu, prilákate motýle a poskytnete úkryt žabám, cicavcom a hmyzu.

column2: Support your national parks!
column3: Podporujte národné parky vo svojej krajine!
column4: Visit nature reserves and parks to show support for their creation, preservation and even their expansion. Remember to leave these areas as you found them.
column5: Navštevujte prírodné rezervácie a parky, aby ste ukázali, že podporujete ich vytváranie, zachovávanie, ba dokonca rozširovanie. Nezabudnite na to, že tieto oblasti musíte vždy opustiť v stave, v akom ste ich našli.

column2: Conserve water by letting your lawn grow longer.
column3: Ak necháte trávnik narásť dlhší, udrží sa v ňom viac vody.
column4: Let the grass grow higher and thus encourage root growth. It will also allow the grass to self-seed. If you mow a path in the middle, it will show that it is indeed meant to be that way as opposed to being neglected.
column5: Nechajte trávu vyrásť, čo povzbudí rast koreňov. Umožní sa tým aj samovýsev trávy. Ak v strede trávnika vykosíte cestičku, ukážete, že trávnik nezanedbávate, ale naopak – nekosíte ho zámerne.

column2: A rotting log is a mini nature reserve in its own right!
column3: Hnijúce poleno je samo osebe miniatúrna prírodná rezervácia so svojim vlastným kolobehom.
column4: By removing dead or dying trees from woodland, a section of the natural nutrient-cycle can be lost. A lack of dead wood reduces species diversity by about 20 %. Avoid removing dead wood from your property. You could be doing away with thousands of invertebrate species and fungi.
column5: Odstraňovaním odumretých alebo vysychajúcich stromov z lesa sa môže stratiť prirodzený cyklus živín. Nedostatok odumretého dreva znižuje rozmanitosť druhov o 20 %. Neodstraňujte odumreté stromy zo záhrady. Môžete zlikvidovať tisíce druhov hmyzu a húb.

column2: To prevent soil erosion, plant vegetation with complementary root systems.
column3: V záujme prevencie pôdnej erózie vysádzajte rastliny tak, aby sa ich koreňové sústavy vzájomne dopĺňali.
column4: Some examples include lavender that have deep roots, which form a dense network that stabilises the soil.
column5: Príkladom je levanduľa s hlbokými koreňmi vytvárajúcimi hustú sieť, ktorá stabilizuje pôdu.

column2: From a distance…
column3: Z diaľky...
column4: Appreciate wildlife, but be sure to watch wild animals from a distance and avoid feeding them. Remember, the scent you leave when you touch a nest or a lair may scare the parents off for good. Instead of touching, try to find out more about them and maybe even discover how you can contribute to their protection.
column5: Môžete obdivovať voľne žijúce zvieratá, ale dávajte si pozor, aby ste ich pozorovali len z určitej vzdialenosti a nikdy ich nekŕmte. Pamätajte na to, že pach, ktorý po Vás zostane, keď sa dotknete hniezda alebo brlohu, môže vyplašiť ich rodičov. Namiesto toho, aby ste sa ich dotýkali, skúste sa o nich dozvedieť viac a pokúste sa zistiť, ako môžete pomôcť pri ich ochrane.

column2: Take part in the next census of birds in your country.
column3: Zúčastnite sa najbližšieho sčítania vtákov vo svojej krajine.
column4: In addition to making a valuable contribution to the national bird survey, you can learn how to recognise wrens, robins and will also spend a day outdoors.
column5: Okrem toho, že významne prispejete k národnému prieskumu vtákov, naučíte sa, ako rozpoznať orieška od červienky, a navyše strávite deň vonku.

column2: When on a hiking trip do not leave anything behind, especially litter.
column3: Keď ste na výlete, nikdy po sebe nič nenechávajte, najmä žiadne odpadky.
column4: If you come across anything that others have left behind, act responsibly and pick it up.
column5: Ak zbadáte niečo, čo tam nechali iní, správajte sa zodpovedne a zodvihnite to.

column2: Where you can, choose organically farmed fish such as sea bass, salmon and trout.
column3: Ak je to možné, kupujte ekologicky chované ryby, ako sú lavraky, lososy a pstruhy.
column4: Non-organic fish uses large quantities of chemicals and antibiotics which can affect other animals in the food chain. It is also worth bearing in mind that to produce a 3 kg farmed salmon, 15 kg of fish are caught in the wild to provide its meal and oil.
column5: Pri neekologicky chovaných rybách sa používa množstvo chemikálií a antibiotík, ktoré môžu ovplyvniť iné živočíchy v potravinovom reťazci. Rovnako je užitočné zapamätať si, že na odchov 3 kg lososa na mäso a olej sa musí vo voľnej prírode nachytať 15 kg rýb.

column2: Welcome a newborn in your family by planting a tree.
column3: Privítajte novorodenca vo svojej rodine tak, že zasadíte strom.
column4: In addition to creating a happy memory, this tree will give you shade, create a small ecosystem and produce oxygen.
column5: Okrem toho, že Vám stromček bude túto príležitosť pripomínať, poskytne tieň, vytvorí malý ekosystém a bude produkovať kyslík.

column2: Find out about the special flora and fauna in your area.
column3: Zistite si informácie o špeciálnej flóre a faune vo svojej oblasti.
column4: Threatened and endangered species can be found in all kinds of ecosystems, big and small. Learn what kinds of species are listed as endangered in your area and commit to assisting in the preservation of their habitat.
column5: Ohrozené a zraniteľné druhy je možné nájsť vo všetkých druhoch ekosystémov, či už veľkých alebo malých. Zistite si, ktoré živočíšne a rastlinné druhy z vašej oblasti sú zaradené medzi ohrozené druhy, a dajte si záväzok, že budete chrániť ich prirodzené prostredie.

column2: If on holidays by a tropical lagoon or coral reef, avoid touching or stepping on corals.
column3: Na dovolenke na lagúnovom alebo koralovom útese si dávajte pozor, aby ste nestúpili na koralový útes, a ani sa ho nedotýkajte.
column4: When diving, do not break off a branch of coral to take home as a souvenir. Coral reefs are precious and they are disappearing
column5: Pri potápaní alebo šnorchlovaní neolamujte kúsky koralov, aby ste si ich zobrali domov. Koralové útesy sú vzácne a postupne zanikajú.

column2: Create a small ecosystem
column3: Vytvorte malý ekosystém
column4: in your garden or park by piling up some logs in a secluded corner. These will provide shelter for hedgehogs, frogs and toads. If you half-bury the bottom logs in the soil, you will also encourage stag beetles as they are fond of rotten wood. A pile of stones will also provide shelter to a range of insects and spiders.
column5: v záhrade či parku tak, že do vzdialeného rohu navŕšite niekoľko polienok. Poskytnú úkryt pre ježkov, žaby a ropuchy. Polená môžete napoly zahrabať do pôdy. Pomôžete tak roháčom, pretože tie milujú rozkladajúce sa drevo. Hromada kameňov poskytne úkryt rôznemu hmyzu a pavúkom.

column2: Did you know?
column3: Vedeli ste?
column4: Certain non-recyclable paper products (such as tissues, napkins, and egg cartons) can be added to your compost. Their fibres will aerate the compost and help the organisms that encourage decomposition.
column5: Do kompostu môžete pridať niektoré nerecyklovateľné výrobky z papiera (obrúsky, servítky, prepravky na vajíčka). Ich vlákna prevzdušnia kompost a pomôžu mikroorganizmom, ktoré podporujú rozklad organickej hmoty.

column2: Choose your pet carefully and think before buying an exotic animal
column3: Svoje domáce zvieratko si dôkladne vyberte a dobre si rozmyslite, či si kúpite exotické zvieratko.
column4: Reptiles, birds and fish are often taken from their natural habitats. The black market for exotic pets has devastated entire populations of species, and it is still the fastest growing sector in the pet market.
column5: Plazy, vtáky a ryby sú často vytrhnuté zo svojho prirodzeného prostredia. Nezákonné obchodovanie s exotickými zvieratami zničilo celé populácie živočíšnych druhov a ešte stále je to najrýchlejšie rastúce odvetvie na trhu s domácimi zvieratkami.

column2: If you're up for an unusual holiday, why not volunteer for nature conservation?
column3: Ak chcete stráviť nezvyčajné prázdniny, pouvažujte o dobrovoľnej činnosti na ochranu prírody.
column4: Many travel companies offer such trips. It will give you the opportunity to work with passionate people and to do something positive in support of an environmental cause.
column5: Mnohé cestovné kancelárie takéto pobyty ponúkajú. Získate tak príležitosť spolupracovať s nadšenými ľuďmi a urobiť niečo dobré na ochranu životného prostredia.

column2: Grow your own vegetable garden or just a few in window boxes.
column3: Zriaďte si svoju vlastnú zeleninovú záhradku alebo aspoň niekoľko kvetináčov v oknách.
column4: You'll enjoy tasty and fresh vegetables free of pesticides.
column5: Dobrá a čerstvá zelenina bez pesticídov Vám určite bude chutiť!

column2: Help to clean up your surroundings.
column3: Pomáhajte pri upratovaní svojho okolia.
column4: Each year on World Environment Day, schools and environmental organisations worldwide organise clean up operations. Join one! In addition to enriching the landscape of your neighbourhood, you will learn more about the animals and plants that live nearby.
column5: Každoročne v deň, ktorý bol vyhlásený za Svetový deň životného prostredia, školy a environmentálne organizácie na celom svete organizujú upratovanie okolia. Zapojte sa do niektorej z týchto akcií! Okrem vyčistenia krajiny vo svojom okolí sa dozviete viac informácií o zvieratách, ktoré tam žijú, a rastlinách, ktoré tam rastú.

column2: Looking to add new plants to your garden?
column3: Premýšľajte, aké nové rastliny si vysadíte v záhrade?
column4: Be careful when buying for your garden. People are one of the main introducers of invasive species, especially flora. Many of the invasive species have been introduced for ornamental purposes. Do put an extra effort in finding out whether the plant you want is native to your environment.
column5: Starostlivo si premyslite, čo do záhrady vysadíte. Ľudia zavádzajú najviac inváznych druhov, najmä rastlín. Mnohé invázne druhy sa začali vysádzať na okrasné účely. Neleňte a zistite, či je rastlina, ktorú chcete vysadiť, prirodzenou súčasťou prostredia.

column2: Buy locally-produced fresh produce
column3: Kupujte čerstvú zeleninu a ovocie, ktoré sú vypestované vo vašom okolí,
column4: either directly from the farmer or at a local fruit and vegetable market. Seasonal food is good for you and the environment. Cutting the number of kilometres your food has travelled and avoiding packaging reduces pollution and waste.
column5: a to buď priamo od pestovateľa alebo na miestnom trhu s ovocím a zeleninou. Sezónne potraviny sú dobré pre Vás i pre životné prostredie. Zníži sa tým množstvo obalov a počet kilometrov, ktoré musia potraviny prekonať, kým sa dostanú k Vám, čím sa zníži aj znečistenie a množstvo odpadu.

column2: Where possible, switch to organic food!
column3: Orientujte sa na organické potraviny!
column4: Organic food production uses no synthetic pesticides, produces slightly less greenhouse gases and usually leaves more room for biodiversity in agricultural areas.
column5: Pri organickej produkcii potravín sa nepoužívajú žiadne syntetické pesticídy, vytvára sa o niečo menej skleníkových plynov a zvyčajne sa ponecháva väčší priestor pre biodiverzitu v poľnohospodárskych oblastiach.

column2: Eat meat in moderation!
column3: Jedzte mäso s mierou!
column4: If you're a meat eater, consider reducing your meat consumption and going for quality rather than quantity. Production of meat consumes enormous amounts of energy, not only for the growth and transport of animal feed, but also for the heating, air conditioning, and lighting of the immense animal farms. Changing to a diet with less meat helps the environment, but is also good for your health. It is best to buy meat from local producers and buy organic too.
column5: Ak jete mäso, pouvažujte o obmedzení jeho konzumácie a namiesto množstva hľadaj kvalitu. Pri produkcii mäsa sa spotrebuje obrovské množstvo energie nielen na pestovanie a prepravu krmiva pre zvieratá, ale aj na vykurovanie, vetranie a osvetlenie fariem na chov hospodárskych zvierat. Ak budete jesť menej mäsa, pomôžete nielen životnému prostrediu, ale aj svojmu zdraviu. Najlepšie je kupovať potraviny od miestnych výrobcov, ideálne organické potraviny.

column2: Disposable napkins are often given out for free but this is no reason to waste them.
column3: Servítky na jedno použitie sa často dávajú bezplatne, ale to ešte nie je dôvod, aby sme nimi plytvali.
column4: Instead of taking a handful, one or two should be more than enough. Be reasonable and trees will thank you for it!
column5: Namiesto toho, aby ste si ich zobrali za celú hrsť, mali by Vám stačiť jeden či dva. Správajte sa rozumne a stromy sa Vám za to poďakujú!

column2: Eat fruit and vegetables that are in season.
column3: Jedávajte sezónne ovocie a zeleninu.
column4: They taste better, are healthier for you, and their cultivation has less impact on the environment.
column5: Lepšie chutia, sú zdravšie a ich pestovanie má menší vplyv na životné prostredie.

column2: Consider your dairy consumption.
column3: Zamyslite sa nad tým, koľko mlieka a mliečnych výrobkov spotrebujete.
column4: The production of butter, cheese and other dairy products with high fat content accounts for high greenhouse gas emissions as well as for eutrophication of groundwater, rivers and seas. Remember: Globally, around 70 % of all agricultural land is used for livestock production.
column5: Výroba masla, syra a iných mliečnych výrobkov s vysokým obsahom tuku znamená vysokú produkciu skleníkových plynov, ako aj eutrofizáciu podzemných vôd, riek a morí. Zapamätajte si: 70 % všetkej poľnohospodárskej pôdy na svete sa používa na chov dobytka.

column2: Invest in a lunch box.
column3: Investujte do nádoby na potraviny.
column4: If needed use cling film and paper instead of aluminium foil when you prepare your lunch. Reducing the amount of materials you use will reduce the amount of rubbish you throw away and this is good news for the environment!
column5: Ak potrebujete ďalší obal, keď si pripravujete desiatu, použite radšej fóliu a papier ako alobal. Znížením množstva materiálov, ktoré používame, sa znižuje množstvo odpadkov, ktoré vyhadzujeme, čo je dobré pre životné prostredie.

column2: Don't start a washing machine unless it is fully loaded with laundry or dishes.
column3: Nepúšťajte práčku ani umývačku riadu, ak nie sú úplne plné.
column4: Its energy and water consumption will be the same whether it's full or empty so you might as well optimise its cycle.
column5: Spotreba energie bude rovnaká, či sú prázdne alebo plné, takže cyklus môžete optimálne využiť.

column2: Let your hot food cool down before putting it in the refrigerator
column3: Skôr ako odložíte jedlo do chladničky, nechajte ho najprv vychladnúť
column4: and defrost food from the freezer in the fridge. Both will save you money on your energy bill. Also, remember to keep the fridge door open for only as long as you need it.
column5: a jedlo z mrazničky rozmrazujte v chladničke. V oboch prípadoch ušetríte peniaze za faktúry za elektrinu. Nenechávajte dvere chladničky otvorené dlhšie ako treba.

column2: Take a shower rather than a bath!
column3: Uprednostnite sprchovanie pred kúpaním!
column4: This way you can cut your water consumption by a third! Pause the water flow when soaping and avoid long showers. A shower uses about 30 to 80 litres, while a bath uses 150 to 200 litres of precious water. Install low-flow shower heads and think before buying a power shower.
column5: Takto sa Vaša spotreba vody zníži trojnásobne! Kým sa budete mydliť, zastavte vodu a nesprchujte sa zbytočne dlho. Pri sprchovaní sa minie 30 až 80 litrov, zatiaľ čo pri kúpaní 150 až 200 litrov vzácnej vody. Namontujte úsporné sprchové hadice a dobre si rozmyslite nákup elektrickej sprchy.

column2: Got lime scale to remove?
column3: Potrebujete odstrániť vodný kameň?
column4: Instead of chemical products, try using vinegar to remove lime scale from tiles, taps, kettles and irons.
column5: Na odstraňovanie vodného kameňa z obkladačiek, vodovodných kohútikov, kanvíc a žehličiek použite namiesto chemických prípravkov ocot.

column2: Buy eco-friendly dishwashing detergent.
column3: Kúpte ekologický saponát na umývanie riadu.
column4: It is largely biodegradable, less polluting to aquatic habitats and just as effective a cleaning agent as less environmentally friendly options. Look for eco-friendly dishwashing detergents, such as those labelled with the European flower eco-label (see www.eco-label.com to find one in your country).
column5: Je lepšie biologicky rozložiteľný, v menšej miere znečisťuje vodné prostredie a predstavuje rovnako účinný čistiaci prostriedok ako alternatívy menej priaznivé k životnému prostrediu. Hľadajte ekologické prípravky na umývanie riadu, napríklad tie, ktoré sú označené európskou ekologickou značkou kvetiny (informácie o výrobkoch v konkrétnej krajine nájdete na adrese www.eco-label.com ).

column2: Planning to renovate your house or apartment?
column3: Plánujete renováciu domu či bytu?
column4: Look for ways to reduce the energy consumption for heating and cooling, for example by sealing windows and doors, insulation or changing the windows. Today it is possible to build ‘carbon neutral’ houses.
column5: Hľadajte spôsoby zníženia spotreby energie na kúrenie a chladenie, napríklad utesnením okien a dverí, izoláciou alebo výmenou okien. Dnes už existuje možnosť postaviť si tzv. uhlíkovo neutrálny dom.

column2: In the market for a new printer?
column3: Chystáte sa kúpiť si novú tlačiareň?
column4: When buying a new printer consider one that allows ink cartridges to be refilled with rechargeable kits. It is very cost effective and environmentally friendly. If this is not applicable to your printer remember to recycle your used cartridges by returning them to the shop where you buy the new ones.
column5: Keď budete kupovať novú tlačiareň, vyberte si takú, ktorá umožňuje opakované napĺňanie atramentových kaziet z vymeniteľnej súpravy. Takéto prístroje sú nákladovo efektívne a šetrné k životnému prostrediu. Ak sa vo Vašom modeli kazety nedajú znova naplniť, recyklujte ich tak, že ich vrátite do predajne, v ktorej ste kúpili nové kazety.

column2: Invest in rechargeable batteries instead of buying disposable ones.
column3: Investujte do nabíjateľných batérií namiesto toho, aby ste zakaždým kupovali nové.
column4: You will save money in the long term. You can also buy solar powered rechargers if you want to reduce your environmental impact even further.
column5: Z dlhodobého hľadiska ušetríte. Ak chcete ešte viac znížiť vplyv na životné prostredie, môžete si kúpiť solárnu nabíjačku.

column2: Say no to disposable products!
column3: Nepoužívajte jednorazové výrobky!
column4: We're using an increasing number of one-use products such as plastic razors, cups, paper towels, wipes, nappies, plastic bags, paper napkins and even disposable cameras to name a few. Not only do they usually cost more in the long-run, they involve the consumption of more resources and energy than their reusable alternatives.
column5: Používame príliš veľa jednorazových výrobkov, ako napríklad plastové holiace strojčeky, poháre, papierové utierky, handry, plienky, igelitové tašky, papierové servítky a dokonca aj jednorazové fotoaparáty, a to sme spomenuli len niekoľko z nich. Nielenže nás z dlhodobého hľadiska stoja viac, ale pri ich výrobe sa spotrebuje viac prírodných zdrojov a energie, ako pri podobných výrobkoch, ktoré môžeme používať opakovane.

column2: When shopping for new electronics, favour products with low energy use.
column3: Pri nákupe elektroniky uprednostnite výrobky s nízkou spotrebou energie.
column4: You can use energy labels (A++, A+, A, B) for guidance, and for office electronics the Energy Star label. In the long-run, they will save you money on your electricity bill. To find out what products are included, go to EU's website: www.eu-energystar.org.
column5: Nájdete ich podľa energetického označenia (A++, A+, A, B) a pri kancelárskej elektronike podľa značky Energy Star. V oboch prípadoch ušetríte peniaze za elektrinu. Zoznam zahrnutých výrobkov nájdete na webovej stránke EÚ: www.eu-energystar.org.

column2: Close the loop!
column3: Uzavrite kruh!
column4: Purchase products made from recycled materials. Who else should buy all the products made from the stuff you throw into the recycling bins?
column5: Nakupujte výrobky z recyklovaných materiálov. Kto iný by mal kupovať všetky výrobky z vecí, ktoré ste vyhodili do kontajnerov na recyklovaný odpad?

column2: When preparing a good meal, buy Fairtrade!
column3: Ak chcete pripraviť dobré jedlo, kupujte výrobky so značkou Fairtrade.
column4: Fairtrade ensures Southern producers get their fair share. There are also many products which are certified Fairtrade and organic at the same time.
column5: Značka Fairtrade je zárukou, že južní výrobcovia dostanú spravodlivý podiel. Existuje veľa výrobkov, ktoré majú značku Fairtrade aj osvedčenie o organickom pôvode

column2: Don't forget about your local shops.
column3: Nezabúdajte na miestne obchody.
column4: New supermarkets in the area can reduce business for smaller shops. Pollution and congestion would be significantly less if consumers frequented their local shops, rather than travelling long distances to out-of-town shopping centres.
column5: Nové supermarkety môžu odlákať zákazníkov malých obchodov v príslušnej oblasti. Znečistenie a dopravné zápchy budú určite menšie, ak spotrebitelia uprednostnia miestne obchody pred cestami do vzdialených mimomestských nákupných stredísk.

column2: Buy lasting potted flowers!
column3: Kupujte kvetiny v kvetináčoch, ktoré dlho vydržia!
column4: When the urge to give flowers takes you, choose a potted plant from a local supplier. A lot of exotic flowers are grown in greenhouses great distances away. Aside from the issue of transport, there can be high social and environmental costs. For example, in Colombia, the flower industry uses enormous quantities of polluting pesticides, and in Kenya, horticulture requires a lot of water which reduces local water resources. As an alternative ask your flower shop for Fairtrade or organically produced flowers.
column5: Ak potrebujete darovať kvet, vyberte si kvet v kvetináči od miestneho dodávateľa. Mnohé exotické kvety sa pestujú ďaleko v skleníkoch. Okrem problému s dopravou môžu byť príčinou vysokých sociálnych a environmentálnych nákladov. Napríklad kvetinársky priemysel v Kolumbii používa nadmerné množstvo znečisťujúcich pesticídov alebo záhradníctvo v Keni používa veľa vody, čím znižuje miestne zásoby. Ako alternatívu v kvetinárstve žiadajte kvety so značkou Fairtrade alebo ekologicky vypestované kvety.

column2: Buy your music as electronic files online and pollute less!
column3: Kupujte si pesničky on-line ako elektronické súbory a znížte tak znečistenie!
column4: You will save a trip to the music store as well as reducing the use of CDs, plastic boxes, packaging and transportation, not to mention some money.
column5: Ušetríte si cestu do hudobnej predajne a nemusíte platiť za nosiče CD, umelohmotné škatule a obaly, ako aj náklady na ich prepravu, nehovoriac o tom, že ušetríte aj nejaké peniaze.

column2: Buy what you need and not what you want!
column3: Kupujte si to, čo potrebujete, a nie to, čo chcete!
column4: If everyone on earth lived a European lifestyle, we would need three planets to supply all the resources. Do not fall into the trap of consumerism and make a shopping list of items you need rather than picking up unnecessary items that you think you need. This will also save you money.
column5: Keby každý na Zemi žil európskym životným štýlom, na prírodné zdroje by sme potrebovali tri takéto planéty. Nenechajte sa zlákať konzumným spôsobom života a dopredu si píšte zoznam vecí, ktoré potrebujete kúpiť, namiesto toho, aby ste kupovali zbytočnosti, o ktorých si myslíte, že ich potrebujete. Navyše ušetríte peniaze.

column2: Upgrade your computer!
column3: Zmodernizujte si svoj počítač!
column4: The EEA has upgraded their office PCs with additional memory space. This way, the life-time of the computers was extended by another two years and avoided a lot of electronic waste.
column5: Agentúra EEA zmodernizovala osobné počítače v kanceláriách a rozšírila pamäťový priestor. Predĺžila tak životnosť počítačov o ďalšie dva roky a ušetrila množstvo elektronického odpadu.

column2: Dispose medical waste properly!
column3: Nezabúdajte na správnu likvidáciu zdravotníckeho odpadu!
column4: Landfills or sewage systems are not the place for old medication. Instead, dispose them at designated disposal stations or take them back to your pharmacist.
column5: Skládky ani kanalizácia nie sú miestom pre staré lieky. Namiesto toho lieky odovzdajte na označených miestach alebo vráťte späť do lekárne.

column2: Don't throw away your printer cartridges.
column3: Nevyhadzujte tlačové kazety.
column4: Instead, recycle them! Most office supply stores make it possible to turn in your old, used cartridges when buying new ones.
column5: Recyklujte ich! Väčšina predajní s kancelárskym spotrebným materiálom umožňuje pri nákupe nových kaziet atramentu vrátiť staré použité kazety.

column2: Got bulky waste to dispose of?
column3: Potrebujete zlikvidovať objemný odpad?
column4: When you'd like to get rid of large waste items, take it to a drop-off centre or contact a special company to come and pick it up. The professionals will segregate and possibly recycle your waste. Some products, including refrigerators and other electric appliances, have to be recycled properly not to pollute the environment. You can also use the internet or newspapers to sell goods which still have some value.
column5: Ak sa chcete zbaviť objemných vecí, odovzdajte ich na zbernom mieste alebo sa obráťte na špecializovanú firmu, ktorá ich odvezie. Odborníci odpad roztriedia a podľa možností recyklujú. Niektoré výrobky (napríklad chladničky a iné elektrické prístroje) sa musia správne recyklovať, aby neznečistili životné prostredie. Veci, ktoré ešte majú nejakú hodnotu, môžete predať na internete alebo prostredníctvom miestnych novín.

column2: When the time comes to change your car battery, recycle your old one.
column3: Keď nastane čas na výmenu autobatérie, starú batériu recyklujte.
column4: Check with your local authorities for their advice as they might recommend that you take it to a special disposal site, or to a garage which collects them for recycling and proper disposal.
column5: Požiadajte o radu miestne orgány, ktoré Vám môžu odporučiť špecializované zberné miesto či servis, ktoré takéto batérie zbierajú, recyklujú a správne likvidujú.

column2: Dispose of toxic materials properly!
column3: Nezabúdajte na správnu likvidáciu toxických látok!
column4: The best way to dispose of paint is to deliver it to your local specialist waste recycling centre. If you do not have access to one of these, let the paint dry fully, adding sawdust or cat litter as needed, before putting it in the dustbin. Don't throw it down the drain, because it is toxic and it interferes with the processes of water treatment plants.
column5: Najlepší spôsob likvidácie farby je odovzdať ju v miestnom špecializovanom stredisku recyklácie odpadu. Ak sa vo Vašom okolí žiadne takéto stredisko nenachádza, nechajte farbu úplne vyschnúť, nasypte do nej podľa potreby piliny alebo stelivo pre mačky a potom vyhoďte do odpadkového koša. Nevylievajte ju do kanalizácie, pretože je toxická a bráni činnosti čističky odpadových vôd.

column2: Dripping oil?
column3: Kvapká vám z auta olej?
column4: Did you know that most of oil pollution in our oceans is the result of human activity on land and not tanker spills? If you notice oil leaking from your car, fix it right away! Never dispose of used oil into a storm drain.
column5: Viete o tom, že na znečistení oceánov ropnými látkami sa nepodieľajú ani tak havárie tankerov, ako vo väčšine prípadov ľudská činnosť na súši? Ak zistíte, že vám z auta kvapká olej, ihneď poruchu opravte. Použitý olej nikdy nevylievajte do verejnej kanalizácie.

column2: Think twice before buying more toys for your children.
column3: Dobre si zamyslite pred tým, ako svojim deťom nakúpite ďalšie hračky.
column4: Many of them are used only very shortly and then thrown away. Go for high-quality, long-lasting toys that can be used by several generations of children. Selling old toys on a flea market can give your toys a second life and can be much fun for you and the kids.
column5: S mnohými sa hrajú len krátko a vyhodia ich. Nakupujte veľmi kvalitné a trvanlivé hračky, s ktorými sa môže hrať niekoľko generácií. Ak hračky predáte na burze, znovu ožijú a určite to bude zábavné pre vás aj vaše deti.

column2: Get in shape and be friendly to the environment all at once!
column3: Zlepšite si fyzickú kondíciu a zároveň urobte niečo dobré pre životné prostredie!
column4: Journeys of less than 3 km may take less time if you walk, use a bike or even take the bus. If taking your kids along, try using a skateboard, skipping rope, rollerblades or buggy boards! Remember how much fun it was when you were a kid.
column5: Cesty na vzdialenosť maximálne 3 km budú trvať kratšie, ak pôjdete peši, na bicykli alebo autobusom. Ak so sebou vezmete deti, nezabudnite na skateboard, švihadlo, kolieskové korčule či kočík. Pamätáte si, koľko zábavy ste si v detstve užili?

column2: Walk or cycle: Set a good example!
column3: Buďte dobrým príkladom!
column4: Walk or cycle to your work as much as it is possible and you’ll set your kids a good example. Encourage them to walk, cycle or take the bus when going to and from school each day! Both their health and the environment will benefit.
column5: Vždy keď je to možné, choďte do práce pešo alebo na bicykli a budete deťom dobrým príkladom. Povzbudzujte ich, aby do školy a zo školy chodili pešo, na bicykli či autobusom. Získa tým ich zdravie aj životné prostredie.

column2: Car pool!
column3: Dohodnite sa na vzájomnom odvoze autom.
column4: If you live far away from school, instead of driving your kids to and from school each day, start a car pooling initiative with the other parents and share the responsibility. It will save you time, petrol and help the environment.
column5: Ak bývate ďaleko od školy, nevozte deti do školy a zo školy každý deň autom, ale dohodnite sa s ostatnými rodičmi na vzájomnej výpomoci a vozte deti striedavo. Ušetríte čas, benzín a pomôžete životnému prostrediu.

column2: Keep your tyres properly inflated.
column3: Dbajte na správne nahustenie pneumatík.
column4: This will reduce wear and tear on them and increase their longevity, thereby saving money. It also saves precious raw material: it takes 27 litres of crude oil to produce a new tire. Under-inflated tyres also increase fuel consumption by up to 10%. Check your tyres at least once a month. It takes but a few minutes.
column5: Menej sa ojazdia, predĺži sa ich životnosť a vy ušetríte peniaze. Navyše sa ušetria vzácne suroviny: na výrobu novej pneumatiky sa spotrebuje 27 litrov ropy. Nedostatočne nahustené pneumatiky zvyšujú spotrebu pohonných hmôt až o 10 %. Pneumatiky kontrolujte minimálne raz mesačne. Trvá to len niekoľko minút.

column2: Share your automobile!
column3: Využívajte automobil spoločne!
column4: If you have to use a car to get to work, sign up to a car sharing scheme.
column5: Ak musíte do práce dochádzať autom, zapojte sa do systému spoliočného využívania vozidiel.

column2: Slow down!
column3: Spomaľte!
column4: When driving your car, drive steadily and anticipate what is coming up. Avoid rapid accelerations and breaking as much as possible. This will decrease your car’s fuel consumption.
column5: Vedeniu vozidla venujte maximálnu pozornosť a snažte sa predvídať, čo príde. Podľa možností sa vyhýbajte prudkému zrýchľovaniu a brzdeniu. Zníži sa tak spotreba pohonných hmôt.

column2: Have your oil changed by a professional.
column3: Výmenu oleja zverte odborníkovi.
column4: Take your car to a garage to have the oil changed. They will collect the used oil and recycle it.
column5: Pri výmene oleja zavezte auto do servisu. Zbierajú tam použitý olej a recyklujú ho.

column2: If travelling by plane, off-set your CO2 emissions.
column3: Keď letíte lietadlom, kompenzujte hodnotu emisií CO2.
column4: Many airlines and travel agencies offer carbon-credit schemes in their services.
column5: Mnohé letecké spoločnosti a cestovné kancelárie ponúkajú v rámci služieb systém uhlíkových kreditov.

column2: Innovate!
column3: Modernizujte!
column4: Encourage your workplace to develop a sustainable transport policy for business trips. You can buy carbon credits to off-set flights, minimise physical meetings involving travel by using conference or video-calls or take a sleeper train instead of flying.
column5: Zasaďte sa o to, aby na vašom pracovisku platila zásada využívania trvalo udržateľnej dopravy pri služobných cestách. Ako náhradu za lety môžete zakúpiť uhlíkové kredity a minimalizovať osobné stretnutia formou cestovania využitím konferenčných hovorov alebo video hovorov, prípadne namiesto lietadla využite spací vozeň.

column2: Save paper by setting your printer to print double sided by default.
column3: Nastavte východiskové nastavenie tlačiarne na obojstrannú tlač a ušetríte papier.
column4: You can also print two pages per page if it remains legible. The EEA has introduced double-side default printing, which reduced the Agency’s paper consumption by around 17 % from 2004 to 2005.
column5: Podobne môžete vytlačiť dve strany v rámci jednej, ak bude text čitateľný. Agentúra EEA má dvojstrannú tlač nastavenú ako východiskovú, čím v rokoch 2004 až 2005 obmedzila spotrebu papiera o 17 %.

column2: Turn the heat down!
column3: Nekúrte toľko!
column4: Comfortable room temperature is 19 °C, but 15 °C is just perfect for bedrooms, as it can help you sleep better. Remember to turn the heating off if you're leaving for the holidays!
column5: Vhodná teplota v miestnosti je 19 °C, v spálni dokonca 15 °C, pretože sa Vám bude lepšie zaspávať. Keď cestujete na dovolenku či prázdniny, nezabudnite vypnúť kúrenie.

column2: To save on your domestic energy consumption,
column3: Ak chcete znížiť spotrebu energie vo svojej domácnosti,
column4: make your radiators more efficient by placing reflective panels or sheets of aluminum foil behind them as this will bounce the heat back into the room.
column5: zefektívnite činnosť radiátorov a umiestnite za ne reflexné panely, platne alebo hliníkovú fóliu. Budú odrážať teplo späť do miestnosti.

column2: Do not position your fridge or freezer near a heat source,
column3: Neumiestňujte chladničku alebo mrazničku do blízkosti zdroja tepla,
column4: such as a stove or radiator, or even a south-facing window, as it will lead to increased electricity consumption.
column5: ako je rúra či radiátor, dokonca ani k oknu, ktoré je obrátené na juh, pretože by sa zvýšila spotreba.

column2: If you own an old refrigerator and freezer,
column3: Ak máte starú chladničku či mrazničku,
column4: defrost them at least every six months. Even better –  replace them with new models, which have automatic defrost cycles and are generally up to twice more energy-efficient.
column5: minimálne každých šesť mesiacov ju odmrazte. Ešte lepšie bude, ak ju vymeníte za niektorý z nových modelov s automatickým odmrazovaním, ktoré sú všeobecne dvakrát energeticky účinnejšie.

column2: Turn down your hot water thermostat
column3: Nastavte termostat na teplú vodu na nižšiu hodnotu
column4: – it doesn't need to be set higher than 60 ºC. The same goes for the boiler of your central heating. Remember, 70 % of the energy used by households in the EU is spent on heating homes and another 14 % – on heating water.
column5: – nemusí byť vyššia ako 60 ºC. To isté sa týka bojlera ústredného kúrenia. Zapamätaj si, že 70 % energie spotrebovanej domácnosťami v EÚ je určených na kúrenie a 14 % na ohrievanie vody.

column2: Don't forget to switch off the lights.
column3: Nezabúdajte vypínať svetlá!
column4: Switching off five lights in hallways and rooms in your house – when you don't need them – can save around EUR 60 a year! This prevents the release of approximately 400 kg of CO2 gas in one year.
column5: Ak zhasnete päť svetiel na chodbe a v jednotlivých miestnostiach domu (keď ich nepotrebujete), môžeš ušetriť až 60 EUR ročne. Zabránite tak uvoľneniu približne 400 kg CO2 ročne.

column2: Don't forget to unplug your battery chargers
column3: Nezabudnite vytiahnuť nabíjačku batérií zo zásuvky,
column4: after you've finished charging your mobile phone or laptop. If left plugged in, they continue to consume energy.
column5: keď si nabijete mobilný telefón alebo prenosný počítač. Ak ich necháte zapojené, budú ďalej spotrebovávať energiu.

column2: Try to cool off without resorting to air conditioning.
column3: Na ochladenie miestnosti používajte iné prostriedky ako klimatizáciu.
column4: The use of A/C can increase your electricity bill by 33 %. A fan requires one tenth of the energy used by an A/C system; sunshades, blinds, shutters and the cool of the night use no energy at all.
column5: Použitie klimatizácie môže zvýšiť účty za elektrinu až o 33 %. Ventilátor spotrebuje len jednu desatinu energie klimatizačnej sústavy; tienidlá, žalúzie, rolety a nočný chlad nespotrebujú žiadnu energiu.

column2: If you can, change your electricity supplier,
column3: Ak je to možné, zmeňte dodávateľa elektriny.
column4: switch over to the one that offers part of your energy supply from renewable sources. It will send the right message to energy companies.
column5: Využite služby takého dodávateľa, ktorý dodáva časť energie z obnoviteľných zdrojov. To bude ten správny signál pre energetické spoločnosti.

column2: Put a lid on your pots when cooking.
column3: Pri varení používajte pokrievky.
column4: You can save up to a quarter of the energy needed for preparing the dish. Pressure cookers and steamers are even better: they can save around 70 %!
column5: Ušetríte až štvrtinu energie potrebnej na prípravu jedla. Ešte lepšie sú tlakové a parné hrnce: ušetria až 70 % energie!

column2: Our waste can produce lighting,
column3: Odpad sa dá použiť na osvetlenie,
column4: electricity, heat and even jobs!  Remember to recycle what you no longer need.
column5: výrobu elektriny, tepla, dokonca tvorbu pracovných miest. Nezabudnite recyklovať všetko, čo už nebudete potrebovať.

column2: Get on the move and cycle, walk or use public transport!
column3: Pohybujte sa: jazdite na bicykli, choďte pešo, využívajte hromadnú dopravu!
column4: You'll improve your health and lessen your impact on the environment. Remember that for each litre of fuel burnt in a car engine, more than 2.5 kg of CO2 is released into the atmosphere.
column5: Budete zdravší a znížite záťaž na životné prostredie. Zapamätajte si, že každý liter paliva spáleného v motore automobilu uvoľní do ovzdušia viac ako 2,5 kg CO2.

column2: Lonely drive to work?
column3: Jazdíte do zamestnania autom a ste v ňom sami?
column4: Car-pooling with your colleagues will lessen your impact on the environment, save you money and let you travel in the company of others.  Ask which of your colleagues live nearby and take turns driving to work.
column5: Zdieľanie vozidla s kolegami zníži záťaž na životné prostredie, ušetrí peniaze a umožní Vám získať spolucestujúcich. Zistite, ktorý z kolegov býva blízko vás a striedajte sa pri jazdách do zamestnania.

column2: Buying a new car?
column3: Chcete si kúpiť nové auto?
column4: Why not buy one of the new generation vehicles?  A hybrid car consumes between 20 % and 30 % less fuel and generates far less CO2 than a classical vehicle. So why not pollute less and save money – all at once?
column5: Čo keby ste si kúpili niektoré z vozidiel novej generácie? Hybridné autá spotrebujú o 20 až 30 % menej paliva a vytvoria oveľa menej CO2 ako klasické vozidlá. Môžete súčasne menej znečisťovať prostredie a ušetriť viac peňazí.

column2: During cold winter days, don’t warm up your car's engine while idle.
column3: V studených zimných dňoch nezahrievajte motor, ktorý beží naprázdno.
column4: It's safe to start the journey with a cold engine, and you will save on fuel.
column5: Bude bezpečnejšie, ak sa na jazdu vydáte so studeným motorom a navyše ušetríte za palivo.

column2: Off for the weekend with the family?
column3: Odchádzate s celou rodinou na víkend?
column4: To avoid traffic jams and the related stress, not to mention polluting, why not consider other transportation alternatives?  After all, trains are more comfortable!
column5: Ak sa chcete vyhnúť dopravným zápcham a súvisiacemu stresu (nehovoriac o znečistení), zvážte alternatívne dopravné prostriedky. Veď vlaky sú oveľa pohodlnejšie!

column2: Yet another flight for a business meeting?
column3: Plánujete ďalšiu cestu lietadlom na obchodné stretnutie?
column4: Develop a habit of considering telephone or video-conferencing first!
column5: Zvykajte si na to, že budete uvažovať o telefonickej konferencii alebo videokonferencii ako o prvej možnosti.

column2: Keep on the move!
column3: Gættu þess að fá næga hreyfingu!
column4: Instead of taking the car: walk, cycle, take the bus or use the underground. You will not only keep fit but also help reduce traffic, air pollution, noise and accidents.
column5: Í stað þess að aka er ráðlegt að ganga, hjóla eða fara með strætisvagni. Með því móti bætir þú heilsuna en, að auki dregur þú úr umferð, loftmengun, hávaða og dregur úr slysahættu.

column2: Got an errand to run?
column3: Þarftu að bregða þér frá til að útrétta eitthvað?
column4: Cars often pollute more on short trips when the motor is cold, so try to walk or cycle instead.
column5: Bílar menga meira á stuttum leiðum því þá er vélin enn köld. Þú ættir að ganga eða hjóla í stað þess að aka.

column2: Don’t skip regular check-ups of your car.
column3: Slepptu ekki reglulegu eftirliti með bílnum.
column4: Inspect your car regularly for the emissions it generates. Catalytic converters need regular maintenance.
column5: Láttu athuga afgasið frá bílvélinni reglulega. Hvarfakútar þurfa reglulegt viðhald.

column2: Going to work?
column3: Hvernig ferðu í vinnuna?
column4: Consider carpooling or using public transport rather than your own car. If driving, ask around the office which of your colleagues lives near you and whether you can share lifts.
column5: Hugleiddu hvort ekki væri betra að sameinast um bíl eða almenningsvagna í stað eigin bíls.

column2: Think twice before buying a new car.
column3: Hugsaðu þig vel um áður en þú kaupir nýjan bíl.
column4: It might be more efficient to use alternatives for transport rather than keeping a car only for weekend trips.
column5: Það gæti verið betra að nota annan ferðamáta í stað þess að eiga bíl sem bara er notaður til helgarferða.

column2: Bicycles produce neither greenhouse gases nor pollution
column3: Reiðhjólum fylgja hvorki gróðurhúsalofttegundir né mengun
column4: and are therefore the least polluting mode of transport.
column5: og því eru þær sá ferðamátinn sem minnst mengar.

column2: Use bicycle couriers!
column3: Hagnýttu þér sendil á reiðhjóli!
column4: If you run a business and need to deliver mail and parcels regularly around town, use a bicycle courier service if one is available. Bicycles bypass traffic; are quick; and you will contribute to the improvement of urban air quality in your area.
column5: Ef þú rekur fyrirtæki og sendir póst og böggla reglulega  innanbæjar, ættir þú að hagnýta þjónustu sendlaþjónustu. Reiðhjól stöðvast ekki í umferðinni, komast fljótt á áfangastað og draga úr loftmengun í þéttbýli.

column2: Did you know that you can reduce air pollution by recycling your waste?
column3: Veistu að þú getur dregið úr loftmengun með því að endurnýta sorp?
column4: By recycling glass, paper, batteries, engine oil and aluminium cans, these materials can be re-used, and you will reduce the volume of waste incinerated by up to 70%.
column5: Með því að senda gler, pappír, rafhlöður, vélarolíu og áldósir í endurnýtingu er hægt að minnka magn sorps sem fer í brennslu um allt að 70%.

column2: On very hot days use public transport rather than your car.
column3: Skildu bílinn eftir heima og farðu með almenningsvagni ef mjög heitt er í veðri.
column4: Car exhaust emissions react with sunlight and heat to cause polluting gases such as tropospheric ozone. This is the main ingredient of poor air quality and photo-chemical smog, which can cause breathing difficulties.
column5: Afgas bíla hvarfast við önnur efni fyrir tilstilli sólarljóss og hita. Þannig verða til mengandi lofttegundir eins og veðrahvolfsóson, sem er uppistaðan í loftmengun og ljósefnafræðilegu "smoggi", en það getur gert fólki erfitt um andardrátt.

column2: Think first before buying a Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV).
column3: Hugsaðu þig vel um áður en þú kaupir SUV-bíl
column4: In addition to being very expensive to run, SUVs are very fuel inefficient. They emit twice as much carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons and nitrogen dioxide as an average car. These chemicals contribute to air pollution as well as global warming!
column5: Auk þess sem SUV-bílar eru mjög dýrir í rekstri þurfa þeir mjög mikið eldsneyti. Þeir gefa frá sér helmingi meira kolmónoxíð, kolvatnsefni og köfnunarefnisoxíð en venjulegir fólksbílar. Þessi efni auka loftmengun og hnattræna hlýnun.

column2: Fresh water is scarce!
column3: Framboð hreins vatns er takmarkað!
column4: Some 97.5% of water on the Earth is salt water, leaving only 2.5% as fresh water. Of this over two thirds is frozen in glaciers and polar ice caps. The remaining unfrozen fresh water is found mainly as groundwater, with only a small fraction present in rivers, lakes or in the air. Water is a precious resource, use it responsibly and don’t waste it!
column5: Um 97,5% alls vatns á jörðinni er sjór. Afgangurinn, sem er aðeins 2,5%, er ferskt vatn. Af því eru rúmlega tveir þriðju bundnir í jöklum og heimsskautaís. Það sem þá er eftir að ófrosnu, fersku vatni er fyrst og fremst grunnvatn, en aðeins ofurlítið hlutfall er í ám, vötnum og í loftinu.

column2: Turn off the tap!
column3: Skrúfaðu fyrir vatnið!
column4: Avoid wasting water while brushing your teeth or shaving, and save up to 10 litres of water each time. Use a mug of water and turn the tap off so you only use what you need.
column5: Gættu þess að sóa ekki vatninu þegar þú burstar tennurnar eða rakar þig. Með því móti sparast 10 lt. vatns í hvert skipti.

column2: Wash your fruits and vegetables in a bowl of water rather than under a running tap.
column3: Skolaðu ávexti og grænmeti í vatnsskál fremur en í rennandi vatni.
column4: You will save water and will do so further by watering your houseplants with the remaining water.
column5: Þannig sparast vatn og þú sparar meira með því að vökva pottaplönturnar með vatni sem gengur af.

column2: A dripping tap can waste as much as one litre of water per hour.
column3: Úr lekum krana getur komið meira en einn lítri af vatni á klukkutíma.
column4: In one week, that is enough to fill a bathtub. Drinking water is precious. Save it!
column5: Vatnið fyllir baðkar á einni viku. Drykkjarvatnið er dýrmætt og það verður að fara sparlega með það!

column2: Install a water meter to keep track of your water consumption.
column3: Það borgar sig að setja upp vatnsmæli til að fylgjast með neyslunni.
column4: Households with meters tend to be more careful with their water-use and also end up saving money as well.
column5: Þeir sem hafa vatnsmæla fara betur með vatnið og spara peninga um leið.

column2: Thirsty?
column3: Ertu þyrst+B43ur?
column4: Fill a jug with tap water and store it in your fridge rather than waiting for the tap to run cold each time you want a glass of cold water.
column5: Fylltu könnu og settu í kæliskápinn frekar en að láta renna í hvert skipti þar til vatnið er nógu kalt.

column2: Why waste?
column3: Engin ástæða er til að sóa vatni.
column4: Boil only as much water as you need for your cup of coffee or tea.
column5: Sjóddu ekki meira vatn en þarf fyrir bolla af kaffi eða tei.

column2: Take a quick shower instead of a bath.
column3: Farðu í stutt sturtubað í stað þess að leggjast í baðkarið.
column4: Showers require as little as a third of the water! However, this is true as long as you keep them under five minutes long. So be quick and use a shower timer to keep track of time next time you hop in!
column5: Sturtan þarf ekki nema þriðjung vatnsins sem annars þarf! Vertu ekki lengi í sturtunni og notaðu tímamæli í næsta skipti!

column2: Invest in low-flow showerheads to decrease your consumption of water.
column3: Kauptu sturtuhausa með hægu flæði til að draga úr vatnsnotkuninni.
column4: They produce a finer spray and increase the flow of the water while using less of it.
column5: Vatnsúðinn verður fínni, og þótt minna vatn þurfi virðist eins og flæðið sé meira.

column2: Reduce your domestic consumption of water.
column3: Dragðu úr vatnsnotkun heimilisins.
column4: By having aerators and water flow restrictors fitted on your taps, the flow of water will feel stronger, but will consist of less water and more air. Aerated taps can reduce the water flow by 30-40 %.
column5: Ef loftblandari (aerator) er settur á stútinn virðist straumurinn aukast en það er vegna þess að loft blandast vatninu og streymið minnkar við það. Vatnsmagnið getur minnkað um 30 - 40%.

column2: Drop in a hippo!
column3: Minnkaðu rýmið í vatnskassann!
column4: Decrease your toilet’s water-use by dropping a hippo or other displacement device into the cistern. If you’re planning on buying a new toilet, consider a water efficient one with a dual flush.
column5: Minnkaðu magnið sem kemur úr vatnskassanum: Settu í hann einhvern hlut svo að hann taki minna vatn. Ef þú ætlar að kaupa nýtt klósett: Hugleiddu að velja vatnssparandi tæki með tvennskonar skolun.

column2: A leaking toilet could waste as much as 200 litres of water per day.
column3: Ef vatnskassinn lekur geta allt að 200 lítrar farið til spillis á dag.
column4: This is equivalent to flushing your toilet 50 times. Check your toilet for a possible leak.
column5: Það samsvarar því að sturta niður 50 sinnum. Athugaðu hvort kassinn lekur.

column2: Only run the dishwasher when it's completely full.
column3: Ekki setja uppþvottavélina í gang fyrr en hún er orðin alveg full.
column4: In this way, you actually use less water than if you wash the dishes by hand.
column5: Þá þarf í rauninni minna vatn en ef þvegið er upp með höndunum.

column2: Go for the eco-label!
column3: Veldu umhverfismerktar vörur!
column4: When shopping for a new washing machine, look for an energy-efficient model that uses the least amount of water. To find out more, visit the Eco-Label web-site that lists energy-efficient appliances:
column5: Ef þú ætlar að kaupa nýja þvottavél: Veldu vél sem þarf lítið rafmagn og vatn. Skoðaðu vefsvæði Eco-Label en þar eru listar yfir orkusparneytin heimilistæki.

column2: Sounds like common sense, but
column3: Virðist liggja alveg í augum uppi, en
column4: a sure way to save water when doing the laundry is to do less of it! Before starting your washing machine, wait for a full load and check your clothes if they really are dirty; one wear does not always qualify them for a wash.
column5: Sparaðu vatn með því að þvo sjaldnar! Ekki þvo fyrr en vélin er full og þvoðu ekki fatnað nema hann sé í raun óhreinn. Ekki er víst að þvo þurfi flík sem búið er að fara í einu sinni.

column2: Don't flush
column3: Ekki sturta
column4: cotton-balls, cotton-swabs and make-up tissues down the toilet. Instead dispose of them in the bin where they belong.
column5: niður baðmullarhnoðrum, pappírsþurrkur fyrir andlitsfarða o.þh. Allt slíkt á heima í ruslafötu baðherbergisins.

column2: Water your garden in the late evening or early morning.
column3: Vökvaðu garðinn seint á kvöldin eða snemma á morgnana.
column4: During those cooler hours, less water is lost through evaporation and as a result plants will absorb more of it.
column5: Þá er svalara, minna gufar upp af vatni og gróðurinn fær meira.

column2: The water hose in your garden can release as much as 18 litres of water a minute.
column3: Í gegnum garðslönguna fara allt að 18 lítrar á mínútu.
column4: Use a traditional watering can instead and significantly reduce the water wasted. Alternatively, you can fit the hose with a trigger gun to control the water-flow.
column5: Notaðu í staðinn venjulega garðkönnu. Þannig sparast mikið vatn. Einnig er hægt að setja skammtara með gikk á slönguendann og stýra þannig flæðinu.

column2: Soak, don’t sprinkle!
column3: Betra er að metta á réttum stöðum en að úða allt!
column4: When gardening, soak the roots of your plants twice a week instead of sprinkling water on them each day. This way much more water is absorbed instead of evaporating.
column5: Vökvaðu ræturnar tvisvar á viku í stað þess að úða daglega. Þá gufar miklu minna upp, en gróðurinn fær meira vatn.

column2: If you let your lawn grow longer, it will require less water.
column3: Ef þú slærð sjaldnar þarf minna vatn.
column4: Taller grass encourages deeper roots and shades the soil to reduce moisture loss.
column5: Hátt gras eflir vöxt rótanna og veitir jarðveginum skugga sem dregur úr uppgufun.

column2: Collect rainwater
column3: Safnaðu regnvatninu
column4: for watering your garden instead of using precious drinking water from the tap. Also, remember to check the weather forecast before watering the garden; it may be about to rain.
column5: og notaðu það til að vökva garðinn og sparaðu í staðinn dýrmætt drykkjarvatn úr krananum. Gáðu til veðurs áður en þú vökvar; kannski rignir bráðum.

column2: Hand-wash your car with a bucket, sponge and soap.
column3: Handþvoðu bílinn; notaðu fötu, svamp og sápu.
column4: You’ll use up only a few litres of water compared to a commercial car wash which can use from 32 to 150 litres each time. You can achieve the same result, but with far less water.
column5: Þú þarft ekki nema nokkra lítra af vatni. Berðu það saman við að á bílaþvottastöð þarf 32 til 150 lítra í hvert skipti. Árangurinn er jafngóður en mikið vatn sparast.

column2: Mulch your plants – indoors and outdoors.
column3: Leggðu moð að rótum plantna, úti og inni.
column4: It will keep weeds away; protect the plants by keeping the soil cool; decrease evaporation and reduce soil compaction. Be creative and use materials like: pebbles, bark chippings, gravel, cocoa shells, decorative pine cones, marbles, broken crockery, grass clippings or leaf mould. But avoid mulching too close to the stems to avoid the plant rotting in winter.
column5: Þannig er illgresi bægt frá; verndaðu plönturnar með því að veita jarðveginum svala. Þannig minnkar þú uppgufunina og þjappaðu jarðveginum minna saman. Beittu ímyndunaraflinu og notaðu efni eins og: smáhnullunga, börk, möl, kókoshnetur, greniköngla, glerkúlur, brotið leirtau, klippt gras eða visnað lauf. Forðastu samt að leggja moð of vel upp að leggjum plantna svo að þeir fúni ekki yfir veturinn.

column2: If you have a garden, creating a pond is a great way to boost biodiversity.
column3: Búðu til smátjörn í garðinum til að auka líffræðilegan fjölbreytileika.
column4: Frogs, water beetles, pond snails, and sometimes dragonflies and damselflies will use ponds. However, remember: avoid tadpole-eating goldfish!
column5: Ýmis gróður og smádýr þrífast í og við smátjarnir.

column2: Minimise your use of weed killers and insecticides.
column3: Notaðu eins lítið af illgresis- og skordýraeyði og hægt er.
column4: These can kill many useful creatures and plants you didn't intend to get rid of, especially if they seep into ponds and streams. There are many wildlife-friendly alternatives.
column5: Slík efni drepa margar gagnlegar lífverur, bæði plöntur og dýr sem þú vilt sennilega ekki losna við, einkum ef þessi efni komast í smátjarnir og læki. Til eru margir valkostir sem ekki eru hættulegir villtum dýrum.

column2: Pesticides contain dangerous and harmful toxic chemicals that are damaging human health.
column3: Í varnarefnum eru hættuleg og heilsuspillandi efni.
column4: Residues from garden pesticides and insecticides can linger in the home. Contact your local authorities to find out where to safely and properly dispose of them.
column5: Leifar af varnarefnum og skordýraeitri geta borist inn í híbýli. Yfirvöld upplýsa hvar er tekið við afgöngum til eyðingar.

column2: Kill weeds with hot boiling water or simply burn them.
column3: Eyddu illgresi með   sjóðandi vatni eða brenndu það.
column4: Weeds that have had boiling water poured over them turn brown within a few hours and die. There is no toxic residue and the area is immediately safe for children to play.
column5: Illgresi sem sjóðandi vatni hefur verið hellt á verður brúnt eftir nokkrar klukkustundir og deyr. Engin eiturefni verða eftir og börnum er strax óhætt að leika sér á staðnum.

column2: Home gardens can add immensely to the biodiversity of cities and towns.
column3: Garðar við íbúðarhús auka mjög líffræðilegan fjölbreytileika í borgum og bæjum.
column4: They provide cover, feeding and commuting routes for wildlife including hedgehogs, badgers, birds and butterflies. If you have a garden, increase its value by planting berry-bearing trees and flowering plants. Rowan, bird cherry and dandelion, among others, can serve as food and shelter to a wide range of invertebrates.
column5: Í görðum er skjól, næring og annað sem þarf fyrir ýmis smádýr. Meira gagn og ánægju má hafa af garðinum með því að gróðursetja berjarunna og plöntur sem bera blóm.  Tré, runnar og annar gróður veita skordýrum, köngulóm og öðrum hryggleysingjum skjól og næringu.

column2: Biodiversity: Set a good example!
column3: Gefðu gott fordæmi!
column4: Encourage others in your community to create biodiversity ‘hot spots’. How? A row of gardens could create a biodiversity corridor linking wildlife to a local park or green space.
column5: Hvettu fólk í þínu bæjarfélagi til að koma upp svæðum með líffræðilegum fjölbreytileika. Hvernig? Margir garðar hlið við hlið geta myndað tengingu við skemmtigarða og græn svæði.

column2: Keep your dog on a lead if it is likely to run off and disturb wildlife.
column3: Hafðu hundinn í bandi svo hann hlaupi ekki frá þér og spilli náttúrunni.
column4: In particular, be careful of nesting birds in early spring and early summer, and roosting or feeding birds in winter. If you have a dog, keep this in mind when you're taking it for a walk!
column5: Sérstök þörf er á aðgát þar sem fuglar verpa á vorin og fram á sumar; einnig þar sem þeir leita sér matar eða hafa næturstað á veturna. Þetta ber að hafa í huga þegar hundar eru viðraðir!

column2: Dispose, don’t pour!
column3: Fleygðu á réttum stöðum, helltu engu niður!
column4: Anything you pour down your drain, sink or toilet can eventually end up in our rivers or sea! Never dispose of liquids such as oils, grease, or hazardous liquids – like paint thinners or unused paint – by pouring them down the drain. Instead, collect them in one box and dispose with the rest of your waste. Keep them all in their individual packaging, to avoid possible chemical reactions. This will also make it easier for them to be identified during waste collection. If applicable, take them to your community collection point.
column5: Allt sem fer í niðurfall,vask eða salerni getur fyrr eða síðar borist úti í á eða sjó! Fargaðu aldrei vökvum eins og olíu eða feiti, eða hættulegum vökvum eins og leysiefnum og málningarafgöngum, með því að hella þeim í niðurfall. Í staðinn á að safna þessu í einn kassa og farga um leið og öðru sorpi. Hafið vökvana í upphaflegum ílátum til að afstýra hættulegum efnahvörfum. Þá er auðveldara að bera kennsl á þá við sorphirðu. Farðu með það sem á að skila á ákveðna staði.

column2: Don't buy timber from illegal trade!
column3: Kauptu ekki timbur+B49 frá ólöglegum seljendum!
column4: Illegal trade in tropical timber contributes to forest destruction. Many hardware suppliers are now selling timber that has been certified as legal and sustainable. Next time you shop for wood-products, check for labels such as the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).
column5: Ólögleg verslun með timbur frá hitabeltislöndum stuðlar að eyðingu regnskóga. Margar byggingarvöruverslanir selja nú vörur sem vottað er að séu löglegur og sjálfbær. Næst þegar þú kaupir timbur skaltu spyrja um merki eins og Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).

column2: When travelling to exotic places, choose your souvenirs carefully.
column3: Á ferðalögum á fjarlægum slóðum þarf að sýna aðgát við kaup minjagripa.
column4: Trade in items such as woodcarvings, red coral or ornaments with fur or feathers, is often regulated and permits are required to bring them home. Check the rules, as there are strict laws governing exports of wildlife and you could risk having your souvenir confiscated.
column5: Verslun með útskorna trémuni, rauða kóralla eða skrautmuni með loðskinnum eða fjöðrum o.fl. er oft háð opinberu eftirliti og ferðamenn þurfa leyfi til að fara með þá til heim. Kynntu þér reglur. Strangar reglur gilda um útflutning villtra dýra og líkur eru á að minjagripir verði gerðir upptækir.

column2: Be creative and design a wildlife area in your garden!
column3: Gefðu ímyndunaraflinu lausan tauminn og búðu til náttúrlegt svæði í garðinum!
column4: In addition to creating a natural haven for you and your family, it will attract butterflies and also provide cover for frogs, mammals and insects.
column5: Auk þess sem þú og fjölskyldan fáið náttúrlegt afdrep laðar það að fiðrildi svo og önnur skordýr og smádýr.

column2: Support your national parks!
column3: Sýna þarf þjóðgörðum stuðning!
column4: Visit nature reserves and parks to show support for their creation, preservation and even their expansion. Remember to leave these areas as you found them.
column5: Farðu í þjóðgarða og önnur slík svæði til að sýna að þú sért hlynntur stofnun þeirra, því sem þar er gert til að vernda náttúruna og jafnvel stækkun þeirra. Mundu að sýna umgengni sem er til fyrirmyndar.

column2: Conserve water by letting your lawn grow longer.
column3: Sparaðu vatn: láttu líða lengra milli þess sem þú slærð.
column4: Let the grass grow higher and thus encourage root growth. It will also allow the grass to self-seed. If you mow a path in the middle, it will show that it is indeed meant to be that way as opposed to being neglected.
column5: Leyfðu grasinu að spretta vel áður en þú slærð það. Þannig eflir þú rótarvöxtinn. Þá er líka hugsanlegt að grasið sái sér sjálft. Ef þú býrð til stíg í flötina með því að slá grasið sést að það er ekki ofvaxið sökum slóðaskapar.

column2: A rotting log is a mini nature reserve in its own right!
column3: Viðarbútur sem fúnar er dæmi um líffræðilegan fjölbreytileika!
column4: By removing dead or dying trees from woodland, a section of the natural nutrient-cycle can be lost. A lack of dead wood reduces species diversity by about 20 %. Avoid removing dead wood from your property. You could be doing away with thousands of invertebrate species and fungi.
column5: Með því að flytja burt visinn trjágróður, kann náttúrlegur hlekkur í fæðukeðju skóglendis að hverfa. Ef visinn trjágróður vantar minnkar líffræðilegur fjölbreytileiki um u.þ.b. 20%. Ef þú fjarlægir dauðan trjágróður úr garðinum, kann mikill fjöldi hryggleysingja og sveppagróðurs að hverfa úr honum.

column2: Buy a ’recyclable’ Christmas tree!
column3: Kauptu 'endurnýtanlegt' jólatré!
column4: If you buy a Christmas tree, buy one with roots so that you can keep it watered. When Christmas is over you can plant it in the garden. If you buy a cut tree, recycle it by having it collected by your local authorities.
column5: Ef þú kaupir jólatré skaltu fá þér tré með rót og vökva það á jólunum. Eftir jólin er hægt að gróðursetja það í garðinum. Ef tréð er rótarlaust skaltu skila því til    réttra yfirvalda sem setja það í moldun.

column2: To prevent soil erosion, plant vegetation with complementary root systems.
column3: Til að afstýra uppblæstri  er gott að fjölga B68plöntum til að bæta við rótarkerfum.
column4: Some examples include lavender that have deep roots, which form a dense network that stabilises the soil.
column5: Stundum er bætt við lofnarblómum. Þau hafa djúpar rætur sem mynda þétt net er festa jarðveginn.

column2: From a distance…
column3: Séð úr fjarska...
column4: Appreciate wildlife, but be sure to watch wild animals from a distance and avoid feeding them. Remember, the scent you leave when you touch a nest or a lair may scare the parents off for good. Instead of touching, try to find out more about them and maybe even discover how you can contribute to their protection.
column5: Þótt þú hafir yndi af villtum dýrum skaltu gæta þess að koma ekki of nærri þeim og gefa þeim ekki. Mundu að ef þú snertir hreiður, bæli eða greni, skilur þú eftir lykt sem fælir e.t.v. foreldrana endanlega frá. Í stað þess að snerta skaltu reyna að komast að fleiru um dýrin og jafnvel finna ráð til að vernda þau betur.

column2: Take part in the next census of birds in your country.
column3: Vertu með í næstu fuglatalningu í landi þínu.
column4: In addition to making a valuable contribution to the national bird survey, you can learn how to recognise wrens, robins and will also spend a day outdoors.
column5: Auk þess sem þú hjálpar til við fuglaskoðunarátak lands þíns, lærir þú að þekkja ýmsar tegundir og nýtur útiverunnar.

column2: When on a hiking trip do not leave anything behind, especially litter.
column3: Varast ber að skilja eftir rusl eða annað í gönguferðum utan þéttbýlis.
column4: If you come across anything that others have left behind, act responsibly and pick it up.
column5: Ef þú finnur rusl sem aðrir hafa skilið eftir, skaltu sýna ábyrgðartilfinningu og hirða það.

column2: Where you can, choose organically farmed fish such as sea bass, salmon and trout.
column3: Veldu 'lífrænan' eldisfisk ef þess er kostur, t.d. silung og lax.
column4: Non-organic fish uses large quantities of chemicals and antibiotics which can affect other animals in the food chain. It is also worth bearing in mind that to produce a 3 kg farmed salmon, 15 kg of fish are caught in the wild to provide its meal and oil.
column5: Fiskur sem ekki er 'lífrænt' alinn þarf mikið magn kemískra efna og fúkkalyfja sem geta haft slæm áhrif á önnur dýr í fæðukeðjunni. Hafa ber í huga að til að ala 3 kílógramma lax þarf að veiða 15 kg af fiski úti í náttúrunni til að fá mjöl og lýsi.

column2: Welcome a newborn in your family by planting a tree.
column3: Fagnaðu fæðingu í fjölskyldunni með því að gróðursetja tré.
column4: In addition to creating a happy memory, this tree will give you shade, create a small ecosystem and produce oxygen.
column5: Auk þess sem ljúfar minningar tengjast trénu, veitir það skugga og skjól, myndar lítið vistkerfi og gefur frá sér súrefni.

column2: Find out about the special flora and fauna in your area.
column3: Kynntu þér sérkenni flóru og fánu þíns byggðarlags.
column4: Threatened and endangered species can be found in all kinds of ecosystems, big and small. Learn what kinds of species are listed as endangered in your area and commit to assisting in the preservation of their habitat.
column5: Lífverur sem ógn steðjar að eða eru í útrýmingarhættu eru til í tegundum vistkerfa, smáum og stórum. Kynntu þér hvaða tegundir í þínu umhverfi standa höllum fæti og legðu þitt af mörkum til að vernda búsvæði þeirra.

column2: If on holidays by a tropical lagoon or coral reef, avoid touching or stepping on corals.
column3: Sértu á ferð þar sem eru lón eða kóralrif: Ekki snerta eða stíga á kóralla.
column4: When diving, do not break off a branch of coral to take home as a souvenir. Coral reefs are precious and they are disappearing
column5: Þegar þú ert að kafa: Brjóttu ekki af kóral til að hafa til minja. Kóralrif eru mjög mikilvæg og þeim fækkar.

column2: Create a small ecosystem
column3: Búðu til lítið vistkerfi
column4: in your garden or park by piling up some logs in a secluded corner. These will provide shelter for hedgehogs, frogs and toads. If you half-bury the bottom logs in the soil, you will also encourage stag beetles as they are fond of rotten wood. A pile of stones will also provide shelter to a range of insects and spiders.
column5: í garðinum þínum með því að hlaða upp lurkum þar sem lítið ber á þeim. Þar verður afdrep fyrir ýmsar lífverur. Ef þú hálfgrefur lurkana myndast rétt umhverfi fyrir lífverur sem kunna vel við sig í fúnum viði. Grjóthrúga veitir skordýrum og köngulóm gott skjól.

column2: Compost!
column3: Búðu til moldunaraðstöðu!
column4: Start a composting scheme by inviting your neighbours and even your local school to compost organic waste. It is a natural fertiliser and it can increase the soil's ability to retain water and air.
column5: Settu í gang moldunaráætlun og bjóddu nágrönnum eða jafnvel skólanum í hverfinu að koma með lífrænan úrgang til þín. Þannig fæst náttúrlegur áburður sem hjálpar jarðveginum að halda í sér lofti og vatni.

column2: Did you know?
column3: Vissir þú þetta?
column4: Certain non-recyclable paper products (such as tissues, napkins, and egg cartons) can be added to your compost. Their fibres will aerate the compost and help the organisms that encourage decomposition.
column5: Sumar pappírs-/pappavörur (t.d. pappírsvasakllútar, hand-/munnþurkur og eggjabakkar) er hægt að molda. Pappírstrefjarnar örva loftun moldumassans og hjálpa örverum sem flýta fyrir rotnun.

column2: Choose your pet carefully and think before buying an exotic animal
column3: Hugsaðu þig vel um áður en þú kaupir gæludýr eða dýr frá fjarlægu landi.
column4: Reptiles, birds and fish are often taken from their natural habitats. The black market for exotic pets has devastated entire populations of species, and it is still the fastest growing sector in the pet market.
column5: Skriðdýr, fuglar og fiskar eru oft tekin úti í nátturunni. Svartur markaður gæludýra frá fjarlægum löndum hefur stórskaðað lífstofna ákveðinna tegunda og er enn sá hluti gæludýramarkaðarins sem er í hvað örustum vexti.

column2: If you're up for an unusual holiday, why not volunteer for nature conservation?
column3: Langi þig í óvenjulegt  frí: Því ekki sjálfboðaliði við náttúruvernd.
column4: Many travel companies offer such trips. It will give you the opportunity to work with passionate people and to do something positive in support of an environmental cause.
column5: Margar ferðaskrifstofur bjóða slíkar ferðir. Þú færð færi á að vinna með mjög áhugasömum einstaklingum og að gera eitthvað gott fyrir umhverfismálin.

column2: Grow your own vegetable garden or just a few in window boxes.
column3: Settu upp grænmetis-garð, jafnvel í kössum á gluggakistu.
column4: You'll enjoy tasty and fresh vegetables free of pesticides.
column5: Þú færð ferskt og gómsætt grænmeti sem er laust við varnarefni.

column2: Help to clean up your surroundings.
column3: Taktu þátt í hreinsunarstarfi í hverfinu þínu.
column4: Each year on World Environment Day, schools and environmental organisations worldwide organise clean up operations. Join one! In addition to enriching the landscape of your neighbourhood, you will learn more about the animals and plants that live nearby.
column5: Á hverju ári á Alþjóðlega umhverfisdeginum gera skólar og umhverfissamtök um allan heim umhverfisátak. Vertu með! Fyrir utan það að þú hjálpar til við að hreinsa og fegra hverfið sem þú býrð í, kemst þú að ýmsu merkilegu um dýr og gróður sem þrífst þar.

column2: Looking to add new plants to your garden?
column3: Langar þig að bæta við plöntum í garðinum?
column4: Be careful when buying for your garden. People are one of the main introducers of invasive species, especially flora. Many of the invasive species have been introduced for ornamental purposes. Do put an extra effort in finding out whether the plant you want is native to your environment.
column5: Farðu að með gát þegar þú kaupir fyrir garðinn. Margar plöntur ætlaðar til skrauts hafa reynst vágestir. Sama á við um sum framandi dýr. Vertu viss um að þú sért ekki að kaupa framandi plöntu sem kann að valda usla í umhverfi þínu.

column2: Buy locally-produced fresh produce
column3: Kauptu ný matvæli framleidd í nágrenninu
column4: either directly from the farmer or at a local fruit and vegetable market. Seasonal food is good for you and the environment. Cutting the number of kilometres your food has travelled and avoiding packaging reduces pollution and waste.
column5: annaðhvort beint frá bónda eða ávaxta-/grænmetismarkaði á staðnum. Búvörur viðkomandi árstíðar eru hollar og umhverfisvænar. Kauptu vörur úr nágrenninu sem ekki þurfa umbúðir. Þannig dregur þú úr mengun og sorpi.

column2: Where possible, switch to organic food!
column3: Veldu 'lífræn' matvæli ef þess er kostur.
column4: Organic food production uses no synthetic pesticides, produces slightly less greenhouse gases and usually leaves more room for biodiversity in agricultural areas.
column5: Við ræktun 'lífrænna' matvæli eru ekki notuð samsett, kemísk varnarefni, aðeins minna losnar af gróðurhúsalofttegundum og yfirleitt er meiri möguleiki á líffræðilegum fjölbreytileika við slíka ræktun.

column2: Eat meat in moderation!
column3: Gættu þess að borða ekki of mikið kjöt!
column4: If you're a meat eater, consider reducing your meat consumption and going for quality rather than quantity. Production of meat consumes enormous amounts of energy, not only for the growth and transport of animal feed, but also for the heating, air conditioning, and lighting of the immense animal farms. Changing to a diet with less meat helps the environment, but is also good for your health. It is best to buy meat from local producers and buy organic too.
column5: Ef þú neytir kjöts ættir þú að hugleiða að minnka neysluna og leggja meiri áherslu á gæði en magn. Kjötframleiðsla krefst feikimikillar orku, ekki eingöngu vegna dýraeldis og fóðurflutninga, heildur einnig vegna hitunar, lofthitunar og lýsingar á hinum gríðastóru búum. Þú hjálpar umhverfinu ef þú borðar minna kjöt og það er einnig gott fyrir heilsuna. Best er að kaupa kjöt hjá bændum í grenndinni og helst hjá þeim sem eru með 'lífrænan' búrekstur.

column2: Disposable napkins are often given out for free but this is no reason to waste them.
column3: Víða eru serví+B106ettur gefnar en það réttlætir ekki sóun.
column4: Instead of taking a handful, one or two should be more than enough. Be reasonable and trees will thank you for it!
column5: Láttu eina eða tvær duga, ekki taka fleiri. Vertu hófsamur og trén munu þakka þér fyrir það!

column2: Eat fruit and vegetables that are in season.
column3: Neyttu ávaxta/grænmetis sem best er hæft til neyslu á hverjum tíma.
column4: They taste better, are healthier for you, and their cultivation has less impact on the environment.
column5: Slíkur matur smakkast betur, er hollari og ræktun hans hefur ekki spillt umhverfinu eins mikið.

column2: Enjoy beef but eat in moderation.
column3: Borðaðu ekki of mikið af nautakjöti.
column4: Beef production accounts for around three times more greenhouse gas emissions than the production of poultry or pork.
column5: Framleiðslu nautakjöts fylgir þrisvar sinnum meira af gróðurhúsalofttegundum heldur en framleiðslu fuglakjöts eða svnakjöts.

column2: Consider your dairy consumption.
column3: Neysla mjólkurafurða: Hafðu aðgát.
