column4: The production of butter, cheese and other dairy products with high fat content accounts for high greenhouse gas emissions as well as for eutrophication of groundwater, rivers and seas. Remember: Globally, around 70 % of all agricultural land is used for livestock production.
column5: Framleiðslu smjörs, osta og annarra feitra mjólkurvara veldur mikilli losun gróðurhúsalofttegunda og auk þess ofauðgun grunnvatns, árvatns og hafsvæða. Mundu: Um 70% alls notaðs búlands í veröldinni eru lögð undir skepnuhald.

column2: Don't waste food.
column3: Ekki sóa mat.
column4: Buy only the amounts you really need, and make use of leftovers. This way you can reduce waste and also prevent emissions from additional production of food.
column5: Kauptu aðeins það sem þú þarft í raun og notaðu afganga vel. Þannig getur þú minnkað sóun og dregið úr losun mengandi efna.

column2: Invest in a lunch box.
column3: Kauptu nestisbox.
column4: If needed use cling film and paper instead of aluminium foil when you prepare your lunch. Reducing the amount of materials you use will reduce the amount of rubbish you throw away and this is good news for the environment!
column5: Ef þörf krefur skaltu nota svokallaða glæra filmu í stað álpappírs þegar þú útbýrð nesti. Með því að spara umbúðir þarftu ekki að fleygja eins miklu, og það er gott fyrir náttúruna!

column2: Don't start a washing machine unless it is fully loaded with laundry or dishes.
column3: Ekki gangsetja þvottavél/uppþvottavél fyrr en hún er full.
column4: Its energy and water consumption will be the same whether it's full or empty so you might as well optimise its cycle.
column5: Orku- og vatnsnotkunin er sú sama hvort sem vélin er full eða tóm.

column2: Let your hot food cool down before putting it in the refrigerator
column3: Láttu heitan mat kólna áður en hann fer inn í kæliskápinn
column4: and defrost food from the freezer in the fridge. Both will save you money on your energy bill. Also, remember to keep the fridge door open for only as long as you need it.
column5: og þíddu mat úr frystinum í kæliskápnum. Þannig sparast fé og rafmagnsreikningurinn lækkar. Gættu þess líka að hafa kæliskápshurðina ekki opna lengur en þú þarft.

column2: Let the light shine in!
column3: Slepptu sólaljósinu inn í íbúðina.
column4: Decrease your CO2 emissions and keep your electricity bills low by making the most of natural light. Think about choosing pale-coloured walls, ceilings and floors, as well as mirrors, to reflect the daylight.
column5: Minnkaðu CO2 losunina og lækkaðu rafmagnsreikninginn með því að nota dagsljósið eins vel og hægt er. Hugleiddu að hafa veggi, gólf og loft í ljósum litum. Speglar er líka heppilegir því þeir endurkasta dagsljósi.

column2: How often do you go through your family albums?
column3: Hve oft skoðar þú fjölskyldumyndirnar?
column4: Instead of printing all your digital photographs, archive them on your computer and share them with your loved ones via email.
column5: Í stað þess að prenta út stafrænar ljósmyndir er skynsamlegt að vista þær í tölvunni og senda þær í tölvupósti.

column2: Take a shower rather than a bath!
column3: Farðu í sturtubað í stað þess að leggjast í baðkarið!
column4: This way you can cut your water consumption by a third! Pause the water flow when soaping and avoid long showers. A shower uses about 30 to 80 litres, while a bath uses 150 to 200 litres of precious water. Install low-flow shower heads and think before buying a power shower.
column5: Þannig er hægt að minnka vatnsnotkunina um þriðjung! Stöðvaðu flæðið meðan þú ert að sápa þig og vertu ekki lengi í sturtunni. Í sturtubað þarf 30 til 80 lítra en fyrir bað í baðkari þarf 150 til 200 lítra. Notaðu sturtuhausa sem skammta lítið flæði og kauptu ekki aflsturtu (power shower).

column2: Is junk and marketing mail being delivered to your home?
column3: Færð þú ruslpóst inn um bréflúguna?
column4: Removing your name from the mailing list can be as easy as sending a letter, postcard, email or ticking a box on a form. This can save many trees and a lot of water each year. You can also add a sign on your mailbox: ‘No advertisements please’.
column5: Að láta taka nafn sitt af póslista er eins einfalt og að senda bréf, póstkort, tölvupóst eða smella á reit á eyðublað á netinu. Þannig er hægt að bjarga mörgum trjám og spara mikið vatn á hverju ári. Einnig er hægt að setja eftirfarandi á póstkassann:  ‘Engan ruslpóst, takk fyrir’.

column2: Got lime scale to remove?
column3: Þarf að fjarlægja kalkskánir?
column4: Instead of chemical products, try using vinegar to remove lime scale from tiles, taps, kettles and irons.
column5: Í stað kemískra efna er hægt að nota edik til að losa kalkskánir af flísum, krönum, kötlum o.fl.

column2: Buy eco-friendly dishwashing detergent.
column3: Kauptu vistvænt þvottaefni fyrir uppþvottavélina.
column4: It is largely biodegradable, less polluting to aquatic habitats and just as effective a cleaning agent as less environmentally friendly options. Look for eco-friendly dishwashing detergents, such as those labelled with the European flower eco-label (see www.eco-label.com to find one in your country).
column5: Það leysist að mestu leyti upp í náttúrinni, mengar vatnsbúsvæði minna, og er alveg jafn gott hreinsiefni eins og þau sem menga meira. Veldu vistvænt þvottaefni fyrir uppþvottavélar,eins og t.d. það sem er merkt með Evrópublóminu (sjá www.eco-label.com til að finna hvað á við í þínu landi).

column2: Say no to paper towels!
column3: Hafnaðu pappírshandþurrkum!
column4: A mop or sponge will do an even better job at cleaning up a spill so why waste paper? Reduce your waste and you'll help trees.
column5: Moppa eða svampur dugir jafvel betur en pappír til að hreinsa það sem fer niður. Dragðu úr sóun og hjálpað trjánum.

column2: Planning to renovate your house or apartment?
column3: Ætlar þú að endurbæta íbúðina/húsið?
column4: Look for ways to reduce the energy consumption for heating and cooling, for example by sealing windows and doors, insulation or changing the windows. Today it is possible to build ‘carbon neutral’ houses.
column5: Reyndu að finna aðferðir til að draga úr orkunotkun við hitun og kælingu, t.d. með því að þétta hurðir og glugga, skipta um glugga eða fá einangrunargler. Nú á dögum er hægt að byggja 'kolefnisjöfnuð' hús.

column2: Pay your bills online!
column3: Borgaðu reikningana á netinu.
column4: Eliminate your paper trail as well as the energy used to transport paper bills.
column5: Sparaðu pappírinn og jafnframt orkuna sem fer í að senda þá til þín í pósti.

column2: Say no to plastic or paper bags!
column3: Hafnaðu pappírs- og plastpokum!
column4: The plastic bags you use but for a few minutes can last for as long as 15 to 1,000 years in the environment. Don't get a new plastic bag each time you go shopping. Get a funky re-useable or cotton bag instead and say 'no thanks' to plastic or paper bags.
column5: Plastpokarnir sem þú notar geta enst í 1 - 1000 ár í náttúrunni. Fáðu þér ekki nýjan poka í hvert skipti sem þú verslar, heldur poka sem má nota hvað eftir annað eða baðmullarpoka. Afþakkaðu pappírs- og plastpoka.

column2: Favour toxic-free electronics!
column3: Veldu rafeindatæki án eiturefna!
column4: Many electronic goods contain hazardous toxic chemicals that are harmful to the environment once discarded. Before buying a new electronic device, find out what companies offer toxic-free products by visiting the following EU website:
column5: Í mörgum rafeindatækjum eru hættuleg eiturefni sem skaða nattúruna ef þeim er fleygt. Áður en þú kaupir rafeindatæki skaltu kynna þér á eftirtöldum ESB vefsvæðum hvaða fyrirtæki bjóða vistvænan búnað:

column2: In the market for a new printer?
column3: Ætlar þú að kaupa nýjan prentara?
column4: When buying a new printer consider one that allows ink cartridges to be refilled with rechargeable kits. It is very cost effective and environmentally friendly. If this is not applicable to your printer remember to recycle your used cartridges by returning them to the shop where you buy the new ones.
column5: Við kaup á prentara þarf að kanna hvort hann tekur hylki sem hægt er að endurfylla. Það er mjög hagkvæmt og vistvænt. Ef þetta á ekki við um prentarann þinn: Mundu að fara með notuðu hylkin til seljandans svo hann komi þeim í endurvinnslu.

column2: Invest in rechargeable batteries instead of buying disposable ones.
column3: Veldu hleðslurafhlöður, ekki einnota rafhlöður.
column4: You will save money in the long term. You can also buy solar powered rechargers if you want to reduce your environmental impact even further.
column5: Þú sparar til lengri tíma litið. Þú getur einnig keypt sólknúin hleðslutæki ef þig langar til að spara enn meiri orku.

column2: Say no to disposable products!
column3: Hafnaðu einnotavörum!
column4: We're using an increasing number of one-use products such as plastic razors, cups, paper towels, wipes, nappies, plastic bags, paper napkins and even disposable cameras to name a few. Not only do they usually cost more in the long-run, they involve the consumption of more resources and energy than their reusable alternatives.
column5: Við notum einnota vörur í sífellt auknum mæli. Dæmi: Rakvélablöð, hand- og munnþurrkur úr  pappír, afþurrkunarklútar, bleyjur, plastpokar, jafnvel einnota myndavélar. Ekki er nóg með að þessar vörur kosti meira til lengri tíma litið, þeim fylgir meiri hráefna- og orkunotkun heldur en því sem hægt er að nota aftur og aftur.

column2: When shopping for new electronics, favour products with low energy use.
column3: Kauptu rafeindatæki sem þurfa lítið rafmagn.
column4: You can use energy labels (A++, A+, A, B) for guidance, and for office electronics the Energy Star label. In the long-run, they will save you money on your electricity bill. To find out what products are included, go to EU's website: www.eu-energystar.org.
column5: Hægt er að miða við orkumerkingar (A++, A+, A, B) og Energy Star merki fyrir rafeindatæki. Þannig sparar þú rafmagn til lengri tíma litið. Til að sjá hvaða búnað hér er um að ræða, skaltu fara á vefsvæði ESB: www.eu-energystar.org.

column2: Close the loop!
column3: Lokaðu hringnum!
column4: Purchase products made from recycled materials. Who else should buy all the products made from the stuff you throw into the recycling bins?
column5: Kauptu tæki sem framleidd eru úr endurunnu efni. Hver annar ætti að kaupa allar vörurnar sem unnar eru úr því sem þú fleygir í tunnuna?

column2: When preparing a good meal, buy Fairtrade!
column3: Ef þú ætlar að búa til góða máltíð: Kauptu Fairtrade!.
column4: Fairtrade ensures Southern producers get their fair share. There are also many products which are certified Fairtrade and organic at the same time.
column5: Fairtrade tryggir að framleiðendur í Suðurlöndum fá réttlátar greiðslur. Einnig eru til margar vörur með Fairtrade vottun sem jafnframt eru 'lífrænar'.

column2: Don't forget about your local shops.
column3: Ekki gleyma kaupmanninum á horninu.
column4: New supermarkets in the area can reduce business for smaller shops. Pollution and congestion would be significantly less if consumers frequented their local shops, rather than travelling long distances to out-of-town shopping centres.
column5: Nýir stórmarkaðir í hverfinu geta eyðilagt viðskiptin fyrir  litlu verslununum. Mengun og umferð væri miklu minni ef fólk verslaði við hverfisbúðir í stað þess að aka langar leiðir til verslanamiðstöðva utan borganna.

column2: Buy lasting potted flowers!
column3: Kauptu pottaplöntur sem endast!
column4: When the urge to give flowers takes you, choose a potted plant from a local supplier. A lot of exotic flowers are grown in greenhouses great distances away. Aside from the issue of transport, there can be high social and environmental costs. For example, in Colombia, the flower industry uses enormous quantities of polluting pesticides, and in Kenya, horticulture requires a lot of water which reduces local water resources. As an alternative ask your flower shop for Fairtrade or organically produced flowers.
column5: Ef þig langar að gefa blóm skaltu kaupa pottaplöntu hjá blómabónda í grenndinni. Mikið af afskornum blómum kemur úr gróðurhúsum í miklum fjarska.  Auk flutningskostnaðar getur verið mikill félagslegur og umhverfislegur kostnaður, Dæmi: Í Kólumbíu er notað gífurlegt magn af mengandi varnarefnum í blómarækt, og í Kenya þarf mjög mikið vatn í garðrækt sem minnkar vatn til annarra nota. Annar valkostur; Biddu blómasalann um blóm frá Fairtrade eða 'lífrænt ræktuð' blóm.

column2: Buy your music as electronic files online and pollute less!
column3: Kauptu tónlist á netinu og mengaðu minna!
column4: You will save a trip to the music store as well as reducing the use of CDs, plastic boxes, packaging and transportation, not to mention some money.
column5: Þú sparar þér ferð í tónlistarbúð og minnkar notkun geisladiska, plastboxa, umbúða, og að auki sparast peningar.

column2: Buy what you need and not what you want!
column3: Kauptu það sem þig vantar, ekki það sem þig langar í!
column4: If everyone on earth lived a European lifestyle, we would need three planets to supply all the resources. Do not fall into the trap of consumerism and make a shopping list of items you need rather than picking up unnecessary items that you think you need. This will also save you money.
column5: Ef allir jarðarbúar hefðu evrópskan lífsstíl þyrftum við þrjár jarðir til að uppfylla allar þarfir þeirra. Gættu þess að láta ekki neysluhyggju ná tökum á þér. Búðu til lista yfir það sem þú þarft í stað þess að taka í búðinni ónauðsynlega hluti sem þú heldur að þú þurfir. Þannig sparar þú einnig fé.

column2: Upgrade your computer!
column3: Uppfærðu tölvuna!
column4: The EEA has upgraded their office PCs with additional memory space. This way, the life-time of the computers was extended by another two years and avoided a lot of electronic waste.
column5: Hjá EEA hafa skrifstofutölvurnar fengið minnisstækkun sem lengir líf þeirra um 2 ár. Mikið rafeindasorp sparaðist.

column2: Dispose medical waste properly!
column3: Losaðu þig við lyfjaúrgang með réttum hætti!
column4: Landfills or sewage systems are not the place for old medication. Instead, dispose them at designated disposal stations or take them back to your pharmacist.
column5: Urðunarstaðir eða skólplagnir eru ekki réttu förgunarstaðirnir fyrir gömul lyf. Skilaðu þeim í staðinn á sérstökum móttökustöðvum eða til lyfjabúða.

column2: Don't throw away your printer cartridges.
column3: Fleygðu ekki prentaraduftshylkjunum.
column4: Instead, recycle them! Most office supply stores make it possible to turn in your old, used cartridges when buying new ones.
column5: Endurnýttu þau í staðinn! Flestar ritfangaverslanir taka á móti gömlum, tómum hylkjum þegar ný eru keypt.

column2: Got bulky waste to dispose of?
column3: Þarftu að losna við fyrirferðarmikinn úrgang?
column4: When you'd like to get rid of large waste items, take it to a drop-off centre or contact a special company to come and pick it up. The professionals will segregate and possibly recycle your waste. Some products, including refrigerators and other electric appliances, have to be recycled properly not to pollute the environment. You can also use the internet or newspapers to sell goods which still have some value.
column5: Þegar þú þarft að fleygja stórum hlutum skaltu fara með þá á móttökustöðva sorps eða hafðu samband við  viðeigandi fyrirtæki til að losna við þá. Fagmenn munu hluta í sundur og jafnvel endurnýta hlutina. Hluti eins og kæliskápa og ýmis raftæki verður að endurnýta vegna mengunarhættu. Þú getur einnig notað netið eða dagblöðin til að selja hluti sem ennþá eru einhvers virði.

column2: Don’t litter!
column3: Ekki fleygja rusli á almannafæri!
column4: Avoid disposing any waste on the streets, in nature, and especially not in the gutter. This rubbish can end up in the water treatment system and overcharge the decontamination process. Take advantage of city waste baskets. They are everywhere and that's what they are for.
column5: Gættu þess að skilja aldrei eftir sorp á götunni, í náttúrunni og sérstaklega ekki nærri niðurföllum. Það getur endað í skolphreinsistöð og ofgert hreinsibúnaðinum. Hagnýttu þér sorpílát á almannafæri. Þau eru allsstaðar og eru ætluð til einmitt þessara nota.

column2: Need new glasses?
column3: Þarftu ný gleraugu?
column4: Around 10 million pairs of usable spectacles are discarded each year in Europe and North America. These can be used to help people in the developing world to afford glasses. Most opticians now act as collection points for old glasses, so drop yours off and give them a new lease on life.
column5: Um 10 milljón pör nothæfra gleraugna fara í ruslið árlega í Evrópu og Norður-Ameríku. Þau geta komið fátæku fólki í þróunarlöndunum að gagni. Flestir gleraugnasalar taka nú orðið við gömlum gleraugum. Losaðu þig við þau gömlu og gefðu þeim framhaldslíf.

column2: When the time comes to change your car battery, recycle your old one.
column3: Mundu að skila inn gamla bílrafgeyminum um leið og þú kaupir nýjan.
column4: Check with your local authorities for their advice as they might recommend that you take it to a special disposal site, or to a garage which collects them for recycling and proper disposal.
column5: Leitaðu ráða hjá réttum yfirvöldum. Þau benda þér e.t.v. á sérstakar móttökustöðvar eða verkstæði sem endurvinna eða farga rafhlöðum með réttum aðferðum.

column2: Dispose of toxic materials properly!
column3: Losaðu þig við eiturefni á réttan hátt!
column4: The best way to dispose of paint is to deliver it to your local specialist waste recycling centre. If you do not have access to one of these, let the paint dry fully, adding sawdust or cat litter as needed, before putting it in the dustbin. Don't throw it down the drain, because it is toxic and it interferes with the processes of water treatment plants.
column5: Besta aðferðin til að losna við málningu er að skila henni til sérhæfðrar endurnýtingarstöðvar. Ef þú kemst ekki á slíka stöð skaltu láta málninguna þorna og setja í hana sag eða kattaskít áður en þú setur hana í sorptunnuna. Ekki hella henni í niðurfallið því hún er eitruð og veldur skaða í skólphreinsistöðvum.

column2: Dripping oil?
column3: Olíuleki?
column4: Did you know that most of oil pollution in our oceans is the result of human activity on land and not tanker spills? If you notice oil leaking from your car, fix it right away! Never dispose of used oil into a storm drain.
column5: Vissir þú að mestöll olíumengun hafanna er af mannavöldum á landi en ekki vegna olíu sem stór olíuskip hafa losað?

column2: Donate your old clothes to charities or collection programs.
column3: Gefðu gömlu fötin til góðgerðarstofnana eða aðila sem taka á móti þeim.
column4: Your old wardrobe will be given a second life as either second-hand clothes or shredded and recycled as raw material for textiles and packaging. This will save precious energy and our scarce natural resources.
column5: Gömlu fötin þín öðlast framhaldslíf; annaðhvort verða þau notuð af öðrum eða verða tætt og endurnýtt sem hráefni í vefjarefni eða umbúðir.

column2: Think twice before buying more toys for your children.
column3: Hugsaðu þig vel um áður en þú kaupir fleiri leikföng handa börnunum.
column4: Many of them are used only very shortly and then thrown away. Go for high-quality, long-lasting toys that can be used by several generations of children. Selling old toys on a flea market can give your toys a second life and can be much fun for you and the kids.
column5: Leikföngum er oft fleygt eftir stuttan tíma. Veldu vönduð og endingargóð leiköng sem börn geta tekið við hvert af öðru. Ef þú selur gömul leikföng á flóamarkaði fá þau aftur hlutverk og gleðja bæði börnin og þig.

column2: Dispose with care!
column3: Ef þú fleygir einhverju: Gerðu það rétt.
column4: Take your electronic waste to a local collection point or give it back to the retailer so that it can be treated or recycled properly. Electronic and electric appliances contain many toxic substances. Since mid 2005, all European Member States are obliged to set up take-back systems for this waste.
column5: Farðu með rafeindasorpi á móttökumiðstöðvar eða til seljandans svo að hann geti meðhöndlað það eða komið því í endurvinnslu. Raf- og rafeindatæki innihalda margskonar eiturefni. Frá miðju ári 2005 eru öll aðildarríki ESB skyldug að koma upp móttökukerfum fyrir þessa tegund sorps.

column2: Going on a trip?
column3: Ertu að fara í ferðalag?
column4: If getting there by car, instead of by train or bus, be generous and share the space. By taking other people who might have made their journey in a separate car, you're putting one less car on the road.
column5: Ef þú ekur í stað þess að velja lest eða rútu: vertu rausnarlegur og bjóddu öðrum far. Ef þú flytur fólk sem annars hefði ekið ertu búinn að fækka bílunum á veginum um einn.

column2: Get in shape and be friendly to the environment all at once!
column3: Passaðu upp á línurnar og vertu vistvænn líka!
column4: Journeys of less than 3 km may take less time if you walk, use a bike or even take the bus. If taking your kids along, try using a skateboard, skipping rope, rollerblades or buggy boards! Remember how much fun it was when you were a kid.
column5: Styttri ferðir en 3 km taka e.t.v. skemmri tíma ef þú gengur, hjólar eða ferð jafnvel með strætisvagni. Ef börnin koma með, er upplagt að taka með hjólabretti, sippuband, línuskauta eða svokölluð buggyboards. Mundu hvað það var gaman að vera barn.

column2: Walk or cycle: Set a good example!
column3: Gefðu gott fordæmi!
column4: Walk or cycle to your work as much as it is possible and you’ll set your kids a good example. Encourage them to walk, cycle or take the bus when going to and from school each day! Both their health and the environment will benefit.
column5: Vertu börnunum góð fyrirmynd og farðu gangandi eða hjólandi í vinnuna ef þess er kostur. Hvettu þau til að ganga, hjóla eða taka strætó í og úr skóla dag hvern! Það er gott fyrir heilsu þeirra og umhverfið.

column2: Car pool!
column3: Sameinist um bíla!
column4: If you live far away from school, instead of driving your kids to and from school each day, start a car pooling initiative with the other parents and share the responsibility. It will save you time, petrol and help the environment.
column5: Ef þú býrð fjarri skólanum skaltu, í stað þess að aka börnunum til og frá skóla daglega, beita þér fyrir því að foreldrar skiptist á að aka. Þannig sparast tími og eldsneyti og að auki er það vistvænt.

column2: Keep your tyres properly inflated.
column3: Hafðu réttan þrýsting í hjólbörðunum.
column4: This will reduce wear and tear on them and increase their longevity, thereby saving money. It also saves precious raw material: it takes 27 litres of crude oil to produce a new tire. Under-inflated tyres also increase fuel consumption by up to 10%. Check your tyres at least once a month. It takes but a few minutes.
column5: Við það slitna þeir minna og endast lengur. Þannig sparast fé og dýrmæt hráefni: Það þarf 27 lítra af hráolíu til að framleiða einn hjólbarða. Ef of lítið loft er í börðunum, eykst eldsneytiseyðslan um allt að 10%. Athugaðu þrýstinginn a.m.k. mánaðarlega. Það tekur ekki nema nokkrar mínútur.

column2: Share your automobile!
column3: Leyfðu öðrum að aka með þér!
column4: If you have to use a car to get to work, sign up to a car sharing scheme.
column5: Ef þú kemst ekki hjá að aka til vinnu: Kannaðu möguleika á sameiginlegum akstri með vinnufélögum.

column2: Slow down!
column3: Hægðu á þér!
column4: When driving your car, drive steadily and anticipate what is coming up. Avoid rapid accelerations and breaking as much as possible. This will decrease your car’s fuel consumption.
column5: Aktu með jöfnum hraða og fylgstu með því sem framundan er. Forðastu eins og hægt er skyndilega hraðaaukningu og hemlun. Við það minnkar eldsneytiseyðslan.

column2: Have your oil changed by a professional.
column3: Láttu fagmann skipta um olíu fyrir þig.
column4: Take your car to a garage to have the oil changed. They will collect the used oil and recycle it.
column5: Láttu skipta um olíu á smurstöð. Þar verður séð um að olían komist í endurvinnslu.

column2: When travelling, choose eco tourism.
column3: Veldu vistvænan ferðamáta!
column4: Developing countries often gain little financial benefit from the influx of visitors to their shores. Only around 30 % of the money spent by tourists on their holiday remains in the host country. Eco tourism is promoted in some countries. For sustainable destinations, explore EU’s catalogue at www.eco-label.com.
column5: Þróunarlönd hagnast að jafnaði lítið á ferðamannastraumnum. Aðeins um 30% af eyðslu ferðamanna verður eftir í landinu. Í sumum löndum er lögð áhersla á vistvæna ferðamennsku. Þau lönd er hægt að finna í katalóg ESB á www.eco-label.com.

column2: If travelling by plane, off-set your CO2 emissions.
column3: Ef þú ferðast í flugi ættir þú að kolefnisjafna það.
column4: Many airlines and travel agencies offer carbon-credit schemes in their services.
column5: Mörg flugfélög og ferðaskrifstofur bjóða kolefnisjöfnun.

column2: Innovate!
column3: Finndu upp á nýjungum!
column4: Encourage your workplace to develop a sustainable transport policy for business trips. You can buy carbon credits to off-set flights, minimise physical meetings involving travel by using conference or video-calls or take a sleeper train instead of flying.
column5: Mæltu með því á vinnustað þínum að komið verði upp sjálfbærri stefnu hvað varðar viðskiptaferðir. Þú getur keypt kolefnisjöfnun fyrir ferðir, fækkað fundum sem krefjast ferðalaga með video-fundum og ráðstefnum, eða með því að panta svefnpláss í næturlest.

column2: Sign your emails with style.
column3: Sendu vistvænar kveðjur með tölvupóstinum.
column4: Adding a short sentence ‘Be kind to our planet and print this email only when necessary.’ will spread the word and help save our trees!
column5: Ef þú bætir við einni stuttri setningu: 'Sýndu plánetunni okkar vinsemd og prentaðu ekki þennan tölvupóst nema nauðsyn krefji', frétta fleiri af áhuga þínum og þannig er hægt að bjarga fleiri trjám!

column2: Print less!
column3: Prentaðu minna!
column4: At the office, encourage your colleagues to re-use the other side of paper and print less by archiving their emails and attachments. You can also try and create paperless habits. Some studies show that office paper consumption is rising by 20 % per year and web-based technology is actually increasing the printing of documents. On average each worker uses about 50 sheets of A4 per day. Must you print?
column5: Hvettu samstarfsfólk á skrifstofunni til að prenta líka á baksíðurnar og að prenta minna með því að geyma tölvupósta og viðhengi. Þú gætir einnig reynt að venja fólk á að nota ekki pappír. Kannanir sýna að pappírsnotkun á skrifstofum eykst um 20% árleg og að sú tækni að geyma upplýsingar á vefnum eykur í raun pappírsnotkunina. Að jafnaði eyðir hver starfsmaður 50 A4 síðum á dag. Gætir þú ekki dregið úr pappírsnotkun þinni.

column2: Save paper by setting your printer to print double sided by default.
column3: Sparaðu pappír: Stilltu prentarann fyrir prentun á báðar síðurnar.
column4: You can also print two pages per page if it remains legible. The EEA has introduced double-side default printing, which reduced the Agency’s paper consumption by around 17 % from 2004 to 2005.
column5: Einnig er hægt að prenta báðum megin á blaðið, ef hægt er að lesa það. Hjá EEA var farið að stilla prentarana fyrir prentun báðum megin. Pappírsnotkunin minnkaði um u.þ.b. 17% frá 2004 til 2005.

column2: Re-use paper!
column3: Endurnotaðu pappírinn!
column4: Instead of using a fresh piece of paper for rough work, turn over a used copy and write on the other side. Use products made of recycled paper. Remember! Every ton of recycled paper saves 17 trees compared to paper made from virgin materials.
column5: Í stað þess að nota nýjar arkir fyrir grófvinnu, er ráð að skrifa á baksíðu prentaðra arka. Notaðu endurunninn pappír. Mundu! Hvert tonn af endurunnum pappír bjargar 17 trjám miðað við pappír sem unnin er úr nýju hráefni.

column2: Get a mug!
column3: Fjárfestu í einkabolla!
column4: Invest in your own office coffee mug instead of using disposable plastic or paper cups. If you drink two coffees a day, you would be saving approximately 400 plastic cups in one year.
column5: Kauptu þér bolla til að nota á skrifstofunni í stað einnota pappírs- eða plastbikara. Ef þú drekkur 2 kaffibolla á dag, eru það samtals um 400 plastbikarar á ári.

column2: Buy in bulk!
column3: Kauptu í stórum umbúðum!
column4: At your workplace, suggest that individual packets of coffee, sugar, cream and tea be replaced by large containers for everyone's use. It will be cheaper and will reduce.
column5: Gerðu tillögu um það á vinnustaðnum að hætt verði að nota smápakkningar af kaffi, sykri, rjóma og tei og í staðinn komi stór ílát sem allir taki úr. Það verður ódýrara og dregur úr notkuninni.

column2: Use a toy library and if there isn't one in your neighbourhood, start one!
column3: Notaðu leikfangamiðlun: Ef engin er í grenndinni: Stofnaðu hana!
column4: Instead of buying new toys, set up a toy library with your friends and exchange them. The variety of toys will entertain the kids and they will be used by more than one child thus reducing your impact on the environment.
column5: Í stað þess að kaupa ný leikföng er ráðlegt að stofna leikfangamiðlun nokkurra vinafjölskyldna. Börnin gleðjast vegna hins mikla úrvals og hvert leikfang verður notað af mörgum börnum. Það dregur úr umhverfisálaginu.

column2: Human activity generates six gigatonnes of carbon dioxide per year,
column3: Mannleg umsvif framleiða 6 gigatonn af koldíoxíði á ári,
column4: while the Earth can recycle only three gigatonnes.  The rest accumulates each year in the atmosphere, thus reinforcing the greenhouse effect. Remember to save energy!
column5: en jörðin ræður aðeins við endurvinnslu þriggja gigatonna. Afgangurinn hleðst upp í andrúmsloftinu ár frá ári og við það aukast gróðurhúsaáhrifin. Mundu að draga úr orkunotkuninni.

column2: Turn the heat down!
column3: Minnkaðu hitann!
column4: Comfortable room temperature is 19 °C, but 15 °C is just perfect for bedrooms, as it can help you sleep better. Remember to turn the heating off if you're leaving for the holidays!
column5: Þægilegur herbergishiti er 19 °C, en 15 °C er alveg rétti hitinn í svefnherberginu og þú sefur betur. Mundu að lækka hitann eða skrúfa fyrir hann ef þú ert að fara í ferðalag.

column2: To save on your domestic energy consumption,
column3: Til að lækka orkreikning heimilisins,
column4: make your radiators more efficient by placing reflective panels or sheets of aluminum foil behind them as this will bounce the heat back into the room.
column5: skaltu auka afköst ofnanna í íbúðinni með því að setja upp álplötur eða -skinnur bakvið þá, því við það endurkastast hitinn inn í herbergin.

column2: Do not position your fridge or freezer near a heat source,
column3: Láttu ekki kæliskáp eða frysti standa nærri ofni,
column4: such as a stove or radiator, or even a south-facing window, as it will lead to increased electricity consumption.
column5: t.d. veggofni. Sama gildir um eldavélar og jafnvel suðurglugga, því við það eykst rafmagnseyðslan.

column2: If you own an old refrigerator and freezer,
column3: Ef ísskápurinn eða frystirinn er gamall,
column4: defrost them at least every six months. Even better –  replace them with new models, which have automatic defrost cycles and are generally up to twice more energy-efficient.
column5: verður að afþíða a.m.k. á hálfsárs fresti. Betra er þó að kaupa nýjan skáp eða frysti með sjálfvirkri afþýðingu því þeir nýta flestir rafmagnið allt að helmingi betur

column2: Fill up that freezer!
column3: Fylltu frystinn!
column4: Help it consume less energy by keeping it full.  It requires less energy to cool a full freezer than an empty one. Should you not have filled it, add some plastic bottles filled with water or even old newspapers – until you need the space!
column5: Sparaðu rafmagnið með því að hafa hann fullan. Það þarf minna til að halda frostinu í fullum frysti en tómum. Ef hann er ekki fullur er ráð að setja í hann plastflöskur með vatni eða jafnvel gömul dagblöð - þar til þú þarft á rýminu að halda.

column2: Clean the dusty coils behind your refrigerator
column3: Hreinsaðu pípulögnina aftan á kæliskápnum
column4: to help disperse the heat to increase the energy efficiency of the refrigerator.  Dusty coils can waste as much as 30 % extra electricity!
column5: svo að hitinn dreifist betur. Þannig nýtir skápurinn rafmagnið betur. Ef leiðslurnar eru ekki hreinar kann rafmagnseyðslan að aukast um allt að 30%.

column2: The recommended temperature for a refrigerator is between 1 – 4 °C
column3: Besti hiti fyrir ísskáp er á bilinu 1 - 4 °C
column4: and for the freezer it should be set at -18 °C. Each degree below these temperatures makes no difference as to how well the food is preserved, but it does increase energy consumption by approximately five per cent.  Place a thermometer in the refrigerator and the freezer to check the temperature!
column5: og rétt er að stilla frystinn á -18 °C. Hvert stig undir þessu hitastigi hefur engin áhrif á hve lengi maturinn geymist, en hinsvegar eykst rafmagnseyðslan um 5% við hvert stig. Hafðu hitamæla í kæliskápnum og frystinum til að fylgjast með!

column2: Defrost your food by taking it out of the freezer the night before
column3: Þýddu mat með því að taka hann út úr frystinum kvöldið áður
column4: and placing it in the refrigerator or simply leaving it out on the counter. Avoid defrosting in the microwave and adding to your electricity bill!
column5: og settu hann í kæliskápinn eða láttu hann einfaldlega liggja á eldhúsborðinu. Afþýðingu í örbylgjuofni ætti að forðast því það er orkusóun!

column2: Turn down your hot water thermostat
column3: Lækkaðu hitann á hitastilli vatnshitarans
column4: – it doesn't need to be set higher than 60 ºC. The same goes for the boiler of your central heating. Remember, 70 % of the energy used by households in the EU is spent on heating homes and another 14 % – on heating water.
column5: Hann þarf ekki að vera hærri en 60 °C. Það sama gildir um ketil í tengslum við miðstöðvarhitun. Mundu að 70% orkunotkunar heimilanna í ESB felst í upphitun þeirra og 14% í viðbót í hitun vatns.

column2: Don't forget to switch off the lights.
column3: Gleymdu ekki að slökkva ljósin.
column4: Switching off five lights in hallways and rooms in your house – when you don't need them – can save around EUR 60 a year! This prevents the release of approximately 400 kg of CO2 gas in one year.
column5: Með því að slökkva 5 ljós í forstofu og herbergjum húss - þegar þeirra er ekki þörf - er hægt að spara 60 evrur á ári! Það samsvarar u.þ.b. 400 kg CO2 losun á ári.

column2: Switch the lights off before going on holiday.
column3: Slökktu ljósin áður en þú ferð í frí.
column4: To save electricity, before you leave don’t forget to unplug as many appliances as is possible. If the appliances are still plugged in, they continue to use up energy. even if you switch them off.
column5: Til að spara rafmagn verður þú að muna að taka eins mörg tæki úr sambandi eins og hægt er áður en þú ferð. Tæki sem enn eru tengd halda áfram að eyða rafmagni jafnvel þótt slökkt sé á þeim.

column2: Turn off your computer during your absence from the office
column3: Slökktu á tölvunni áður en þú ferð úr skrifstofunni
column4: for long meetings or lunch hours.  You can thus save up to 20 % of your daily electric consumption. Even if it is not you who is paying the electricity bill, think of the environment.
column5: til að fara í mat eða á langa fundi. Þannig er hægt að minnka daglega notkun um allt að 20%. Jafnvel þótt þú þurfir ekki sjálfur að borga rafmagnsreikninginn, ættir þú að hugsa um umhverfismálin.

column2: Plug the electronics in your living-room
column3: Tengdu rafeindatækin í dagstofunni
column4: (TV, DVD player, stereo system) into a single multi-socket electrical bar.  When not in use, simply switch off the bar and save on the electrical consumption by as much as 10 % (approximately 200 000 W a year). Appliances left on standby still use quite a lot of electricity.
column5: (sjónvarpstækið, DVD spilarann, stereo kerfið) við eitt fjöltengi. Þegar tækin eru ekki í notkun slekkur þú á fjöltenginu og sparar rafmagn sem svarar allt að 10% (u.þ.b. 200 000 W á ári). Tæki sem stillt eru á bið (standby) eyða þónokkru rafmagni.

column2: Don't forget to unplug your battery chargers
column3: Gleymdu ekki að taka hleðslutækið úr sambandi
column4: after you've finished charging your mobile phone or laptop. If left plugged in, they continue to consume energy.
column5: þegar þú ert búinn að hlaða farsímann eða fartölvuna. Ef þú skilur hleðslutækið eftir í sambandi, heldur það áfram að eyða rafmagni.

column2: Try to cool off without resorting to air conditioning.
column3: Reyndu að kæla íbúðina án þess að nota loftkælinguna.
column4: The use of A/C can increase your electricity bill by 33 %. A fan requires one tenth of the energy used by an A/C system; sunshades, blinds, shutters and the cool of the night use no energy at all.
column5: Loftkæling getur hækkað rafmagnsreikninginn um 33%. Vifta notar einn tíunda þess rafmagns sem samsvarandi loftkæling þarf.

column2: If you can, change your electricity supplier,
column3: Keyptu rafmagn af öðrum orkusala ef það er hægt,
column4: switch over to the one that offers part of your energy supply from renewable sources. It will send the right message to energy companies.
column5: Flyttu þig til orkusala sem selur rafmagn sem að hluta til er framleitt úr endurnýtanlegum orkumiðli. Það sendir réttu skilaboðin til orkufyrirtækja.

column2: Don't use the pre-wash cycle on your washing machine.
column3: Notaðu ekki forþvottarstillinguna á þvttavélinni.
column4: Modern washing machines allow you to bypass this cycle, saving 15 % of the energy that would otherwise be used.
column5: Nútíma þvottavélar eru þannig að hægt er að sleppa þessu stigi, og við það sparast 15% þeirrar orku  sem annars myndi þurfa.

column2: Bake in one go!
column3: Bakaðu tvennt í einu!
column4: When baking a quiche, why not profit from an already heated oven and place your apple pie in it as well? You will save 50 % on your gas or electricity consumption!
column5: Þegar bökuð er lítil kaka er skynsamlegt að nota ofninn til að baka eitthvað annað um leið, t.d. epalböku. Þannig sparast 50% rafmagns eða gass!

column2: Switch the stove or oven off a few minutes
column3: Slökktu á hellunni eða bakarofninum nokkrum mínútum
column4: before your food is ready and make use of the residual heat to finish cooking.
column5: áður en maturinn/baksturinn er tilbúinn því þannig er hægt að nota afgangshitann.

column2: To save on energy when cooking,
column3: Til að spara orku við eldunina,
column4: cut up your veggies into small pieces to reduce the cooking time. When boiling or steaming vegetables, boil the water in the kettle first – rather than on the hob, and use only as much water as is necessary.
column5: skaltu skera grænmetið í smábita til að stytta suðutímann. Þegar grænmeti er soðið eða gufusoðið er rétt að sjóða vatnið fyrst í katli en ekki á hellunni. Notaðu ekki meira vatn en nauðsynlega þarf.

column2: Iron your clothes in one batch,
column3: Straujaðu í einu lagi allt sem þarf að strauja
column4: rather than one item at a time. You will save the energy required to heat up the iron each time you want to use it.
column5: frekar en eitt stykki í einu. Þannig sparast sá hiti sem þarf til að hita upp straujárnið í hvert skipti sem þú þarft að nota það.

column2: Use a thermos flask to save energy.
column3: Notaðu hitabrúsa til að spara orku.
column4: When you boil water for a hot drink, try to boil only what you need, or pour the surplus into a thermos flask to keep the water hot for your next cup!
column5: Þegar þú sýður vatn til að laga heitan drykk, reyndu að sjóða ekki nema það sem þú þarft í það skiptið, eða helltu því sem umfram er í hitabrúsa til að eiga heitt vatn í næstu lögun!

column2: Put a lid on your pots when cooking.
column3: Hafðu lok á pottunum meðan þú ert að elda.
column4: You can save up to a quarter of the energy needed for preparing the dish. Pressure cookers and steamers are even better: they can save around 70 %!
column5: Þannig sparast allt að fjórðungur þeirrar orku sem þarf til að laga réttinn. Þrýstipottar og gufupottar eru jafnvel enn betri; Þeir geta sparað um 70%!

column2: Have your water boiler inspected once a year
column3: Láttu skoða vatnshitarann einu sinni á ári
column4: – to verify whether it isn't poisoning the air in your home or consuming too much energy. Have it replaced once every 15 years – to benefit from the technological advances that render new boilers more energy-efficient.
column5: til að ganga úr skugga um að hann eitri ekki loftið í húsinu eða eyði of mikilli orku. Láttu skipta um hann á 15 ára fresti - til að hafa gagn af tækniframförum sem gera nýja hitara orkunýtnari.

column2: Switch to LED flashlights.
column3: Skiptu yfir í LED kastaraperur.
column4: With a lifespan of almost 100 000 hours, this lamp will serve you for dozens of years without producing any waste or pollution!
column5: Þær endast næstum því í 100 000 klukkustundir. LED perur endast því áratugum saman án sóunar eða mengunar.

column2: In the office, switch from the old computer monitor to
column3: Skiptu um gamla tölvuskjáinn á skrifstofunni
column4: a more energy-efficient LCD screen. If you're using your screen up to eight hours a day, you can save up to 100 000 W in one year.
column5: og fáðu þér orkunýtnari LCD skjá. Ef þú notar skjáinn í allt að átta stundir á dag, getur þú sparað allt að 100 000 W á ári.

column2: Our waste can produce lighting,
column3: Sorpið okkar getur búið til ljós,
column4: electricity, heat and even jobs!  Remember to recycle what you no longer need.
column5: rafmagn, hita og jafnvel störf! Mundu eftir að endurnýta það sem þú þarft ekki lengur.

column2: Get on the move and cycle, walk or use public transport!
column3: Farðu að hreyfa þig: Hjólaðu, gakktu eða taktu strætó!
column4: You'll improve your health and lessen your impact on the environment. Remember that for each litre of fuel burnt in a car engine, more than 2.5 kg of CO2 is released into the atmosphere.
column5: Við það batnar heilsan og umhverfisálag þitt minnkar. Mundu að fyrir hvern lítra eldsneytis sem brennur í bílvélinni þinni, fara meira en 2,5 kg af CO2 út í loftið.

column2: Going on a longer trip? Choose wisely.
column3: Ætlar þú í langferð? Veldu ferðamátann af skynsemi.
column4: An average new car generates 160 g/km of CO2 equivalent per passenger, a plane 100 - 250 g/km, a bus 40 - 80 g/km, and a train 40 - 160g/km.  If going by car, take as many passengers onboard as possible as it will reduce the CO2 emissions per person.
column5: Meðalbíllinn (nýr) gefur frá sér 160 g/km af CO2 jafngildi fyrir hvern farþega, flugvél 100 - 250 g/km, strætisvagn 40 - 80 g/km og járnbrautarlest 40 - 160g/km. Ef þú ekur í fólksbíl skaltu taka með eins marga farþega og hægt er til að minnka CO2 losun pr. farþega.

column2: Lonely drive to work?
column3: Einmanalegt að aka í vinnuna?
column4: Car-pooling with your colleagues will lessen your impact on the environment, save you money and let you travel in the company of others.  Ask which of your colleagues live nearby and take turns driving to work.
column5: Ef vinnufélagar sameinast um bíl minnkar umhverfisálagið, peningar sparast og menn njóta samverunnar. Kynntu þér hverjir vinnufélaganna búa í grenndinni og þið getið skipst á um að aka.

column2: Buying a new car?
column3: Ertu að hugsa um að kaupa nýjan bíl?
column4: Why not buy one of the new generation vehicles?  A hybrid car consumes between 20 % and 30 % less fuel and generates far less CO2 than a classical vehicle. So why not pollute less and save money – all at once?
column5: Hví ekki kaupa bíl af nýrri kynslóð? Tvinnbíl notar um 20 - 30% minna eldsneyti og losar miklu minna CO2 en venjulegir bílar. Hvað mælir þá á móti því að minnka mengun og spara jafnframt fjármuni?

column2: During cold winter days, don’t warm up your car's engine while idle.
column3: Láttu ekki bílvélina hitna í lausagangi á köldum vetrardögum.
column4: It's safe to start the journey with a cold engine, and you will save on fuel.
column5: Það er óhætt að aka af stað þótt vélin sé enn köld og þú sparar eldsneyti.

column2: Off for the weekend with the family?
column3: Ætlar fjölskyldan í helgarferð?
column4: To avoid traffic jams and the related stress, not to mention polluting, why not consider other transportation alternatives?  After all, trains are more comfortable!
column5: Til að komast hjá umferðarhnútum og streitu sem þeim fylgir, svo ekki sé minnst á mengunina, hví ekki hugleiða aðra ferðamáta? Þegar allt kemur til alls eru lestirnar þægilegri.

column2: Travel responsibly!
column3: Ferðist með ábyrgðartilfinningu!
column4: Fly only for distances greater than 700 km. Otherwise take the train. A transatlantic flight produces almost half as much CO2 as an average person produces over a period of one year while meeting all his or her other needs, such as lighting, heating and car travel!
column5: Fljúgðu ekki nema fjarlægðin sé meiri en 700 km. Annars skaltu taka lestina. Flugi yfir Atlantshafið fylgir næstum helmingur þeirrar CO2 losunar sem tengist til jafnaðar hverjum einstaklingi á einu ári vegna annarra þarfa hans, eins og t.d. lýsingar, upphitunar og bílferða.

column2: Yet another flight for a business meeting?
column3: Enn ein viðskiptaferðin í flugi?
column4: Develop a habit of considering telephone or video-conferencing first!
column5: Vendu þig á að athuga alltaf fyrst hvort mögulegt er að koma á síma- eða videofundi og sleppa viðskiptaferðinni.

column2: Keep on the move!
column3: Liigu palju!
column4: Instead of taking the car: walk, cycle, take the bus or use the underground. You will not only keep fit but also help reduce traffic, air pollution, noise and accidents.
column5: Autoga sõitmise asemel mine jalgsi, sõida jalgratta, bussi või metrooga. Nii ei püsi sa mitte ainult heas vormis, vaid aitad vähendada ka liiklust, õhusaastet, müra ja õnnetusi

column2: Got an errand to run?
column3: Pead kiiresti kuskil ära käima?
column4: Cars often pollute more on short trips when the motor is cold, so try to walk or cycle instead.
column5: Lühikestel sõitudel, kui mootor on külm, saastavad autod rohkem, seepärast püüa minna jalgsi või jalgrattaga.

column2: Don’t skip regular check-ups of your car.
column3: Ära jäta käimata auto korralistel ülevaatustel.
column4: Inspect your car regularly for the emissions it generates. Catalytic converters need regular maintenance.
column5: Lase oma auto heitkoguseid korrapäraselt kontrollida. Katalüsaatorit on vaja regulaarselt hooldada.

column2: Going to work?
column3: Lähed tööle?
column4: Consider carpooling or using public transport rather than your own car. If driving, ask around the office which of your colleagues lives near you and whether you can share lifts.
column5: Oma auto kasutamise asemel mõtle, kas auto ühiskasutus või ühistransport poleks mõistlikum. Kui sõidad autoga, küsi töökaaslastelt, kas keegi neist elab sinu lähedal ja kas te saate autot jagada.

column2: Think twice before buying a new car.
column3: Enne uue auto ostmist mõtle kaks korda järele.
column4: It might be more efficient to use alternatives for transport rather than keeping a car only for weekend trips.
column5: Võib-olla on mõistlikum kasutada muid transpordiviise selle asemel, et pidada autot ainult nädalavahetusel kasutamiseks.

column2: Use bicycle couriers!
column3: Kasuta jalgrattakullerit!
column4: If you run a business and need to deliver mail and parcels regularly around town, use a bicycle courier service if one is available. Bicycles bypass traffic; are quick; and you will contribute to the improvement of urban air quality in your area.
column5: Kui juhid ettevõtet ja sul on vaja linnas tihti kirju ja pakke saata, kasuta võimaluse korral jalgrattakulleriteenust. Jalgrattaga saab liiklusest mööda sõita, jõuab kiiremini kohale ja lisaks annad sa panuse oma piirkonna linnaõhu paremaks muutmise heaks.

column2: Did you know that you can reduce air pollution by recycling your waste?
column3: Kas tead, et prügi sorteerides võid õhusaastet vähendada?
column4: By recycling glass, paper, batteries, engine oil and aluminium cans, these materials can be re-used, and you will reduce the volume of waste incinerated by up to 70%.
column5: Kui sorteerid klaasi, paberit, patareisid, mootoriõli ja alumiiniumpurke, võib neid materjale uuesti kasutada ja sa vähendad põletamisele mineva prügi hulka kuni 70%.

column2: On very hot days use public transport rather than your car.
column3: Väga kuumadel päevadel kasuta isikliku auto asemel ühistransporti.
column4: Car exhaust emissions react with sunlight and heat to cause polluting gases such as tropospheric ozone. This is the main ingredient of poor air quality and photo-chemical smog, which can cause breathing difficulties.
column5: Auto heitgaasid reageerivad päikesevalguse ja kuumusega ning tekitavad saastavaid gaase, näiteks troposfääriosooni. See on halvakvaliteedilise õhu ja fotokeemilise sudu peamine koostisosa, mis võib põhjustada hingamisprobleeme.

column2: Think first before buying a Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV).
column3: Mõtle põhjalikult järele, enne kui maastikuauto ostmise kasuks otsustad.
column4: In addition to being very expensive to run, SUVs are very fuel inefficient. They emit twice as much carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons and nitrogen dioxide as an average car. These chemicals contribute to air pollution as well as global warming!
column5: Lisaks sellele, et neid on väga kallis pidada, kasutavad maastikuautod kütust ebatõhusalt. Nad paiskavad õhku kaks korda rohkem vingugaasi, süsivesinikku ja lämmastikdioksiidi kui tavaline auto. Need keemilised ühendid soodustavad nii õhu saastumist kui ka globaalset kliima soojenemist!

column2: Turn off the tap!
column3: Keera kraan kinni!
column4: Avoid wasting water while brushing your teeth or shaving, and save up to 10 litres of water each time. Use a mug of water and turn the tap off so you only use what you need.
column5: Väldi hambaid pestes või habet ajades vee raiskamist ja säästa iga kord 10 liitrit vett. Kasuta veeklaasi ja keera kraan kinni, siis kasutad ainult nii palju vett, kui vajad.

column2: Install a water meter to keep track of your water consumption.
column3: Paigalda veearvesti, et saaksid oma veetarbimist jälgida.
column4: Households with meters tend to be more careful with their water-use and also end up saving money as well.
column5: Majapidamised, kus on veearvesti, kasutavad üldiselt vett hoolikamalt ja säästavad selle tulemusena ka raha.

column2: Thirsty?
column3: Janu?
column4: Fill a jug with tap water and store it in your fridge rather than waiting for the tap to run cold each time you want a glass of cold water.
column5: Täida kann kraaniveega ja pane see külmkappi, selle asemel et lasta iga kord, kui tahad klaasi külma vett, veel kraanist nii kaua joosta, kuni see külmaks muutub.

column2: Why waste?
column3: Milleks raisata?
column4: Boil only as much water as you need for your cup of coffee or tea.
column5: Keeda ainult nii palju vett, kui sul kohvi või tee jaoks vaja on.

column2: Take a quick shower instead of a bath.
column3: Vannis käimise asemel käi kiiresti duši all.
column4: Showers require as little as a third of the water! However, this is true as long as you keep them under five minutes long. So be quick and use a shower timer to keep track of time next time you hop in!
column5: Duši all kulub kolm korda vähem vett! Aga see kehtib ainult siis, kui oled duši all vähem kui viis minutit. Tee kiiresti ja järgmine kord mõõda taimeriga aega!

column2: Invest in low-flow showerheads to decrease your consumption of water.
column3: Veetarbimise vähendamiseks investeeri nõrgema veevooluga dušiotsikutesse.
column4: They produce a finer spray and increase the flow of the water while using less of it.
column5: Nad pihustavad vett peenemalt ja suurendavad veevoolu, kasutades samal ajal vähem vett.

column2: Reduce your domestic consumption of water.
column3: Vähenda kodust veetarbimist.
column4: By having aerators and water flow restrictors fitted on your taps, the flow of water will feel stronger, but will consist of less water and more air. Aerated taps can reduce the water flow by 30-40 %.
column5: Kui lased kraanile paigaldada aeraatori ja veevoolu hulga piiraja, tundub veevool tugevamana, aga koosneb vähemast vee- ja suuremast õhuhulgast. Aeraatori abil võib vähendada veevoolu 30–40 %.

column2: Drop in a hippo!
column3: Kasuta WC-poti veesäästjat!
column4: Decrease your toilet’s water-use by dropping a hippo or other displacement device into the cistern. If you’re planning on buying a new toilet, consider a water efficient one with a dual flush.
column5: Vähenda veetarbimist tualetis, pannes veepaaki veesäästja või mingi seda asendava vahendi. Kui plaanid uut WC-potti osta, oleks parem valida vettsäästev kahesüsteemse loputusega pott.

column2: Only run the dishwasher when it's completely full.
column3: Pane nõudepesumasin alles siis tööle, kui see on täiesti täis.
column4: In this way, you actually use less water than if you wash the dishes by hand.
column5: Sel viisil kulutad tegelikult vähem vett kui nõusid käsitsi pestes.

column2: Go for the eco-label!
column3: Osta ökomärgisega tooteid!
column4: When shopping for a new washing machine, look for an energy-efficient model that uses the least amount of water. To find out more, visit the Eco-Label web-site that lists energy-efficient appliances:
column5: Uut pesumasinat ostes otsi energiatõhusat mudelit, mis kasutab kõige vähem vett. Rohkem teavet saab ökomärgise veebilehelt, kust võib leida energiatõhusate toodete nimekirja: http://www.eco-label.com/

column2: Don't flush
column3: Ära viska WC-potti
column4: cotton-balls, cotton-swabs and make-up tissues down the toilet. Instead dispose of them in the bin where they belong.
column5: vatitupse, -tikke ja pabertaskurätikuid. Selle asemel viska need prügikasti, kus on nende õige koht.

column2: The water hose in your garden can release as much as 18 litres of water a minute.
column3: Aiavoolikust võib tulla kuni 18 liitrit vett minutis.
column4: Use a traditional watering can instead and significantly reduce the water wasted. Alternatively, you can fit the hose with a trigger gun to control the water-flow.
column5: Kasuta selle asemel traditsioonilist kastekannu ja vähenda tunduvalt vee raiskamist. Teise võimalusena võid veevoolu kontrollimiseks lisada voolikule päästiku.

column2: Soak, don’t sprinkle!
column3: Immuta, ära piserda!
column4: When gardening, soak the roots of your plants twice a week instead of sprinkling water on them each day. This way much more water is absorbed instead of evaporating.
column5: Aias taimi kastes immuta nende juuri kaks korda nädalas, selle asemel et neid iga päev vähese veega pritsida. Sellisel viisil suurem hulk vett neeldub kui aurub.

column2: Collect rainwater
column3: Kogu vihmavett
column4: for watering your garden instead of using precious drinking water from the tap. Also, remember to check the weather forecast before watering the garden; it may be about to rain.
column5: aia kastmiseks, selle asemel et kasutada kraanist tulevat kallist joogivett. Vaata enne kastmist ka ilmateadet – võib-olla ennustatakse vihma.

column2: Hand-wash your car with a bucket, sponge and soap.
column3: Pese autot käsitsi, kasutades ämbrit, nuustikut ja pesuvahendit.
column4: You’ll use up only a few litres of water compared to a commercial car wash which can use from 32 to 150 litres each time. You can achieve the same result, but with far less water.
column5: Nii kasutad ainult mõned liitrid vett, võrreldes autopesulaga, kus võib iga kord kuluda 32 kuni 150 liitrit vett. Tulemus on sama, aga palju väiksema veekuluga.

column2: Mulch your plants – indoors and outdoors.
column3: Pane nii toa- kui ka aiataimedele multši.
column4: It will keep weeds away; protect the plants by keeping the soil cool; decrease evaporation and reduce soil compaction. Be creative and use materials like: pebbles, bark chippings, gravel, cocoa shells, decorative pine cones, marbles, broken crockery, grass clippings or leaf mould. But avoid mulching too close to the stems to avoid the plant rotting in winter.
column5: See takistab umbrohu kasvu; kaitseb taimi, hoides mulla jahedana; vähendab aurustumist ja mulla kõvastumist. Ole loov ja kasuta selliseid materjale nagu kivikesed, puukooretükid, kruus, kookospähklikoored, dekoratiivsed männikäbid, klaaskuulikesed, purunenud nõude tükid, pügatud muru või lehemuld. Ära pane multši vartele liiga lähedale, muidu võivad need talvel mädanema minna.

column2: If you have a garden, creating a pond is a great way to boost biodiversity.
column3: Kui sul on aed, siis on tiigi kujundamine hea võimalus suurendada bioloogilist mitmekesisust.
column4: Frogs, water beetles, pond snails, and sometimes dragonflies and damselflies will use ponds. However, remember: avoid tadpole-eating goldfish!
column5: Konnad, veeputukad, veeteod ja vahel ka eri kiililised armastavad tiike. Aga ära lase tiiki kuldkalu, kes söövad kulleseid!

column2: Minimise your use of weed killers and insecticides.
column3: Vähenda umbrohu- ja putukamürkide kasutamist.
column4: These can kill many useful creatures and plants you didn't intend to get rid of, especially if they seep into ponds and streams. There are many wildlife-friendly alternatives.
column5: Need võivad tappa paljusid kasulikke olendeid ja taimi, keda sa hävitada ei tahtnud, eriti kui mürk nõrgub tiikidesse või ojadesse. On ka teisi, loodussõbralikke võimalusi.

column2: Pesticides contain dangerous and harmful toxic chemicals that are damaging human health.
column3: Pestitsiidid sisaldavad ohtlikke ja kahjulikke mürgiseid kemikaale, mis on inimese tervisele kahjulikud.
column4: Residues from garden pesticides and insecticides can linger in the home. Contact your local authorities to find out where to safely and properly dispose of them.
column5: Kodus võib leiduda aias kasutatavate pestitsiidide ja insektitsiidide jääke. Võta ühendust kohalike ametivõimudega, et välja uurida, kuidas neist ohutult ja kõige õigemal viisil vabaneda.

column2: Kill weeds with hot boiling water or simply burn them.
column3: Hävita umbrohtu keeva veega või lihtsalt põletades.
column4: Weeds that have had boiling water poured over them turn brown within a few hours and die. There is no toxic residue and the area is immediately safe for children to play.
column5: Umbrohi, millele on kallatud kuuma vett, muutub mõne tunni jooksul pruuniks ja sureb. Ei mingeid mürgised jääke ja ala on lastele mängimiseks kohe ohutu.

column2: Home gardens can add immensely to the biodiversity of cities and towns.
column3: Koduaiad võivad linnu bioloogiliselt tunduvalt mitmekesisemaks muuta.
column4: They provide cover, feeding and commuting routes for wildlife including hedgehogs, badgers, birds and butterflies. If you have a garden, increase its value by planting berry-bearing trees and flowering plants. Rowan, bird cherry and dandelion, among others, can serve as food and shelter to a wide range of invertebrates.
column5: Aiad pakuvad peavarju, toitu ja liikumisteid paljudele eluslooduse esindajatele, näiteks siilidele, mäkradele, lindudele ja liblikatele. Kui sul on aed, suurenda selle väärtust, istutades marjapuid ja õistaimi. Näiteks pihlakas, toomingas ja võililled võivad pakkuda toitu ja varju paljudele selgrootutele.

column2: Biodiversity: Set a good example!
column3: Anna head eeskuju!
column4: Encourage others in your community to create biodiversity ‘hot spots’. How? A row of gardens could create a biodiversity corridor linking wildlife to a local park or green space.
column5: Julgusta oma kogukonna liikmeid looma bioloogilise mitmekesisuse pelgupaiku. Kuidas? Ühes reas paiknevatest aedadest võib moodustada bioloogilise mitmekesisuse koridori, mis seob elusloodust kohaliku pargi või rohealaga.

column2: Keep your dog on a lead if it is likely to run off and disturb wildlife.
column3: Hoia koer rihma otsas, kui ta võib minema joosta ja elusloodust häirida.
column4: In particular, be careful of nesting birds in early spring and early summer, and roosting or feeding birds in winter. If you have a dog, keep this in mind when you're taking it for a walk!
column5: Ole eriti ettevaatlik varakevadel ja -suvel pesitsevate ja talvel puhkavate või toituvate lindude läheduses. Kui sul on koer, arvesta sellega, kui temaga jalutamas käid!

column2: Dispose, don’t pour!
column3: Äravalamise asemel anna ära!
column4: Anything you pour down your drain, sink or toilet can eventually end up in our rivers or sea! Never dispose of liquids such as oils, grease, or hazardous liquids – like paint thinners or unused paint – by pouring them down the drain. Instead, collect them in one box and dispose with the rest of your waste. Keep them all in their individual packaging, to avoid possible chemical reactions. This will also make it easier for them to be identified during waste collection. If applicable, take them to your community collection point.
column5: Kõik, mis valatakse kraanikaussi või WC-potti, võib lõpuks jõuda meie jõgedesse või merre! Vedelikke, nagu õlisid ja rasva, või ohtlikke majapidamisaineid, näiteks värvivedeldeid või kasutamata värvi, ei tohi kunagi kanalisatsiooni valada. Kogu sellised vedelikud kasti ja anna ära koos muude jäätmetega. Hoia neid kõiki originaalpakendites, et vältida võimalikke keemilisi reaktsioone. Nii on ka jäätmekogujatel neid kergem tuvastada. Kui sinu kodukohas on selliste vedelike kogumispunkt, vii need sinna.

column2: Don't buy timber from illegal trade!
column3: Ära osta puitu ebaseadusliku müüja käest!
column4: Illegal trade in tropical timber contributes to forest destruction. Many hardware suppliers are now selling timber that has been certified as legal and sustainable. Next time you shop for wood-products, check for labels such as the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC).
column5: Ebaseaduslik kaubitsemine troopilise puiduga aitab kaasa metsade hävitamisele. Tänapäeval müüvad paljud tootmismaterjalide tarnijad puitu, mis on tunnistatud seaduslikuks ja säästlikuks. Järgmine kord, kui puidust asju ostad, vaata, et neil oleks vastav märgistus, näiteks Forest Stewardship Council'i (FSC) tähis.

column2: When travelling to exotic places, choose your souvenirs carefully.
column3: Eksootilistes kohtades reisides vali suveniire hoolikalt.
column4: Trade in items such as woodcarvings, red coral or ornaments with fur or feathers, is often regulated and permits are required to bring them home. Check the rules, as there are strict laws governing exports of wildlife and you could risk having your souvenir confiscated.
column5: Kaubitsemine selliste esemetega, nagu puunikerdised, punased korallid või karusnaha või sulgedega kaunistused, on sageli reguleeritud ja nende kojutoomiseks on vaja eriluba. Tutvu vastavate reeglitega, sest loodustoodete ekspordi kohta kehtivad ranged seadused ja su suveniirid võidakse konfiskeerida.

column2: Be creative and design a wildlife area in your garden!
column3: Ole loov ja kujunda oma aeda metsiku looduse ala!
column4: In addition to creating a natural haven for you and your family, it will attract butterflies and also provide cover for frogs, mammals and insects.
column5: See on looduslik varjupaik sinu ja su pere jaoks, mis meelitab ligi liblikaid ja on pelgupaigaks ka konnadele, imetajatele ja putukatele.

column2: Support your national parks!
column3: Toeta rahvusparke!
column4: Visit nature reserves and parks to show support for their creation, preservation and even their expansion. Remember to leave these areas as you found them.
column5: Külasta looduskaitsealasid ja parke, et näidata oma toetust nende rajamisele, avatuna hoidmisele ja isegi laienemisele. Jälgi, et need alad oleksid pärast sinu lahkumist sama korras kui enne.

column2: Conserve water by letting your lawn grow longer.
column3: Säästa vett, lastes murul pikemaks kasvada.
column4: Let the grass grow higher and thus encourage root growth. It will also allow the grass to self-seed. If you mow a path in the middle, it will show that it is indeed meant to be that way as opposed to being neglected.
column5: Lase rohul pikemaks kasvada, nii ajavad juured end sügavamale. Ühtlasi annab see rohule võimaluse end ise külvata. Kui niidad keskele raja, saadakse aru, et sinu muru peabki selline olema ega ole hooletusse jäetud.

column2: A rotting log is a mini nature reserve in its own right!
column3: Mädanev palk on tegelikult väike looduskaitseala!
column4: By removing dead or dying trees from woodland, a section of the natural nutrient-cycle can be lost. A lack of dead wood reduces species diversity by about 20 %. Avoid removing dead wood from your property. You could be doing away with thousands of invertebrate species and fungi.
column5: Surnud või surevate puude metsamaalt koristamisega võib kaduma minna toiduahela üks lüli. Surnud puidu puudumine vähendab bioloogilist mitmekesisust umbes 20%. Ära korista oma maalt surnud puid. Võib juhtuda, et hävitad niiviisi tuhandeid liike selgrootuid ja seeni.

column2: To prevent soil erosion, plant vegetation with complementary root systems.
column3: Mullaerosiooni vähendamiseks külva taimi, millel on tugev juuresüsteem.
column4: Some examples include lavender that have deep roots, which form a dense network that stabilises the soil.
column5: Näiteks on lavendlil sügavad juured, mis moodustavad tiheda võrgustiku ja hoiavad mulda kinni.

column2: From a distance…
column3: Eemalt vaadates…
column4: Appreciate wildlife, but be sure to watch wild animals from a distance and avoid feeding them. Remember, the scent you leave when you touch a nest or a lair may scare the parents off for good. Instead of touching, try to find out more about them and maybe even discover how you can contribute to their protection.
column5: Hinda elusloodust, aga jälgi metsloomi kaugelt ja ära toida neid. Pea meeles, et lõhn, mis sinust maha jääb, kui oled pesa või urgu katsunud, võib loomad pesast ja poegade juurest alatiseks eemale peletada. Katsumise asemel püüa loomade kohta rohkem teada saada ja uuri, kuidas võiksid kaasa aidata nende kaitsmisele.

column2: Take part in the next census of birds in your country.
column3: Osale oma riigi järgmisel linnuloendusel.
column4: In addition to making a valuable contribution to the national bird survey, you can learn how to recognise wrens, robins and will also spend a day outdoors.
column5: Lisaks sellele, et annad olulise panuse lindude loendamisse, õpid tundma käblikuid ja punarindu ning peale selle veedad päeva väljas.

column2: When on a hiking trip do not leave anything behind, especially litter.
column3: Matkal olles ära jäta endast midagi maha, eriti mitte prügi.
column4: If you come across anything that others have left behind, act responsibly and pick it up.
column5: Kui leiad midagi, mille teised on maha jätnud, käitu vastutustundlikult ja korja see üles.

column2: Where you can, choose organically farmed fish such as sea bass, salmon and trout.
column3: Võimaluse korral osta mahekasvatatud kalu, näiteks ahvenaid, lõhesid ja forelle.
column4: Non-organic fish uses large quantities of chemicals and antibiotics which can affect other animals in the food chain. It is also worth bearing in mind that to produce a 3 kg farmed salmon, 15 kg of fish are caught in the wild to provide its meal and oil.
column5: Teisiti kasvatatud kalade korral kasutatakse palju kemikaale ja antibiootikume, mis võivad mõjutada teisi loomi toiduahelas. Samuti tasub meeles pidada, et 3 kg kasvanduses kasvatatud lõhe tootmiseks püütakse loodusest 15 kg teisi kalu, et kasvanduse kalad saaksid toitu ja õli.

column2: Welcome a newborn in your family by planting a tree.
column3: Kui sinu peresse sünnib laps, istuta selle puhul puu.
column4: In addition to creating a happy memory, this tree will give you shade, create a small ecosystem and produce oxygen.
column5: Lisaks helgele mälestusele annab see puu sulle varju, loob väikese ökosüsteemi ja toodab hapnikku.

column2: Find out about the special flora and fauna in your area.
column3: Kogu teadmisi oma piirkonna erilise taimestiku ja loomastiku kohta.
column4: Threatened and endangered species can be found in all kinds of ecosystems, big and small. Learn what kinds of species are listed as endangered in your area and commit to assisting in the preservation of their habitat.
column5: Ohustatud liike võib leida kõikides ökosüsteemides, nii väikestes kui ka suurtes. Uuri, millised liigid on sinu piirkonnas ohustatud ja pühendu nende elupaiga kaitsmisele.

column2: If on holidays by a tropical lagoon or coral reef, avoid touching or stepping on corals.
column3: Troopilise laguuni või korallrahu juures puhkusel olles väldi korallidele astumist või nende puudutamist.
column4: When diving, do not break off a branch of coral to take home as a souvenir. Coral reefs are precious and they are disappearing
column5: Sukeldudes ära murra korallioksa, et seda suveniirina koju viia. Väärtuslikud korallrahud on hävimas.

column2: Create a small ecosystem
column3: Loo väike ökosüsteem
column4: in your garden or park by piling up some logs in a secluded corner. These will provide shelter for hedgehogs, frogs and toads. If you half-bury the bottom logs in the soil, you will also encourage stag beetles as they are fond of rotten wood. A pile of stones will also provide shelter to a range of insects and spiders.
column5: oma aeda või parki, ladudes palkidest kuhja mõnda varjulisse nurka. Seal saavad varju leida siilid, konnad ja kärnkonnad. Kui sa alumised palgid osaliselt maapinda matad, võid luua soodsa elupaiga põderpõrnikatele, sest neile meeldib mädanenud puit. Kivihunnik võib olla varjupaigaks paljudele putukatele ja ämblikele.

column2: Did you know?
column3: Kas teadsid?
column4: Certain non-recyclable paper products (such as tissues, napkins, and egg cartons) can be added to your compost. Their fibres will aerate the compost and help the organisms that encourage decomposition.
column5: Kompostile võib lisada teatud mittesorteeritavaid paberitooteid (näiteks pabertaskurätikud, salvrätikud ja munakarbid). Nende kiud õhutavad komposti ja ergutavad kõdunemist soodustavate mikroorganismide tegevust.

column2: Choose your pet carefully and think before buying an exotic animal
column3: Vali lemmiklooma hoolikalt ja mõtle enne kaks korda, kui eksootilise looma ostad.
column4: Reptiles, birds and fish are often taken from their natural habitats. The black market for exotic pets has devastated entire populations of species, and it is still the fastest growing sector in the pet market.
column5: Sageli tuuakse roomajad, linnud ja kalad nende looduslikest elupaikadest ära. Ebaseaduslik eksootiliste lemmikloomade turg on laastanud terveid liikide populatsioone ja see on ikka veel lemmikloomaturu kõige kiiremini kasvav sektor.

column2: If you're up for an unusual holiday, why not volunteer for nature conservation?
column3: Kui soovid ebatavalist puhkust, siis miks mitte töötada vabatahtlikuna looduskaitse heaks?
column4: Many travel companies offer such trips. It will give you the opportunity to work with passionate people and to do something positive in support of an environmental cause.
column5: Selliseid reise pakuvad paljud reisifirmad. See annab sulle võimaluse töötada koos oma tegevusele pühendunud inimestega ja teha midagi positiivset keskkonna heaks.

column2: Grow your own vegetable garden or just a few in window boxes.
column3: Raja endale köögiviljaaed või kasvata natuke köögivilju aknakastis.
column4: You'll enjoy tasty and fresh vegetables free of pesticides.
column5: Nii saad nautida pestitsiidivabu maitsvaid ja värskeid köögivilju.

column2: Help to clean up your surroundings.
column3: Aita oma ümbruskonda puhas hoida.
column4: Each year on World Environment Day, schools and environmental organisations worldwide organise clean up operations. Join one! In addition to enriching the landscape of your neighbourhood, you will learn more about the animals and plants that live nearby.
column5: Igal aastal korraldavad koolid ja keskkonnakaitseorganisatsioonid ülemaailmsel keskkonnapäeval koristustöid. Ühine nendega! Lisaks oma ümbruskonna maastiku korrastamisele saad rohkem teada lähikonnas elavate loomade ja taimede kohta.

column2: Looking to add new plants to your garden?
column3: Otsid oma aeda uusi taimi?
column4: Be careful when buying for your garden. People are one of the main introducers of invasive species, especially flora. Many of the invasive species have been introduced for ornamental purposes. Do put an extra effort in finding out whether the plant you want is native to your environment.
column5: Ole aeda taimi ostes ettevaatlik. Inimene on peamine võõrliikide, eriti floora, sissetooja. Paljud võõrliigid on sisse toodud dekoratiivtaimedena. Uuri välja, kas taim, mida sa soovid, kasvab sinu kodukohas.

column2: Buy locally-produced fresh produce
column3: Osta kohalikku värsket toodangut
column4: either directly from the farmer or at a local fruit and vegetable market. Seasonal food is good for you and the environment. Cutting the number of kilometres your food has travelled and avoiding packaging reduces pollution and waste.
column5: kas otse talunikelt või kohalikult puu- ja köögiviljaturult. Hooajaline toit on nii sulle kui ka keskkonnale kasulik. Toidu teekonna kilomeetrite vähendamine ja pakendamise vältimine vähendab saastet ja jäätmeid.

column2: Where possible, switch to organic food!
column3: Kus võimalik, hakka tarbima mahetoitu!
column4: Organic food production uses no synthetic pesticides, produces slightly less greenhouse gases and usually leaves more room for biodiversity in agricultural areas.
column5: Mahekasvatatud toidu tootmisel ei kasutata sünteetilisi pestitsiide, tekitatakse natuke vähem kasvuhoonegaase ja jäetakse tavaliselt rohkem ruumi põllumajanduspiirkondade bioloogilisele mitmekesisusele.

column2: Eat meat in moderation!
column3: Söö liha mõõdukalt!
column4: If you're a meat eater, consider reducing your meat consumption and going for quality rather than quantity. Production of meat consumes enormous amounts of energy, not only for the growth and transport of animal feed, but also for the heating, air conditioning, and lighting of the immense animal farms. Changing to a diet with less meat helps the environment, but is also good for your health. It is best to buy meat from local producers and buy organic too.
column5: Kui sööd liha, kaalu lihatarbimise vähendamist ja püüa eelistada kvantiteedile kvaliteeti. Liha tootmiseks on vaja tohutult energiat, mitte ainult loomasööda kasvatamiseks ja transportimiseks, vaid ka suurte loomafarmide kütmiseks, jahutamiseks ja valgustamiseks. Lihasöömise vähendamine on kasulik nii keskkonnale kui ka tervisele. Kõige parem on osta liha kohalikelt tootjatelt ja mahekasvatajatelt.

column2: Disposable napkins are often given out for free but this is no reason to waste them.
column3: Ühekordseid salvrätikuid jagatakse sageli tasuta, aga see ei tähenda, et neid peab raiskama.
column4: Instead of taking a handful, one or two should be more than enough. Be reasonable and trees will thank you for it!
column5: Terve pihutäie võtmise asemel peaks piisama ühest või kahest. Ole mõistlik ja puud on sulle tänulikud!

column2: Eat fruit and vegetables that are in season.
column3: Söö hooajalisi puu- ja köögivilju.
column4: They taste better, are healthier for you, and their cultivation has less impact on the environment.
column5: Need on parema maitsega, tervislikumad ja nende kasvatamine mõjutab keskkonda vähem.

column2: Consider your dairy consumption.
column3: Mõtle, kui palju sa piimatooteid tarbid.
column4: The production of butter, cheese and other dairy products with high fat content accounts for high greenhouse gas emissions as well as for eutrophication of groundwater, rivers and seas. Remember: Globally, around 70 % of all agricultural land is used for livestock production.
column5: Või, juustu ja muude kõrge rasvasisaldusega piimatoodete tootmine põhjustab ulatuslikku kasvuhoonegaaside õhkupaiskumist ning samuti põhjavee, jõgede ja merede eutrofeerumist. Pea meeles: 70 % põllumajandusmaast kogu maailmas kasutatakse loomakasvatuseks.

column2: Invest in a lunch box.
column3: Investeeri toidukarpi.
column4: If needed use cling film and paper instead of aluminium foil when you prepare your lunch. Reducing the amount of materials you use will reduce the amount of rubbish you throw away and this is good news for the environment!
column5: Kui vaja, eelista toidu pakkimisel fooliumile toidukilet ja paberit. Mida vähem materjale sa kasutad, seda vähem prügi viskad ära ja see on keskkonnale hea!

column2: Don't start a washing machine unless it is fully loaded with laundry or dishes.
column3: Ära pane pesumasinat enne tööle, kui see on pesu või nõusid täiesti täis.
column4: Its energy and water consumption will be the same whether it's full or empty so you might as well optimise its cycle.
column5: Tühjana kasutab masin sama palju vett ja energiat kui täidetuna, nii et võiksid kasutada tsüklit kõige optimaalsemal viisil.

column2: Let your hot food cool down before putting it in the refrigerator
column3: Lase toidul enne külmkappi panemist jahtuda
column4: and defrost food from the freezer in the fridge. Both will save you money on your energy bill. Also, remember to keep the fridge door open for only as long as you need it.
column5: ja sulata sügavkülmikust võetud toit külmkapis. Mõlemad aitavad sul elektriarvetele vähem raha kulutada. Ja katsu meeles pidada, et hoiad külmkapi ust lahti ainult nii kaua kui vaja.

column2: Take a shower rather than a bath!
column3: Käi duši all, mitte vannis!
column4: This way you can cut your water consumption by a third! Pause the water flow when soaping and avoid long showers. A shower uses about 30 to 80 litres, while a bath uses 150 to 200 litres of precious water. Install low-flow shower heads and think before buying a power shower.
column5: Nii vähendad oma veetarbimist kolmandiku võrra. Enda seebitamise ajaks keera kraan kinni, samuti püüa vältida pikalt duši all olemist. Kui duši all käies kulub umbes 30- 80 liitrit, siis vannis käies kulub 150-200 liitrit kallist vett. Paigalda nõrgema veevooluga dušiotsikud ja mõtle järele, enne kui surveduši ostad.

column2: Got lime scale to remove?
column3: Pead katlakivi eemaldama?
column4: Instead of chemical products, try using vinegar to remove lime scale from tiles, taps, kettles and irons.
column5: Katlakivi eemaldamiseks keraamilistelt plaatidelt, kraanidelt, veekeedunõust ja triikrauast kasuta keemiatoodete asemel äädikat.

column2: Buy eco-friendly dishwashing detergent.
column3: Osta keskkonnasõbralikku nõudepesuvahendit.
column4: It is largely biodegradable, less polluting to aquatic habitats and just as effective a cleaning agent as less environmentally friendly options. Look for eco-friendly dishwashing detergents, such as those labelled with the European flower eco-label (see www.eco-label.com to find one in your country).
column5: See on suuremas osas bioloogiliselt lagunev, saastab veelisi elukeskkondi vähem ja puhastab sama tõhusalt kui vähem keskkonnasõbralikud vahendid.
